0 001 608124001900 2005-07-20 7/20/05: Begin move from EW 393 to WR 29 @ 1100 hrs.\r\n\r\n7/21/05: Continue moving rig to WR 29.\r\n\r\n7/22/05: Arrive on location @ WR 29 @ 0830 hrs. Run 36¿ conductor csg to 180¿ and monitor current. Pull 36¿ to surface due to high current. ROV confirm location. Set wellhead beacon & 5 compacts.\r\n\r\n7/23/05: ROV took clear bottom survey & run current profile. Begin moving off location to drift in for jetting 36¿. Current too high for running 36¿. Move back onto location and run further current profiles w/ ROV.\r\n\r\n
1 001 608124001900 2005-07-24 7/24/05: Continue current meter profiles with ROV; begin moving rig 33 miles southeast from Walker Ridge 29.\r\n\r\n7/25/05: Move rig 30 miles southeast of Walker Ridge 29; Run 36" conductor casing & 26" BHA; TIH with 36¿ Conductor Casing on landing string to 676¿ while moving rig in direction of the well center.\r\n\r\n7/26/05: Continue RIH with 36" Conductor Casing to 5094' on landing string while moving rig to Walker Ridge 29; position rig over well center; spud & begin jetting in 36".\r\n\r\n7/27/05: Jet 36" Conductor Casing to 5673'; let 36" soak; release from CADA Tool and drill 26" Hole Section from 5673' to 6337'.\r\n\r\n7/28/05: Drill 26" Hole Section from 6337' to 8150'. C&CM; pump Hi-Vis Gel sweep followed by 12.5 PPG pad mud.\r\n\r\n7/29/05: Short trip f/ 8150' to 5673; TIH to 8150'. CCM & spot 16.0 PPG DKD mud at 8150¿; pooh; wash wellhead; pooh & L/D BHA.\r\n\r\n7/30/05: Move rig 15 miles South of location; run 22" Casing while drifting the rig back to Walker Ridge 29.\r\n
2 001 608124001900 2005-07-31 7/31/05: TIH with 22" casing on landing string to 7;975'; land out in HPH. Perform cement job; lock HPH to LPH.\r\n\r\n8/01/05: POOH with inner string; identify fish left in hole; TIH with drill pipe open ended; wash 10' of cement; POOH; RIH with bladed mill assembly.\r\n\r\n8/02/05: Continue RIH with bladed mill assembly. Drill cement from 7;974¿ to 8;030¿. Tag fish. Mill fish from 8;030¿ to 8;032¿. Circ B/U. POOH & L/D bladed mill. P/U Piranha mill.\r\n\r\n8/03/05: RIH with Piranha mill to 7;997¿. Wash from 7;997¿ to 8;032¿. Mill from 8;032¿ to 8;034¿. Circ B/U. POOH.\r\n\r\n8/04/05: Continue POOH. L/D Piranha mill. P/U Metal Muncher mill & RIH to 8;032¿. Mill on fish at 8;032¿.\r\n\r\n8/05/05: Continue to mill on fish from 8;032¿ to 8;035¿. Displace well to 10.5 ppg WBM. Test bottom plug at 8;035¿ with 15K String weight. POOH to 5;653¿. Displace with seawater. Spot surface plug from 5;653¿ to 5;453¿. POOH & L/D Metal Muncher Assembly. PBTD 5;453¿.\r\n

12 001a 608124000602 2007-10-10 10/10/07: Accepted rig at 0630 hours. Rig under tow from MC 961 to WR 30.\r\n\r\n10/11/07 - 10/13/07: Rig under tow from MC 961 to WR 30. Performing rig maintanence and DC inspections; stump testing BOP's.
13 001a 608124000603 2007-10-10 10/10/07: Accepted rig at 0630 hours. Rig under tow from MC 961 to WR 30.\r\n\r\n10/11/07 - 10/13/07: Rig under tow from MC 961 to WR 30. Performing rig maintanence and DC inspections; stump testing BOP's.
14 001a 608124000603 2007-10-14 10/14/07: Finished towing from MC 961 to WR 30. Arrived location and began running anchors.\r\n\r\n10/15/07: Ran 6 anchors. Located well with ROV. Retrieved corrosion cap. Pre-tensioned anchors and prepared to start running BOP stack.\r\n\r\n10/16/07: Continued running anchors. R/U to run riser. Replaced communications module in blue pod on BOP stack. Began running riser.\r\n\r\n10/17/07: Continue running riser. Unable to offload remaining riser on workboats due to rough seas. Took on small equipment and supplies while waiting on weather.\r\n\r\n10/18/07: Waiting on weather. Took on small equipment and supplies and 1700 bbls WBM.\r\n\r\n10/19/07: Waited on weather. Offloaded riser and resumed running.\r\n\r\n10/20/07: Finished running riser. Landed stack on wellhead and tested connector. Discovered leak in rigid conduit line on LMRP. Unlatched stack and prepared to pull riser.
15 001a 608124000603 2007-10-21 10/21/07: Latched BOP stack and tested connector. Discovered leak in rigid conduit co-flex line on LRMP with ROV. Unlatched and pulled riser and BOP stack for repairs.\r\n\r\n10/22/07: Finished pulling riser. Replaced and tested rigid conduit co-flex line on LMRP. Started re-running riser.\r\n\r\n10/23/07: Started BOP in water. Tested choke & kill lines and rigid conduit. Began running riser.\r\n\r\n10/24/07: Continue running riser. Wait on weather. Winds to 52kts.; seas 12-16'.\r\n\r\n\r\n10/25/07: Wait on weather. Tested choke & kill lines. Contintued running riser.\r\n\r\n10/26/07: Flushed through and tested rigid conduit line. Landed BOP and latched same. Test BOP connector. R/D riser running equipment. TIH with 5-1/2" drillpipe and wearbushing to 4;973'.\r\n\r\n10/27/07: TIH with 5-1/2" test assembly. Tested BOP's. TOOH. P/U 6-5/8" test joint. TIH P/U 5-1/2" DP.\r\n\r\n
16 001a 608124000603 2007-10-28 Ongoing MWD/LWD and/or Mudlog Operations 10/28/07: Tested BOP's. No test on middle rams. POOH with test assembly. Installed new seal in test plug. \r\n\r\n10/29/07: TIH with test assembly. Tested BOP's. POOH. P/U 12-1/4" BHA. TIH and displace hole with WBM. \r\n\r\n10/30/07: Drilled cement plug. C&C WBM. \r\n\r\n10/31/07: TIH. Wash and ream to top of cement plug. CBU. R/U Schlumberger.\r\n\r\n11/01/07: RIH w/ Schlumberger USIT and Casing Caliper. R/D Equipment. P/U BHA. Tested casing with 12.5 ppg mud to 250 low / 4125 high. TIH w/ 5-1/2" DP.\r\n\r\n11/02/07: TIH with 12-1/4" directional drlg assembly. Drilled cement. CBU.\r\n\r\n11/03/07: Clean mud pit system. TIH. Diplaced well with 12.3 ppg SBM. Drilled to 16;302'.

Attempted to set KO plug. \r\n\r\n11/6/07: TIH. Perform balanced plug cement job. TOC 15;844'; bottom at 16;410'. CBU. L/D cementing assembly. POOH. L/D cement stinger.\r\n\r\n11/7/07: TIH. Drilled ahead to 17;320'. \r\n\r\n11/9/07: Drilled 13-1/2" hole to 17;581'.\r\n\r\n11/10/07: Drilled to 19;760'. Flow checked well. CBU.

P/U production assembly and begin TIH to 91'.\r\n\r\nNotes:\r\nAt 08:07 hours on 10/29/2018; Thomas Ahlf (Chevron) sent email notification to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) advising that the CAD unit CPU experienced a card failure that rendered the primary & secondary BOP control stations inoperable. L/D TCP control head and slip and cut drill line while monitoring well for losses - well static. Un-set 7" posi-test packer and TIH from 21;823' to 22;179'. P/U and M/U TCP control head. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 63 bbls.\r\n\r\n04/23/2019: Make up TCP control head assembly; tag sump packer with 20k down (no fill); rig up and reverse 10.6 ppg brine while monitoring for losses - well losing at 6 bph during reverse circulation; well losing at max 0.5 bph when shut down. Perform 30 bbl injection test at 2;000 psi surface pressure. Surface pressure bleeding off slowly to formation. Open well and monitor on trip tank; well static. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 50 bbls.\r\n\r\n04/24/2019: Rigged down TCP firing head; pulled bit above perfs and monitor well on trip tank while transfer 10.6 ppg to supply vessel and take on 3;463 bbls of 11.2 ppg CaCl2 brine while filtering same. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 7 bbls.\r\n\r\nNote: Rory Chalmers sent an email notification to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 04/24/2019 at 09:22 hrs. that the plan is to raise the brine weight in the well from 10.6 ppg to 11.2 ppg prior to pulling out of the well with TCP assy. and displacing back to 10.5 ppg once the frac tools have been pulled above the FS-2L valve and the formation isolated.\r\n\r\n04/25/2019: Rig up and displace well with 11.2 ppg brine; snap in and out of sump packer (no fill); TOH above perfs. Monitor well - average 1 bph loss rate. TOH to 20;120'. Function test annular and VBRs from Primary and Secondary stations. Continue TOH to 17;183'. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 121 bbls.\r\n\r\n04/26/2019: TOH lay out TCP assembly (all shots fired); make up perf collet locater and begin TIH with same. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 13.2 bbls.\r\n\r\n04/27/2019: TIH with perf collet; tag sump packer 22;190' with 20k-lb down; rig up reverse out assembly; snap out with 16k-lb and reverse 11.2 ppg brine to spec.\r\nFluid loss past 24 hours: 22.1 bbls.\r\n
205 A004 608124006001 2019-04-28 04/28/2019: Snap in and out of sump packer at 22;190'; no fill observed. Rigged down reverse out assembly and POOH to surface with perf collet locator. Slip and cut drill line. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 55.3 bbls.\r\n\r\n04/29/2019: Rig up tubing tongs and handling tools for frac assembly. Pick up frac assembly and RIH with same to 2;563'. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 17.7 bbls.\r\n\r\n04/30/2019: Continue TIH with frac assembly to sump packer at 22;190'; change out bails and elevators; snap in and out of sump packer with no fill or issues stinging into packer. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 11 bbls.\r\n\r\n05/01/2019: Set down 20k-lb on sump packer; drop packer setting ball; rig up service lines and set VBA packer at 21;818' MD/ 21;602' TVD. Test packer to 1;500 psi; reverse out setting ball; perform pickle treatment flush and test treating lines from frac vessel to 12;000 psi. Obtain circulating rates with cement unit and spot 8 bbl acid in treating lines. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 76 bbls.\r\n\r\n05/02/2019: Bullhead acid into perfs. Performed mini-frac; performed step rate test and reversed out mini frac fluid. Performed main frac and reversed out proppant; reverse out 3x DP volumes. R/D frac iron and P/U service tool to dump seals and close FS2/MCS while logging pack with Protechnics logging tools. Losses stopped once above FS valve. Pressure test FS2/MCS TO 1;000 psi for 5 minutes. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 527 bbls.\r\n\r\nNote: At 14:05 hrs on 05/02/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) for a 3 day or as soon as possible extension to BOP testing; BOP and BSR function testing as requested. \r\n\r\n05/03/2019: Prepare surface volumes and perform displacement to 10.6 ppg CaCl2 brine. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 0 bbls.\r\n\r\n05/04/2019: TOH to surface and L/D GP BHA. No abnormalities or proppant observed on any GP tools/washpipe. Retrieved surface bore protector and set BOP test plug while testing choke manifold offline while monitoring well on trip tank; well static. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 0 bbls.\r\n
206 A004 608124006001 2019-05-05 05/05/2019: Rig up and test VBRs; annular preventer and BSRs with 10.6 ppg CaCl2 from Primary station to 250-350 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. Function test VBRs; annular and BSRs from Primary and Decondary stations. Retrieve BOP test tool and set bore protector. R/U Weatherford and Halliburton isolation assembly handling equipment.\r\n\r\n05/06/2019: TIH picking up isolation assembly from surface to 1;670'. Rig down tubing handling equipment and continue TIH with isolation assembly on 5-7/8" drill pipe to 17;497'.\r\n\r\n05/07/2019: Continue TIH to place isolation assembly VCH packer at 20;196' MD/ 20;014' TVD. Set and test VCH packer to 4;300 psi. TOH from 20;196' to 4;072'.\r\n\r\n05/08/2019: TOH to surface. Pressure test casing against FS valve and BSRs to 4;300 psi. Pull bore protector on 4th attempt; observed scoring on bore protector OD. Jet tree/ surface wellhead. Set BOP test plug and test VBRs and annular with 10.6 ppg CaCl2 from Secondary station to 250-350 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. Function test VBRs; annular and BSRs from Primary and sDecondary stations. Jet surface wellhead; recovering metal fines. Decision to run bore-scope to observe tubing hanger seal profile. \r\n\r\n05/09/2019: Inspect wellhead with bore-scope camera - no scoring observed on tubing hanger seal profile; however footage inconclusive. R/U control line sheaves in preparation to run upper completion.\r\n\r\n05/10/2019: R/U tubing handling equipment; P/U and rack back 34 stands of 5.5" 23# tubing in derrick.\r\n\r\n05/11/2019: Finish P/U and rack back a total of 64 stands of 5.5" 23# tubing in derrick. P/U dummy tubing hanger to perform land out and pressure test on tubing hanger sealing profile after scoring observed on bore protector (5/08/2019).\r\n
207 A004 608124006001 2019-05-12 05/12/2019: Pressure test on dummy tubing hanger (TH) failed. Pull TH and inspect TH for any anomalies. Seal area had signs of damage. RIH and set bore protector. P/U 10-3/4" RTTS and TIH with same.\r\n\r\nNote: At 09:42 hrs on 05/12/2019; Chris Fontenot (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) to proceed to temporarily suspend the well as per the submitted plan and to change out the surface tree.\r\n\r\n05/13/2019: TIH to packer depth of 5;710'. Perform negative test on FS-2 valve. Perform RTTS positive test to 1;000 psi. Reverse out 6.5 ppg base oil. Perform positive test below RTTS to 700 psi against FS-2 valve (inflow test pressure). \r\n\r\n05/14/2019: Perform inflow test on RTTS storm valve. R/D test assembly; TOH and L/D RTTS running tool. N/D BOPs.\r\n\r\nNote: On 05/14/2019 at 10:40 hrs; Pat Campbell (Chevron) sent an email notification to BSEE Houma District of the upcoming M-400 72-hour initial latch up pressure testing of the BOP after the Horizontal Tree change out.\r\n\r\n05/15/2019: Prepare rig floor for BOP removal. Lift BOPs and stage at south side of drilling module. N/D spool joint. P/U horizontal surface tree (HST) and stage to pipe deck.\r\n\r\nNote: At 16:04 hrs on 05/15/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) sent an email notification to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that per the communications on 5/12/19 regarding the tree change out; the well has been successfully suspended and the BOP is currently being removed to perform a tree change out. Given these activities; the BOP will not be function tested today (per schedule). The BOP will be function and pressure tested once nippled back up to the well.\r\n\r\n05/16/2019: Stage backup HST to well bay and N/U same. N/U BOP spool joint. N/U 18 3/4" BOPs.\r\n\r\nNote: On 05/16/2019 at 15:00 hrs; Pat Campbell (Chevron) sent an email notification update to Josh Ladner (BSEE) regarding the timing of the M-400 BOP re-installation initial pressure testing after the Horizontal Tree change out.\r\n\r\nNote: On 05/16/2019 at 15:51 hrs; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) sent an email to William Sanders (BSEE) for review concerning Chevrons intended BOP equipment test program/ rationale plan following the horizontal tree change out on the well. \r\n\r\n05/17/2019: Finish N/U BOPs. Jet BOPs. P/U BOP test tool.\r\n\r\nNote: On 05/17/2019 at 08:35 hrs; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from William Sanders (BSEE) that the BOP test plans sent to BSEE on 05/16/2019 are acceptable as this is not an initial test and the components removed to perform the change out are being tested to the RWP of the wellhead.\r\n\r\n05/18/2019: Test HST/VBRs to 250-350 psi low and 10;000 psi high for 30 minutes. Test VBRs and annular preventer to 250-350 psi low and 6;500 psi high from Primary station. Function test Annular; UVBR; LVBR; UBSR; LBSR from Primary and Secondary stations. Perform Accumulator drawdown test. Pull BOP test assembly and L/D same. Tests witnessed by BSEE Inspectors.\r\n
208 A004 608124006001 2019-05-19 05/19/2019: R/D BOP test tools; M/U TDS and flush choke and kill lines. Jet BOPs and HST. TOH and L/D Clean Well assembly. Set bore protector. Check torque on BOP flange bolts and RBC. RIH with RTTS retrieval tool. Latch RTTS. Pump 50 bbls Hi-vis sweep (86 vis) and circulate out at 8 bpm.\r\n\r\n05/20/2019: TOH and L/D RTTS. TOH with 5-7/8" tailpipe. Pull bore protector and jet HST profile. R/U to run upper completion.\r\n\r\n05/21/2019: R/U tubing handling equipment. M/U mule shoe; CIM; and install control line. P/U ported sub and DHPTG. RIH with same on 3-1/2" tubing to 2;717'.\r\n\r\n05/22/2019: RIH to 3;716'. Stage MLE spooler to rig floor. P/U and install lower; middle and upper motor assemblies; vacuum filling each assembly at rotary.\r\n\r\n05/23/2019: Finish vacuum filling and installing upper motor assembly on lower ESP. Install tandem seal assembly with pothead and pumps on lower ESP. P/U lower bypass tubing and lower motor for upper ESP.\r\n\r\n05/24/2019: Install and test WellLift HP gauge line. Install upper ESP assembly. P/U packer and measure MLE cables for packer penetrators.\r\n\r\n05/25/2019: Feed MLE cables through adjustable adapters. Make up packer penetrators and test same. R/U and splice TEC and CI lines and test same. R/D Weatherford tripmaster and RIH with one stand 5 1/2" from derrick.\r\n
209 A004 608124006001 2019-05-26 05/26/2019: TIH with ESP assembly on 5-1/2" tubing from derrick; installing clamps as needed to 8;332'.\r\n\r\n05/27/2019: Running in hole with ESP assembly on 5-1/2" tubing to 12;144'; pick up timed pup and Schlumberger SCSSV.\r\n\r\n05/28/2019: Function test SCSSV through A and B ports; test same to 8;500 psi for 15 minutes. Install CI line with FMJ connections and test to 10;000 psi. Continue RIH; picking up tubing from 12;190' to 15;409'.\r\n\r\n05/29/2019: Continue RIH; picking up tubing from 15;409' to 20;210'.\r\n\r\n05/30/2019: Rigged down Weatherford Vario elevators and rigged up 6-5/8" handling equipment; pick up tubing hanger and sting into isolation packer. Installed RMS MLE splices and tested same; made up MLE penetrators to hanger.\r\n\r\n05/31/2019: Installed MLE and SCSSV penetrators/ control lines in tubing hanger and tested same. RIH and land out hanger in wellhead. Lock tubing hanger in wellhead and perform 50k-lb overpull test to confirm latch.\r\n\r\n06/01/2019: Rig up slickline BOP and lubricator with isolation retrieval tool in same; test lubricator to 7;000 psi for 15 minutes. Pressure test hanger seals and install ESP flanged outlets on wellhead.\r\n\r\n
210 A004 608124006001 2019-06-02 06/02/2019: Complete electrical checks on ESP penetrators; pressure test to 7;500 psi; install surface caps on same. Bleed down SCSSV ports A and B to zero; make up penetrator adapters and test to 7;500 psi. Install CI penetrators and pressure test to 7;500 psi. Reverse circulate 850 bbls inhibited packer fluid into tubing x casing annulus.\r\n\r\n06/03/2019: Set bore protector on slickline. Run in hole with 3.25" gauge ring to 16;086'; pull out of hole with gauge ring and RIH with 3.125" RPT plug. Set RPT plug in landing profile at 16;086'. POOH and test tubing against RPT plug to 1;000 psi. Close SCSSV; maintaining 1;000 psi; and perform inflow test on same. Equalize pressure across SCSSV and open same. Pressure up down tubing; against RPT plug to set packer with 5;500 psi. RIH and pull RPT plug to surface. Pull bore protector and set temporary crown plug.\r\n\r\n06/04/2019: Install and test night cap to 7;000 psi. Test temporary crown plug to 6;500 psi. R/D slickline and pull TH running tool. R/D upper completion equipment from rig floor.\r\n\r\n06/05/2019: N/D flow line; bell nipple; slip joint; knife gate valve. Bleed accumulator to 0 psi. Remove BOP control lines. N/D BOPs and spool joint.\r\n\r\n06/06/2019: Install upper work platform. Disconnect SCSSV control lines and install 1/4" speed-bite plugs. Pressure test A&B SCSSV lines to 8;500 psi. Install TEC line through wellhead outlet. Perform pressure test to 10;000 psi on TEC lines. Install threaded TH lower lock ring. Install TH neck seal; upper lock ring and DX 1 gasket. Pressure test neck seal and gate valve to 10;000 psi. N/U lubricator assembly to HST. M/U 3.0" GS running tool and slickline lubricator.\r\n\r\n06/07/2019: Test lubricator to 7;000 psi. Retrieve temporary crown plug. Test lubricator quick test sub to 7;000 psi. Open SCSSV and cycle open FS-2 valve. Bullhead 342 bbls base oil. Close and perform successful inflow test on SCSSV. Set crown plug on slickline and test same to 6;500 psi. Close and test crown valve to 6;500 psi. R/D slickline/lubricator and equipment. Install cap flange on crown valve. Install tree flange on AAV. Handover A4 well to Operations.\r\n\r\n06/08/2019: R/D surface lines from cement manifold to AAV. Perform Derrick inspection. R/U fox holes. Prepare and function test VDM for pipe lay down. Lay down 5-7/8" DP out of derrick.\r\n\r\nNote: On 06/08/2019 at 12:01 hours; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) to perform drill pipe lay down operations using the PRS; VDM; fox holes; while flowing the A4 well.\r\n

well_activity_remarks_dict.TEXT_REMARK:
7/20/05:  Begin move from EW 393 to WR 29 @ 1100 hrs.

7/21/05:  Continue moving rig to WR 29.

7/22/05:  Arrive on location @ WR 29 @ 0830 hrs.  Run 36¿ conductor csg to 180¿ and monitor current.  Pull 36¿ to surface due to high current.  ROV confirm location.  Set wellhead beacon & 5 compacts.

7/23/05:  ROV took clear bottom survey & run current profile.  Begin moving off location to drift in for jetting 36¿.  Current too high for running 36¿.  Move back onto location and run further current profiles w/ ROV.

7/24/05:  Continue current meter profiles with ROV; begin moving rig 33 miles southeast from Walker Ridge 29.

7/25/05:  Move rig 30 miles southeast of Walker Ridge 29; Run 36" conductor casing & 26" BHA; TIH with 36¿ Conductor Casing on landing string to 676¿ while moving rig in direction of the well center.

7/26/05:  Continue RIH with 36" Conductor Casing to 5094' on landing string while moving rig to Walker Ridge 29; position rig over well center; spud & begin jetting in 36".

7/27/05:  Jet 36" Conductor Casing to 5673'; let 36" soak; release from CADA Tool and drill 26" Hole Section from 5673' to 6337'.

7/28/05:  Drill 26" Hole Section from 6337' to 8150'.  C&CM; pump Hi-Vis Gel sweep followed by 12.5 PPG pad mud.

7/29/05:  Short trip f/ 8150' to 5673; TIH to 8150'.  CCM & spot 16.0 PPG DKD mud at 8150¿; pooh; wash wellhead; pooh & L/D BHA.

7/30/05:  Move rig 15 miles South of location; run 22" Casing while drifting the rig back to Walker Ridge 29.

7/31/05:  TIH with 22" casing on landing string to 7;975'; land out in HPH.  Perform cement job; lock HPH to LPH.

8/01/05:  POOH with inner string; identify fish left in hole; TIH with drill pipe open ended; wash 10' of cement; POOH; RIH with bladed mill assembly.

8/02/05:  Continue RIH with bladed mill assembly. Drill cement from 7;974¿ to 8;030¿. Tag fish. Mill fish from 8;030¿ to 8;032¿. Circ B/U. POOH & L/D bladed mill. P/U Piranha mill.

8/03/05:  RIH with Piranha mill to 7;997¿. Wash from 7;997¿ to 8;032¿. Mill from 8;032¿ to 8;034¿. Circ B/U. POOH.

8/04/05:  Continue POOH. L/D Piranha mill. P/U Metal Muncher mill & RIH to 8;032¿. Mill on fish at 8;032¿.

8/05/05:  Continue to mill on fish from 8;032¿ to 8;035¿. Displace well to 10.5 ppg WBM. Test bottom plug at 8;035¿ with 15K String weight. POOH to 5;653¿. Displace with seawater. Spot surface plug from 5;653¿ to 5;453¿. POOH & L/D Metal Muncher Assembly. PBTD 5;453¿.
RIG ON LOCATION. CHECK BULLEYE BEFORE JETTING IN. RELEASE RUNNING TOOL.
DRILL TO 12710'.
DRILL TO 16080'.
DRILL TO 19975'.
DRILL TO 22883'.
DRILL TO 24074'.
DRILL TO 23712'.
DRILL TO 28043'.
RELEASED RIG.

10/10/07:  Accepted rig at 0630 hours.  Rig under tow from MC 961 to WR 30.

10/11/07 - 10/13/07:  Rig under tow from MC 961 to WR 30.  Performing rig maintanence and DC inspections; stump testing BOP's.

10/10/07:  Accepted rig at 0630 hours.  Rig under tow from MC 961 to WR 30.

10/11/07 - 10/13/07:  Rig under tow from MC 961 to WR 30.  Performing rig maintanence and DC inspections; stump testing BOP's.

10/14/07:  Finished towing from MC 961 to WR 30. Arrived location and began running anchors.

10/15/07:  Ran 6 anchors.  Located well with ROV.  Retrieved corrosion cap.  Pre-tensioned anchors and prepared to start running BOP stack.

10/16/07:  Continued running anchors.  R/U to run riser.  Replaced communications module in blue pod on BOP stack.  Began running riser.

10/17/07:  Continue running riser.  Unable to offload remaining riser on workboats due to rough seas.  Took on small equipment and supplies while waiting on weather.

10/18/07:  Waiting on weather.  Took on small equipment and supplies and 1700 bbls WBM.

10/19/07:  Waited on weather.  Offloaded riser and resumed running.

10/20/07:  Finished running riser.  Landed stack on wellhead and tested connector.  Discovered leak in rigid conduit line on LMRP.  Unlatched stack and prepared to pull riser.

10/21/07:  Latched BOP stack and tested connector.  Discovered leak in rigid conduit co-flex line on LRMP with ROV.  Unlatched and pulled riser and BOP stack for repairs.

10/22/07:  Finished pulling riser.  Replaced and tested rigid conduit co-flex line on LMRP.  Started re-running riser.

10/23/07:  Started BOP in water.  Tested choke & kill lines and rigid conduit.  Began running riser.

10/24/07:  Continue running riser.  Wait on weather.  Winds to 52kts.; seas 12-16'.


10/25/07:  Wait on weather.  Tested choke & kill lines.  Contintued running riser.

10/26/07:  Flushed through and tested rigid conduit line.  Landed BOP and latched same.  Test BOP connector.  R/D riser running equipment.  TIH with 5-1/2" drillpipe and wearbushing to 4;973'.

10/27/07:  TIH with 5-1/2" test assembly.  Tested BOP's. TOOH.  P/U 6-5/8" test joint.  TIH P/U 5-1/2" DP.

Ongoing MWD/LWD and/or Mudlog Operations 10/28/07:  Tested BOP's.  No test on middle rams.  POOH with test assembly.  Installed new seal in test plug.  

10/29/07: TIH with test assembly.  Tested BOP's.  POOH.  P/U 12-1/4" BHA.  TIH and displace hole with WBM.  

10/30/07: Drilled cement plug.  C&C WBM.  

10/31/07:  TIH.  Wash and ream to top of cement plug.  CBU.  R/U Schlumberger.

11/01/07:  RIH w/ Schlumberger USIT and Casing Caliper.  R/D Equipment.  P/U BHA.  Tested casing with 12.5 ppg mud to 250 low / 4125 high.  TIH w/ 5-1/2" DP.

11/02/07:  TIH with 12-1/4" directional drlg assembly.  Drilled cement.  CBU.

11/03/07:  Clean mud pit system.  TIH.  Diplaced well with 12.3 ppg SBM.  Drilled to 16;302'.

11/04/07:  Drilled to 16;410'.  CBU.  Pumped slug.  POOH.  P/U 3-1/2" cement stinger.  TIH.

11/5/07:  TIH with cement stinger.  Function test BOP's.  Attempted to set KO plug.  

11/6/07:  TIH.  Perform balanced plug cement job.  TOC 15;844'; bottom at 16;410'.  CBU.  L/D cementing assembly.  POOH.  L/D cement stinger.

11/7/07:  TIH.  Drilled cement and sidetracked hole.  Drilled to 16;245'.

11/8/07:  Drilled and underreamed hole from 13-5/8" casing shoe at 16;012' to KOP at 16;100'.  Drilled ahead to 17;320'.  

11/9/07:  Drilled 13-1/2" hole to 17;581'.

11/10/07:  Drilled to 19;760'.  Flow checked well.  CBU.

No Wireline Logs Run 11/11/07:  Finished CBU.  Flow check well; static.  Drilled from 19760' to 20;417'.  Pumped sweep.  Circ hole clean.  Flow check well; static.  POOH to test BOPE.

11/12/07:  P/U BOPE test equipment.  TIH.  Tested BOP's.

11/13/07:  Finished BOP test.  POOH w/ test assembly.  P/U BHA.  TIH.

11/14/07:  Slip and cut drill line.  Finished TIH.  Drilled to 20;845'.  

11/15/07:  Drilled and surveyed with Geo Pilot assembly and MWD to 21;785'.  

11/16/07:  Drilled and surveyed with Geo Pilot assembly and MWD to 22;688'. 

11/17/07:  Drilled and surveyed with Geo Pilot assembly and MWD to 23;205'; pumping weighted sweeps as needed.

No Wireline Logs Run 11/18/07:  Drilled and surveyed to 24;185'.

11/19/07:  Drilled and surveyed to 25;075'.

11/20/07:  Drilled and surveyed to 25;645'.  Function tested BOP's.  CBU.

11/21/07:  CBU.  Back ream and POOH.

11/22/07:  POOH with Geo-Pilot assembly.  S&C drill line.  Change swivel package.  POOH and L/D BHA.  P/U 5-1/2" DP.

11/23/07:  TIH w/ 5-1/2" test assembly to wellhead.  Tested BOP's.  POOH.

11/24/07:  P/U 12-1/4" BHA and TIH.

11/25/07:  TIH.  Wash and ream.  Drilled ahead to 25;845'.

11/26/07:  Drilled to 26;382'.  Circulate hole clean.  Back ream out of hole.

11/27/07:  Tripped out of hole to run logs.

11/28/07:  Finished POOH.  R/U Schlumberger wireline.  RIH w/ GR; RT scanner; GPIT; DSI.  Could not get below 21;775'.  POOH and installed hole finder.  Unable to get below 21;775'.  Logged up to 20;400'.

11/29/07:  POOH with W/L tools.  P/U TLC tools and TIH with same to 20;000'.  

11/30/07:  TIH w/ Schlumberger TLC tools.  Attempted to pass tight spot at 21;747'.  Logged out of hole to 20;109'.  POOH.

12/1/07:  Finished POOH w/ TLC tools.  P/U and RIH w/ USIT tools.  Performed caliper log.  POOH.  Slipped and cut drill line.

12/02/07:  R/U Sperry Sun.  P/U BHA.  Troubleshoot communication problems w/ Sperry Sun MWD/LWD.

12/03/07:  Finish troubleshoot.  L/D Sperry equipment.  P/U BHA.  TIH.  Wash & ream from 21;870-22;743'.

12/04/07:  Washed and reamed to 25;794'.  Stuck pipe at 25;794'.  Attempt to work pipe free.

12/05/07:  Attempt to free stuck pipe while waiting on pipe recovery equipment.  M/U DC severing charge.  P/U Baker CCL; GR; 2-3/8" DC severing charge and RIH.

12/06/07:  RIH w/ CCL; GR; severing charge & wt bars.  Tag bit at 25;798' WLM.  Severed pipe.  Pumped P&A cement plug #1.  Initial SIDPP 3000 psi; decr. to 2800 psi in 5 min.  Monitor stable SIDPP at 2730 psi while waiting on cement.

12/07/07:  Continued waiting on cement.  Continued pipe recovery operations.  Made several attempts but unable to get wireline severing tools below 21;983' due to obstruction in DP at 22;169'.  L/D Baker severing tool.  P/U jars and 2.125" gauge ring and RIH w/ same to 22;169'.  Tagged obstruction in pipe.  POOH w/ Baker wireline.

12/08/07:  Finish POOH w/ 2.125" gauge ring and L/D same.  P/U and RIH w/ 1.750" gauge ring.  Tagged obstruction at 22;175' WLM.  POOH w/ Baker wireline.  L/D 1.750" gauge ring and jars.  P/U CCL; 2.375" severing charge and wt bars.  RIH w/ same to 22;092'.  Severed DP at 22;092' WLM.  POOH w/ Baker wireline.  L/D wireline tools and lubricator.  CBU at 22;092'. 04/04/2019: Completed testing annular and VBRs on 4" drill pipe to 250/ 6;500 psi from Primary control station. Function tested BOP from Primary and Secondary control stations. Pressure tested Upper and Lower BSRs to 250-300/ 6;500 psi from Secondary station. Functioned Upper and Lower BSRs from Primary and Secondary stations. Retrieved BOP test tool and install bore protector. R/U and RIH with GR/CCL and Dummy CIBP to 22;262'. POOH with E-Line.
 
04/05/2019: Make up and RIH with Halliburton cement bond log on Baker electric line and log from 21;550' to 20;600'. POOH and lay out logging tools; lay out pipe remaining and 4" and 6" drill collars from derrick. M/U CIBP on wireline. RIH and set same at 22;275'.

04/06/2019: POOH with wireline. Tested casing to 5;139 psi for 30 minutes; with 11.7 ppg SBM (11.9 ppg downhole). R/D wireline equipment. P/U polish mill asy. RIH picking up drill pipe to 5;240'.

04/07/2019: Continue TIH picking up drill pipe to 9;200' bit depth; 5;500' RTTS depth. Pump 187 bbls of 6.6 base oil to achieve an under balance of 2;088 psi; perform 30 min inflow test; good test. Reverse out base oil. TOH and L/D RTTS.

Note: At 11:44 hrs on 04/07/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) that Chevron may proceed as requested to displace SBM to completion brine; circulate and filter.
 
04/08/2019: Trip in hole with polish mill assembly. RIH picking up 5-7/8" DP to 15;195'.

04/09/2019: RIH picking up 5-7/8" DP from 15;195' to 20;499'. Take baseline parameters.

04/10/2019: Polished top of 7" liner. Pumped and circulated out Hi-vis sweep. TOH from 20;623' to 19;330'. Washed across tieback gap. TOH from 19;330' to 5;400'. Washed across SSWH. TOH from 5;400' to surface and L/D Halliburton clean well BHA. Functioned UBSRs and LBSRs from Primary and Secondary control stations. M/U 5-7/8" bit and Halliburton displacement assembly and TIH to 365'.

Note: At 14:57 hrs on 04/10/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) communicated the 7" liner CBL interpretation to Bobby Nelson (BSEE); confirming competent cement from the top of the liner (20;683' MD) down to 22;050' MD. The lower 450 ft of cement down to the 7" shoe at 22;500' MD shows to be contaminated cement with poor bonding characteristics (deepest log depth 22;293' MD).

04/11/2019: TIH from 365' to 1;858'. Function annular and VBRs from Primary and Secondary stations. TIH from 1;858' to 17;800' while picking up and installing Halliburton scraper/brush assemblies. TIH from 17;800' to 22;110'.

Note: At 22:06 hrs on 04/11/2019; Wayne Bridgeman (Chevron) received email from Bill Sanders (BSEE); stating "Based on the information provided; low probability for success for remedial cementing; and high chance of damaging the production target in attempting to place further cement; Chevron may proceed with displacement to brine."

04/12/2019: Record baseline parameters at 22;110'. Circulate and condition 11.7 ppg SBM. Build spacers and displace 11.7 ppg SBM with 10.5 ppg CaCl2. Clean mud tanks.

04/13/2019: Continue cleaning SBM from mud system.

04/14/2019: Continue cleaning M400 mud system. POOH to 19;436' to confirm clean-up tools clean and lay down same. TIH to 21;635' while continuing to clean mud lines and tanks.

04/15/2019: Finished cleaning lines. Jetted BOPs. TIH to 22;269'. Displace well to 10.5 ppg brine. TOH from 22;269' to 21;824'.

04/16/2019: TOH from 21;824' to surface L/D Halliburton Clean-Well BHA. Perform casing test to 6;500 psi with 10.5 ppg brine. R/U Baker E-line equipment on rig floor.

04/17/2019: Complete R/U Baker E-line. RIH and set CIBP at 22;270' MD/ 22;026' TVD. POOH and L/D DPU setting tool. RIH and set Halliburton sump packer at 22;190' MD/ 21;951' TVD. POOH with E-Line and R/D same. P/U Dril-quip retrieving tool and pull bore protector. RIH with 5 stands of 5-7/8" CTM 57 DP. M/U BOP test tool.

04/18/2019: Test VBRs and annular preventer on 4" DP from Secondary station to 250-300 psi low; 6;500 psi high. Function test BOP from Primary and Decondary stations. Circulate and flush BOP stack through choke & kill. Retrieve BOP test tool; set bore protector. Function UBSR and LBSR from Primary and Secondary stations. Build kill stands. 

04/19/2019: P/U 405 ft of TCP assembly. TIH with TCA on DP to 16;500'.

04/20/2019: TIH to 22;190'. Build TCP control head. Snap in and out of sump packer. Put guns on depth and test lines to 7;000 psi. Set TCP packer and verify guns on depth. Perforate well from 22;042' - 22;180' MD / 21;812' - 21;942' TVD. Circulate across TCP control head. Reverse 1.5 work string volumes. Flow check. Well u-tubing. Pump 20 bbl 11.2 ppg slug. TOH from 22;175 to 21;886'. M/U TCP control head; RIH to 22;002'.

Total losses to well since perforating: 8.5 bbls.

04/21/2019: M/U TCP head and set 7" posi-test packer at 21;714' (gauges @ 21;687'). Cycle IRDV TV and IRDV CV. Circulate across TCP control head (no loss rate). Commence reverse circulation to 10.6 ppg CaCl2 while building and filtering 10.6 ppg brine. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 22 bbls.

Note: At 19:52 hrs on 04/21/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) sent an email to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) with notification that 10.5 ppg brine in hole would be weighted up to 10.6 ppg prior to pulling out of hole after perforating.

04/22/2019: Continue reverse circulation to 10.6 ppg CaCl2 while building and filtering 10.6 ppg brine. L/D TCP control head and slip and cut drill line while monitoring well for losses - well static. Un-set 7" posi-test packer and TIH from 21;823' to 22;179'. P/U and M/U TCP control head. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 63 bbls.

04/23/2019: Make up TCP control head assembly; tag sump packer with 20k down (no fill); rig up and reverse 10.6 ppg brine while monitoring for losses - well losing at 6 bph during reverse circulation; well losing at max 0.5 bph when shut down. Perform 30 bbl injection test at 2;000 psi surface pressure. Surface pressure bleeding off slowly to formation. Open well and monitor on trip tank; well static. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 50 bbls.

04/24/2019: Rigged down TCP firing head; pulled bit above perfs and monitor well on trip tank while transfer 10.6 ppg to supply vessel and take on 3;463 bbls of 11.2 ppg CaCl2 brine while filtering same. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 7 bbls.

Note: Rory Chalmers sent an email notification to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 04/24/2019 at 09:22 hrs. that the plan is to raise the brine weight in the well from 10.6 ppg to 11.2 ppg prior to pulling out of the well with TCP assy. and displacing back to 10.5 ppg once the frac tools have been pulled above the FS-2L valve and the formation isolated.

04/25/2019: Rig up and displace well with 11.2 ppg brine; snap in and out of sump packer (no fill); TOH above perfs. Monitor well - average 1 bph loss rate. TOH to 20;120'. Function test annular and VBRs from Primary and Secondary stations. Continue TOH to 17;183'. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 121 bbls.

04/26/2019: TOH lay out TCP assembly (all shots fired); make up perf collet locater and begin TIH with same. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 13.2 bbls.

04/27/2019: TIH with perf collet; tag sump packer 22;190' with 20k-lb down; rig up reverse out assembly; snap out with 16k-lb and reverse 11.2 ppg brine to spec.
Fluid loss past 24 hours: 22.1 bbls.

04/28/2019: Snap in and out of sump packer at 22;190'; no fill observed. Rigged down reverse out assembly and POOH to surface with perf collet locator. Slip and cut drill line. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 55.3 bbls.

04/29/2019: Rig up tubing tongs and handling tools for frac assembly. Pick up frac assembly and RIH with same to 2;563'. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 17.7 bbls.

04/30/2019: Continue TIH with frac assembly to sump packer at 22;190'; change out bails and elevators; snap in and out of sump packer with no fill or issues stinging into packer. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 11 bbls.

05/01/2019: Set down 20k-lb on sump packer; drop packer setting ball; rig up service lines and set VBA packer at 21;818' MD/ 21;602' TVD. Test packer to 1;500 psi; reverse out setting ball; perform pickle treatment flush and test treating lines from frac vessel to 12;000 psi. Obtain circulating rates with cement unit and spot 8 bbl acid in treating lines. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 76 bbls.

05/02/2019: Bullhead acid into perfs. Performed mini-frac; performed step rate test and reversed out mini frac fluid. Performed main frac and reversed out proppant; reverse out 3x DP volumes. R/D frac iron and P/U service tool to dump seals and close FS2/MCS while logging pack with Protechnics logging tools. Losses stopped once above FS valve. Pressure test FS2/MCS TO 1;000 psi for 5 minutes. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 527 bbls.

Note: At 14:05 hrs on 05/02/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) for a 3 day or as soon as possible extension to BOP testing; BOP and BSR function testing as requested. 

05/03/2019: Prepare surface volumes and perform displacement to 10.6 ppg CaCl2 brine. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 0 bbls.

05/04/2019: TOH to surface and L/D GP BHA. No abnormalities or proppant observed on any GP tools/washpipe. Retrieved surface bore protector and set BOP test plug while testing choke manifold offline while monitoring well on trip tank; well static. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 0 bbls.

05/05/2019: Rig up and test VBRs; annular preventer and BSRs with 10.6 ppg CaCl2 from Primary station to 250-350 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. Function test VBRs; annular and BSRs from Primary and Decondary stations. Retrieve BOP test tool and set bore protector. R/U Weatherford and Halliburton isolation assembly handling equipment.

05/06/2019: TIH picking up isolation assembly from surface to 1;670'. Rig down tubing handling equipment and continue TIH with isolation assembly on 5-7/8" drill pipe to 17;497'.

05/07/2019: Continue TIH to place isolation assembly VCH packer at 20;196' MD/ 20;014' TVD. Set and test VCH packer to 4;300 psi. TOH from 20;196' to 4;072'.

05/08/2019: TOH to surface. Pressure test casing against FS valve and BSRs to 4;300 psi. Pull bore protector on 4th attempt; observed scoring on bore protector OD. Jet tree/ surface wellhead. Set BOP test plug and test VBRs and annular with 10.6 ppg CaCl2 from Secondary station to 250-350 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. Function test VBRs; annular and BSRs from Primary and sDecondary stations. Jet surface wellhead; recovering metal fines. Decision to run bore-scope to observe tubing hanger seal profile. 

05/09/2019: Inspect wellhead with bore-scope camera - no scoring observed on tubing hanger seal profile; however footage inconclusive. R/U control line sheaves in preparation to run upper completion.

05/10/2019: R/U tubing handling equipment; P/U and rack back 34 stands of 5.5" 23# tubing in derrick.

05/11/2019: Finish P/U and rack back a total of 64 stands of 5.5" 23# tubing in derrick. P/U dummy tubing hanger to perform land out and pressure test on tubing hanger sealing profile after scoring observed on bore protector (5/08/2019).

05/12/2019: Pressure test on dummy tubing hanger (TH) failed. Pull TH and inspect TH for any anomalies. Seal area had signs of damage. RIH and set bore protector. P/U 10-3/4" RTTS and TIH with same.

Note: At 09:42 hrs on 05/12/2019; Chris Fontenot (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) to proceed to temporarily suspend the well as per the submitted plan and to change out the surface tree.

05/13/2019: TIH to packer depth of 5;710'. Perform negative test on FS-2 valve. Perform RTTS positive test to 1;000 psi. Reverse out 6.5 ppg base oil. Perform positive test below RTTS to 700 psi against FS-2 valve (inflow test pressure). 

05/14/2019: Perform inflow test on RTTS storm valve. R/D test assembly; TOH and L/D RTTS running tool. N/D BOPs.

Note: On 05/14/2019 at 10:40 hrs; Pat Campbell (Chevron) sent an email notification to BSEE Houma District of the upcoming M-400 72-hour initial latch up pressure testing of the BOP after the Horizontal Tree change out.

05/15/2019: Prepare rig floor for BOP removal. Lift BOPs and stage at south side of drilling module. N/D spool joint. P/U horizontal surface tree (HST) and stage to pipe deck.

Note: At 16:04 hrs on 05/15/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) sent an email notification to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that per the communications on 5/12/19 regarding the tree change out; the well has been successfully suspended and the BOP is currently being removed to perform a tree change out. Given these activities; the BOP will not be function tested today (per schedule). The BOP will be function and pressure tested once nippled back up to the well.

05/16/2019: Stage backup HST to well bay and N/U same. N/U BOP spool joint. N/U 18 3/4" BOPs.

Note: On 05/16/2019 at 15:00 hrs; Pat Campbell (Chevron) sent an email notification update to Josh Ladner (BSEE) regarding the timing of the M-400 BOP re-installation initial pressure testing after the Horizontal Tree change out.

Note: On 05/16/2019 at 15:51 hrs; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) sent an email to William Sanders (BSEE) for review concerning Chevrons intended BOP equipment test program/ rationale plan following the horizontal tree change out on the well. 

05/17/2019: Finish N/U BOPs. Jet BOPs. P/U BOP test tool.

Note: On 05/17/2019 at 08:35 hrs; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from William Sanders (BSEE) that the BOP test plans sent to BSEE on 05/16/2019 are acceptable as this is not an initial test and the components removed to perform the change out are being tested to the RWP of the wellhead.

05/18/2019: Test HST/VBRs to 250-350 psi low and 10;000 psi high for 30 minutes. Test VBRs and annular preventer to 250-350 psi low and 6;500 psi high from Primary station. Function test Annular; UVBR; LVBR; UBSR; LBSR from Primary and Secondary stations. Perform Accumulator drawdown test. Pull BOP test assembly and L/D same. Tests witnessed by BSEE Inspectors.

05/19/2019: R/D BOP test tools; M/U TDS and flush choke and kill lines. Jet BOPs and HST. TOH and L/D Clean Well assembly. Set bore protector. Check torque on BOP flange bolts and RBC. RIH with RTTS retrieval tool. Latch RTTS. Pump 50 bbls Hi-vis sweep (86 vis) and circulate out at 8 bpm.

05/20/2019: TOH and L/D RTTS. TOH with 5-7/8" tailpipe. Pull bore protector and jet HST profile. R/U to run upper completion.

05/21/2019: R/U tubing handling equipment. M/U mule shoe; CIM; and install control line. P/U ported sub and DHPTG. RIH with same on 3-1/2" tubing to 2;717'.

05/22/2019: RIH to 3;716'. Stage MLE spooler to rig floor. P/U and install lower; middle and upper motor assemblies; vacuum filling each assembly at rotary.

05/23/2019: Finish vacuum filling and installing upper motor assembly on lower ESP. Install tandem seal assembly with pothead and pumps on lower ESP. P/U lower bypass tubing and lower motor for upper ESP.

05/24/2019: Install and test WellLift HP gauge line. Install upper ESP assembly. P/U packer and measure MLE cables for packer penetrators.

05/25/2019: Feed MLE cables through adjustable adapters. Make up packer penetrators and test same. R/U and splice TEC and CI lines and test same. R/D Weatherford tripmaster and RIH with one stand 5 1/2" from derrick.

05/26/2019: TIH with ESP assembly on 5-1/2" tubing from derrick; installing clamps as needed to 8;332'.

05/27/2019: Running in hole with ESP assembly on 5-1/2" tubing to 12;144'; pick up timed pup and Schlumberger SCSSV.

05/28/2019: Function test SCSSV through A and B ports; test same to 8;500 psi for 15 minutes. Install CI line with FMJ connections and test to 10;000 psi. Continue RIH; picking up tubing from 12;190' to 15;409'.

05/29/2019: Continue RIH; picking up tubing from 15;409' to 20;210'.

05/30/2019: Rigged down Weatherford Vario elevators and rigged up 6-5/8" handling equipment; pick up tubing hanger and sting into isolation packer. Installed RMS MLE splices and tested same; made up MLE penetrators to hanger.

05/31/2019: Installed MLE and SCSSV penetrators/ control lines in tubing hanger and tested same. RIH and land out hanger in wellhead. Lock tubing hanger in wellhead and perform 50k-lb overpull test to confirm latch.

06/01/2019: Rig up slickline BOP and lubricator with isolation retrieval tool in same; test lubricator to 7;000 psi for 15 minutes. Pressure test hanger seals and install ESP flanged outlets on wellhead.

06/02/2019: Complete electrical checks on ESP penetrators; pressure test to 7;500 psi; install surface caps on same. Bleed down SCSSV ports A and B to zero; make up penetrator adapters and test to 7;500 psi. Install CI penetrators and pressure test to 7;500 psi. Reverse circulate 850 bbls inhibited packer fluid into tubing x casing annulus.

06/03/2019: Set bore protector on slickline. Run in hole with 3.25" gauge ring to 16;086'; pull out of hole with gauge ring and RIH with 3.125" RPT plug. Set RPT plug in landing profile at 16;086'. POOH and test tubing against RPT plug to 1;000 psi. Close SCSSV; maintaining 1;000 psi; and perform inflow test on same. Equalize pressure across SCSSV and open same. Pressure up down tubing; against RPT plug to set packer with 5;500 psi. RIH and pull RPT plug to surface. Pull bore protector and set temporary crown plug.

06/04/2019: Install and test night cap to 7;000 psi. Test temporary crown plug to 6;500 psi. R/D slickline and pull TH running tool. R/D upper completion equipment from rig floor.

06/05/2019: N/D flow line; bell nipple; slip joint; knife gate valve. Bleed accumulator to 0 psi. Remove BOP control lines. N/D BOPs and spool joint.

06/06/2019: Install upper work platform. Disconnect SCSSV control lines and install 1/4" speed-bite plugs. Pressure test A&B SCSSV lines to 8;500 psi. Install TEC line through wellhead outlet. Perform pressure test to 10;000 psi on TEC lines. Install threaded TH lower lock ring. Install TH neck seal; upper lock ring and DX 1 gasket. Pressure test neck seal and gate valve to 10;000 psi. N/U lubricator assembly to HST. M/U 3.0" GS running tool and slickline lubricator.

06/07/2019: Test lubricator to 7;000 psi. Retrieve temporary crown plug. Test lubricator quick test sub to 7;000 psi. Open SCSSV and cycle open FS-2 valve. Bullhead 342 bbls base oil. Close and perform successful inflow test on SCSSV. Set crown plug on slickline and test same to 6;500 psi. Close and test crown valve to 6;500 psi. R/D slickline/lubricator and equipment. Install cap flange on crown valve. Install tree flange on AAV. Handover A4 well to Operations.

06/08/2019: R/D surface lines from cement manifold to AAV. Perform Derrick inspection. R/U fox holes. Prepare and function test VDM for pipe lay down. Lay down 5-7/8" DP out of derrick.

Note: On 06/08/2019 at 12:01 hours; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) to perform drill pipe lay down operations using the PRS; VDM; fox holes; while flowing the A4 well.

7/22/05:  Arrive on location @ WR 29 @ 0830 hrs.  Run 36¿ conductor csg to 180¿ and monitor current.  Pull 36¿ to surface due to high current.  ROV confirm location.  Set wellhead beacon & 5 compacts.

7/23/05:  ROV took clear bottom survey & run current profile.  Begin moving off location to drift in for jetting 36¿.  Current too high for running 36¿.  Move back onto location and run further current profiles w/ ROV.

"},{"   ":1,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608124001900,"WAR_START_DT":"2005-07-24","TEXT_REMARK":"7/24/05:  Continue current meter profiles with ROV; begin moving rig 33 miles southeast from Walker Ridge 29.

7/25/05:  Move rig 30 miles southeast of Walker Ridge 29; Run 36" conductor casing & 26" BHA; TIH with 36¿ Conductor Casing on landing string to 676¿ while moving rig in direction of the well center.

7/26/05:  Continue RIH with 36" Conductor Casing to 5094' on landing string while moving rig to Walker Ridge 29; position rig over well center; spud & begin jetting in 36".

7/27/05:  Jet 36" Conductor Casing to 5673'; let 36" soak; release from CADA Tool and drill 26" Hole Section from 5673' to 6337'.

7/28/05:  Drill 26" Hole Section from 6337' to 8150'.  C&CM; pump Hi-Vis Gel sweep followed by 12.5 PPG pad mud.

7/29/05:  Short trip f/ 8150' to 5673; TIH to 8150'.  CCM & spot 16.0 PPG DKD mud at 8150¿; pooh; wash wellhead; pooh & L/D BHA.

7/30/05:  Move rig 15 miles South of location; run 22" Casing while drifting the rig back to Walker Ridge 29.
"},{"   ":2,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608124001900,"WAR_START_DT":"2005-07-31","TEXT_REMARK":"7/31/05:  TIH with 22" casing on landing string to 7;975'; land out in HPH.  Perform cement job; lock HPH to LPH.

8/01/05:  POOH with inner string; identify fish left in hole; TIH with drill pipe open ended; wash 10' of cement; POOH; RIH with bladed mill assembly.

8/02/05:  Continue RIH with bladed mill assembly. Drill cement from 7;974¿ to 8;030¿. Tag fish. Mill fish from 8;030¿ to 8;032¿. Circ B/U. POOH & L/D bladed mill. P/U Piranha mill.

8/03/05:  RIH with Piranha mill to 7;997¿. Wash from 7;997¿ to 8;032¿. Mill from 8;032¿ to 8;034¿. Circ B/U. POOH.

8/04/05:  Continue POOH. L/D Piranha mill. P/U Metal Muncher mill & RIH to 8;032¿. Mill on fish at 8;032¿.

8/05/05:  Continue to mill on fish from 8;032¿ to 8;035¿. Displace well to 10.5 ppg WBM. Test bottom plug at 8;035¿ with 15K String weight. POOH to 5;653¿. Displace with seawater. Spot surface plug from 5;653¿ to 5;453¿. POOH & L/D Metal Muncher Assembly. PBTD 5;453¿.

Performing rig maintanence and DC inspections; stump testing BOP's."},{"   ":14,"WELL_NAME":"  001a","API12":608124000603,"WAR_START_DT":"2007-10-14","TEXT_REMARK":"10/14/07:  Finished towing from MC 961 to WR 30. Arrived location and began running anchors.

10/15/07:  Ran 6 anchors.  Located well with ROV.  Retrieved corrosion cap.  Pre-tensioned anchors and prepared to start running BOP stack.

10/16/07:  Continued running anchors.  R/U to run riser.  Replaced communications module in blue pod on BOP stack.  Began running riser.

10/17/07:  Continue running riser.  Unable to offload remaining riser on workboats due to rough seas.  Took on small equipment and supplies while waiting on weather.

10/18/07:  Waiting on weather.  Took on small equipment and supplies and 1700 bbls WBM.

10/19/07:  Waited on weather.  Offloaded riser and resumed running.

10/20/07:  Finished running riser.  Landed stack on wellhead and tested connector.  Discovered leak in rigid conduit line on LMRP.  Unlatched stack and prepared to pull riser."},{"   ":15,"WELL_NAME":"  001a","API12":608124000603,"WAR_START_DT":"2007-10-21","TEXT_REMARK":"10/21/07:  Latched BOP stack and tested connector.  Discovered leak in rigid conduit co-flex line on LRMP with ROV.  Unlatched and pulled riser and BOP stack for repairs.

10/22/07:  Finished pulling riser.  Replaced and tested rigid conduit co-flex line on LMRP.  Started re-running riser.

10/23/07:  Started BOP in water.  Tested choke & kill lines and rigid conduit.  Began running riser.

10/24/07:  Continue running riser.  Wait on weather.  Winds to 52kts.; seas 12-16'.


10/25/07:  Wait on weather.  Tested choke & kill lines.  Contintued running riser.

10/26/07:  Flushed through and tested rigid conduit line.  Landed BOP and latched same.  Test BOP connector.  R/D riser running equipment.  TIH with 5-1/2" drillpipe and wearbushing to 4;973'.

10/27/07:  TIH with 5-1/2" test assembly.  Tested BOP's. TOOH.  P/U 6-5/8" test joint.  TIH P/U 5-1/2" DP.

"},{"   ":16,"WELL_NAME":"  001a","API12":608124000603,"WAR_START_DT":"2007-10-28","TEXT_REMARK":"Ongoing MWD/LWD and/or Mudlog Operations 10/28/07:  Tested BOP's.  No test on middle rams.  POOH with test assembly.  Installed new seal in test plug.

Displace DP & riser W/ 50 BBLS base oil; 100 BBLS 15.0 PPG WBM spacer; 250 BBLS HI VIS spacer; 200 BBLS CC 1250; & followed W/ seawater.  POOH W/ lndg string.  MU & TIH W/ blat tool & land out in marine riser NOGO.  Engage blat tool & take 50K OP.  Unlatch riser.  Release blat tool & rack back. Isolate TDS & DW For removal of service loop.
12/17/05:  Divers waiting on weather to repair T1 Thruster. Complete Service Loop change out. Repair PRS track. Change out Desilter Pump #1.

Note:  As per the telephone conversation between Mr. John McCarroll MMS Houma and Mike Weatherl with Chevron on Wednesday December 7th verbal approval was rec¿d to modify open hole P&A plan by adding cement plug #2 from 23;800¿-24;400¿ to the previously approved Plan due to additional information obtained from open hole logs.

01/23/06:  Displace 12.6 ppg SBM w/ seawater. Pump 100 bbls Base oil; 100 bbls WBM Spacer @ 14.7 ppg; 250 bbls Hi Vis seawater / soap spacer. Chase w/ seawater. Perform cmt job. Break circ w/ Dowell. Install Diverter handling tools. Take 50k overpull. Pull Diverter & hand off t/ PRS. Install RHT on TDS. Unlatch BOP¿s / Riser on Driller¿s panel Blue pod (18.7 gals). ROV verify unlatch. R/D choke; kill; boost; & rigid conduit lines f/ slip jt. Hoist SLS ring into locking position & take 50k overpull.

01/24/06:  Engage manual locking dogs for SLS ring t/ Diverter Housing. Set 50k down. P/U t/ neutral; unlock SLS ring f/ Slip jt. POOH w/ slip jt. Lay out 15¿ & 20¿ pup jts; & Blat jt. POOH t/ 3260¿. Recover 4 of 5 compats w/ ROV.

"},{"   ":90,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124002300,"WAR_START_DT":"2006-11-01","TEXT_REMARK":"11/01/06:  Arrive on Big Foot location; ROV deploy compatts & perform seabed survey; prepare rig floor for spud.

11/03/06:  TIH to mudline; jet 36" on AFT; release from CADA and pull 30" bit above LPWH; FWD rotary stab 26" BHA & drill 26" hole to 5946'; POOH due to excessive angle.

"},{"   ":91,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124002300,"WAR_START_DT":"2006-11-05","TEXT_REMARK":"11/05/06:  Drill 26" hole section from 6445' to 8224'; POOH to change BHA.

11/07/06:  Complete TIH to 8224'. Drill 26" hole section from 8224' to 8575'; AFT run 22" casing to 2937'.

11/08/06:  TD 26" hole section at 8600'; run and cement 22" casing to 8551'; POOH with 26" drilling assy.

11/09/06:  Finish cementing 22" casing (8445 ft3); POOH with 5" inner cementing string. Set 16.4 ppg cement suspension plug from 8288'to 8088' (460 ft3). Completed POOH w/ inner string. Rig performed blackout test and ESD-0 test.

11/10/06:  Prepare to offload PS002 subsea tree; install TA cap and inject corrosion inhibitor into HPWH. Install anode sled on Big Foot #3; recover transponders; ROV site survey and transit to Tahiti PS001 (GC 640).

07/11/07:  PERFORM BOP & RIG MAINTENANCE. R/U TO RUN RISER. RUN BOP & RISER TO 282'. **NOTE: ROV DIVE & PERFORM MUDLINE SURVEY; INSPECTED WELLHEAD & RISER. 
**NOTE: ANADRILL/SCHLUMBERGER TESTED PURGE SHUTDOWN ON MWD UNIT ON 07/11/07 AT 2051 HRS (UNIT SHUTDOWN IN 29 SEC).

07/12/07:  RUN BOP & RISER TO 1;482'. MONITOR & TROUBLESHOOT YELLOW POD PILOT PRESSURES. 5K-3K REGULATOR ON YELLOW CONDUIT LINE UNABLE TO MAINTAIN 3000 PSI. PULL RISER & BOP TO SURFACE. CHANGE OUT 5K-3K POD REGULATORS. RUN BOP & RISER TO 1;707'. **NOTE: ROV DIVE & PERFORMED MUDLINE SURVEY; INSPECTED WELLHEAD & RISER. 
**NOTE: MR. JERRY FREEMAN (MMS-NO) AND MR. KELLY BOUZIGARD (MMS-NO) VISITED RIG FROM 0900 HRS TO 1115 HRS - NO INCS ISSUED.

07/13/07:  CHANGED OUT RISER RUNNING TOOL. CONT. RUN BOP & RISER TO 5;157'. P/U TELESCOPIC JOINT. **NOTE: SPERRY SUN CALIBRATED GAS ANALYZER & TESTED THE PURGE SHUTDOWN ON THE MUD LOGGING UNIT ON 07/13/07 AT 1812 HRS (UNIT SHUTDOWN IN 21 SEC). 

07/14/07:  LATCH SDL RING TO TELESCOPIC JOINT. MOVE RIG OVER WELLHEAD. LAND OUT BOP; LATCH WELLHEAD CONNECTOR. TAKE 50 KIPS OVERPULL TO CHECK CONNECTOR. L/D DIVERTER HANDLING TOOL. R/D RISER HANDLING EQUIP. M/U BOP TEST STAND & R/B IN DRK. **NOTE: ON 07/14/07 AT 1300 HRS; MR. TERRY COOK (CUSA) NOTIFIED MR. BEN COCO (MMS-HOUMA) BY E-MAIL THAT BOP STACK WAS LATCHED UP ON BIG FOOT #3
WR 29); AND CONNECTOR WAS TESTED AGAINST BSR TO 250/1;700 PSI; 5 MIN EA TEST. **NOTE: FUNCTION TEST BSR & CSR ON BLUE POD SEM 'B' F/ OIM PANEL AND ON YELLOW POD SEM 'A' F/ RIG FLOOR PANEL.
"},{"   ":95,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124002300,"WAR_START_DT":"2007-07-15","TEXT_REMARK":"07/15/07:  P/U 18-1/8" BHA & DQ ITT. P/U TIH 5-7/8" 46# DP. LAND ITT IN WH. TEST BOP'S ON 5-7/8" DP AS PER CHEVRON & ENSCO PROCEDURES ON YELLOW POD SEM 'A' F/ RIG FLOOR. TEST CHOKE MANIFOLD; CHOKE & KILL LINES; UPPER & LOWER VBR'S; MID 5-7/8" FIXED RAMS; UPPER & LOWER ANNULARS TO 250 PSI LOW / 6800 PSI HIGH F/ 5 MIN EA TEST. **NOTE: DAY TOUR TRIP DRILL = 36 SEC. EVENING TOUR = 38 SEC. 

07/16/07:  CONT TEST BOP'S ON 5-7/8" DP AS PER CHEVRON & ENSCO PROCEDURES ON YELLOW POD SEM 'A' F/ RIG FLOOR. TEST CHOKE MANIFOLD VALVES; CHOKE & KILL LINES; CHOKE & KILL LINES FAIL SAFE VALVES; WH CONNECTOR; UPPER & LOWER VBR'S; MID 5-7/8" FIXED RAMS; UPPER & LOWER ANNULARS; FOSV'S; IBOP; UPPER & LOWER TDS VALVES TO 250 PSI LOW / 6800 PSI HIGH F/ 5 MIN EA TEST. TEST SWIVEL PACKING; TDS MUD HOSE & STANDPIPE MANIFOLD VALVE #8 TO 6400 PSI. FUNCT TEST BOP'S ON BLUE POD SEM 'B' F/ OIM PANEL. FUNCTION TEST DIVERTER F/ RIG FLOOR AND FLOW THRU BOTH PORT & STB OVERBOARD LINES W/ SW (10 SEC TO CLOSE; 13 SEC TO OPEN). POOH 18-1/8" BHA & DQ ITT. L/D DQ ITT. CONT POOH W/ BHA. P/U SJCT & WSRT W/ WS. TIH 18-1/8" BHA; SHALLOW TEST MWD. M/U & R/B EDPHOT W/ ITT. TIH W/ 18-1/8" BHA & WASH DWN & TAG CMT PLUG. DRILL CMT PLUG F/ 7;958' TO 8;145'; PUMP SWEEP; CIRC TO RISER. ** NOTE: SPILL DRILL CONDUCTED ON 07/16/07. **NOTE: ROV PERFORMED MMS REQD INSPECTION OF RISER; BOP'S; WH & MUDLINE.

07-17-07:  FINISH CIRC SWEEP TO RISER. DRILL OUT CMT PLUG F/ 8;145' TO 8;231' & WASH DWN TO TOP OF 22" SHOE TRACK CMT. PUMP SWEEP & CIRC INTO RISER. TEST 22" CASING W/ 8.6 PPG SW TO 1700 PSI F/ 30 MIN. DISP CHOKE; KILL & BOOST LINES & WELL F/ SW TO 10.8 PPG SBM. DRILL OUT 22" SHOE TRACK CMT. CLEAN RAT HOLE & DRILL 16' OF FORMATION TO 8;590'. 01/14/08:  DRILL 10-5/8" HOLE F/ 24;934' TO 25;133' MD; (23;877' TVD). CBU. ATTEMPT TO POOH; TOOK 100K O.P. @ 25;118'. BACK REAM TO 25;106'. ATTEMPT TO POOH W/ NO PUMPS; 85K O.P. BACK REAM TO 24;812'. POOH TO 24;358'; TIH TO 25;111'. CBU. ATTEMPT TO TIH TO 25;133' TAG W/ 17K DOWN @ 25;108'. WASH & REAM TO 25;133'. WGT UP TO 12.1 PPG. ATTEMPT TO POOH. O.P. 80K @ 25;105'. ATTEMPT TO ROTATE (STALLING OUT). EST CIRC (O.K.). WORK PIPE F/ 750K & 500K; (PIPE STUCK). CUT MW TO 11.9 PPG. **NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WELLHEAD; & MUDLINE. RECOVERED RIG BEACON 2B DUE TO SIGNAL LOSS/BATTERY LIFE.

01/15/08:  WORKING & JARRING PIPE UP & DOWN F/ 800K TO 345K. CONT CUTTING MUD WT BACK TO 11.9 PPG. SPOT BASE OIL IN OPEN HOLE TO DECREASE DOWN HOLE PSI TO 11.7 PPG EMW. CONT WORKING & JARRING PIPE UP & DOWN F/ 800K TO 345K. CLOSE ANNULAR & DISP BASE OIL DOWN CHOKE LINE TO LOWER DOWN HOLE PSI TO 11.2 PPG EMW. CONT. WORKING & JARRING PIPE W/ NO SUCCESS. 

01/16/08:  R/U WIRLEINE. RIH W/ SOURCE FISHING TOOL ASSY. ATTEMPT TO RETRIEVE SOURCE W/ FISHING TOOL ASSY; POOH. RADIO ACTIVE SOURCE NOT RETRIEVED. RIH AGAIN & RETRIEVE SOURCE. POOH & L/D SAME. RIH W/ FREEPOINT ASSY & DETERMINE FREE POINT.  

01/17/08:  POOH W/ FREE POINT TOOL. RIH W/ SEVERING ASSY ON WIRELINE TO 24;762' WLM.  TAKE 166K O.P. ON DRILL STRING & FIRE CHARGE. POOH. BREAK CIRC. W/ 750 GPM W/ 3200 PSI. WORK & JAR PIPE W/ MAX O.P. OF 166K. TRAP TQ IN DRILL STRING & WORK & JAR PIPE W/ MAX O.P. OF 116K W/ NO SUCCESS. LINE UP & MONITOR HOLE ON TRIP TANK. RIH W/ SEVERING ASSY RUN #2 ON WIRELINE TO 24;766' WLM. TAKE 166K O.P. ON DRILL STRING. FIRE CHARGE @ 24;766' WLM. PIPE SEVERED WEIGHT INDICATOR FELL F/ 800K TO 625K. NOTE: EST TOF 24;758' DPM. POOH W/ W/L & R/D SAME. POOH W/ DP. (**NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WELLHEAD; & MUDLINE. INJECTED 6 GALS OF GLYCOL IN WH CONNECTOR.)

01/18/08: POOH W/ DP & L/D SEVERED JT OF HWDP. (NOTE: FUNCT BSR/CSR F/ OIM PANEL ON YELLOW POD SEM "B" & RIG FLOOR PANEL ON BLUE POD SEM "A".) EST. TOF @ 24;758' W/ 347' OF FISH LIH. RUN LOG #1 W/ DUAL OBMI; DSI; GPIT; & GR ON WIRELINE. 

01/19/08: CONT TO RUN LOG #1 W/ DUAL OBMI; DSI; GPIT; & GR ON WIRELINE. RUN LOG #2 WITH WIRELINE W/ AIT; LDT; CNT; & CMR+. SLIP & CUT DRILL LINE. P/U 1000' OF 3-1/2" CMT STINGER & TIH W/ SAME ON 5-7/8" DP TO 5;350'. **NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WELLHEAD & MUDLINE.
"},{"   ":124,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124002302,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-01-20","TEXT_REMARK":"01/20/08:  TIH W/ CMT STINGER TO 6;381'. TELESCOPIC JOINT LOWER PACKER ELEMENT FAILED. POOH & L/D 3-1/2" CMT STINGER. LOWER MUD LEVEL IN RISER TO ACCOUNT FOR 200 PSI HYDROSTATIC DROP. P/U & TIH W/ CMT STINGER. CONT TIH W/ CMT STINGER ON 5-7/8" DP TO 7;516'. **FUNCTION TEST BOP'S F/ RIG FLOOR YELLOW POD SEM 'A' & F/ OIM PANEL BLUE POD SEM 'B'.

01/21/08:  TIH TO 10;626'. P/U 16" RTTS & SSC-III ASSEMBLY. TIH W/ RTTS & SET PACKER @ 5;848' (TOP OF SSC-III @ 5;826'). TEST BACKSIDE OF RTTS TO 1000 PSI. RELEASE  OVERSHOT. POOH TO 4;758'. TEST TOP OF RTTS TO 1000 PSI. POOH. **NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WH & MUDLINE.

01/22/08:  R/U RISER HANDLING EQUIP. PULL DIVERTER & L/D SAME. L/D TELESCOPIC JOINT & PACKER HOUSING. INSTALL NEW TELESCOPIC JOINT & PACKER HOUSING. INSTALL DIVERTER & R/D. PERFORM HYD TEST ON UPPER & LOWER PACKERS. P/U 16" RTTS RETRIEVAL BHA & TIH TO 5;826'. POOH W/ 16" RTTS & SSC-III AND L/D SAME.

01/23/08:  RIH T/ 24;700'. P/U CEMENT STAND & PUMP 66 BBLS (370 CU FT / 360 SXS) ACROSS 11-7/8" SHOE. DISPLACE CEMENT W/ 581 BBLS OF 11.9 SBM. ESTIMATED TOC @ 24;100'. R/D CEMENT LINES & POOH W/ CEMENT STINGER T/ 21;200'. **NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WH & MUDLINE.

01/24/08:  CONT POOH W/ CEMENT STINGER F/ 21;200'. L/D 3 1/2" DP. RIH W/ 9 STANDS OF 5 7/8" HWDP. POOH W/ HWDP & L/D SAME IN SINGLE JOINTS.  **NOTE: DIVERTER SUB JT BACKED OFF DURING CEMENT OPERATIONS LEAVING IT IN HOLE.

01/25/08:  FINISH L/D HWDP. CONDUCT BSR / CASING TEST ON YELLOW POD SEM "A" FROM OIM'S PANEL TO 250 PSI FOR 5 MIN. PRESSURE UP TO 2;250 PSI & MONITOR PRESSURE FOR 30 MIN. LOST 80 PSI IN 30 MIN. HELD LAST 5 MINS @ 2;170' PSI. FUNCTION CSR ON YELLOW POD SEM "A" FROM OIM'S PANEL. FUNCTION BSR / CSR ON BLUE POD SEM "B" F/ RIG FLOOR PANEL. P/U & RIH W/ 7" 7 SPF PERF GUN. PERFORATE F/ 22;061' T/ 22;058'. POOH W/ PERF GUN. R/U DOWELL & ATTEMPT TO ESTABLISH INJ RATES. DID NOT REACH THE REQUIRED INJECTION RATE. R/U & RIH PERF GUN. PERFORATE FROM 22;039' T/ 22;036'. POOH W/ PERF GUN. R/U DOWELL & ATTEMPT TO ESTABLISH INJ RATES. P/U & START RIH W/ EZSV ON WIRELINE.

01/26/08:  RIH W/ EZSV ON WIRELINE & SET AT 21;880'. P/U & RIH W/ HALLIBURTON 11-7/8" CMT MSD STINGER T/ 14;154' MD. **NOTE: FUNCTION DIVERTER FROM RIG FLOOR (CLOSE=19 SEC; OPEN=15 SEC). **NOTE ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WH & MUDLINE AND INJECTED 6 GALS OF GLYCOL INTO WELLHEAD W/ RETURNS.
"},{"   ":125,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124002302,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-01-27","TEXT_REMARK":"01/27/08:  CONT RIH W/ HALLIBURTON MSD CEMENT STINGER TO 21;852'. M/U CEMENT STAND & STING INTO 11 7/8" EZSV @ 21;885'. ESTABLISH INJ RATES W/ DOWELL PUMP. MIX & PUMP 40 BBLS OF SURFACTANT WASH FOLLOWED BY 51 BBLS OF 16.8 PPG CEMENT; FOLLOWED BY 5 BBLS OF SURFACTANT WASH. SQUEEZE 40 BBLS OF CEMENT BELOW RETAINER. STING OUT & LEAVE 11 BBLS OF CEMENT ON TOP OF EZSV. POOH & L/D DP T/ 18;742. M/U CEMENT STAND. **NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WH & MUDLINE. DEPLOYED RIG BEACON 2B 100' WEST OF WH & RECOVERED BEACON 2A.

01/28/08:  MIX & PUMP 31 BBLS OF SURFACTANT WASH FOLLOWED BY 38 BBLS OF 16.8 PPG CEMENT; FOLLOWED BY 6.5 BBLS OF SURFACTANT WASH ACROSS 11 7/8" LINER TOP (18;800'-18;500'). POOH & L/D DRILL PIPE 13;850'. MIX & PUMP 37 BBLS OF SURFACTANT WASH; FOLLOWED BY 46 BBLS OF 16.8 PPG CEMENT; FOLLOWED BY 5 BBLS OF SURFACTANT WASH ACROSS 13 5/8" LINER TOP (13;850'- 13;600'). POOH & L/D DP TO 10;116'.

01/29/08:  CONT POOH & L/D DP F/ 10;116' T/ 5;970'. LOCATE LOWER ANNULAR & TEST
13 5/8" TOL CEMENT JOB @ 250 PSI F/ 5 MIN & 1;100 PSI FOR 30 MIN. PRESSURE DROPPED TO 1;060 PSI. 3.7% PRESSURE LOSS. PERFORM 910 PSI NEGATIVE TEST. OK. DISPLACED RISER. MIX & PUMP 5 BBLS OF SEA WATER FOLLOWED BY 43 BBLS OF 14.2 PPG CEMENT (6000' -5800'). CONT POOH & L/D DP. M/U RISER BRUSH & BORE PROTECTOR RETRIEVAL TOOL. TIH T/ 444'. 
**NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WH & MUDLINE. ROV RETRIEVED MUDLINE ADCP. 

01/30/08:  TIH W/ RISER BRUSH & RETRIEVAL TOOL. WASH BOPE & PULL NOMINAL BORE PROTECTOR. SPOT 10 PPG NACL INHIBITED BRINE FROM 5625' TO 5246'. POOH & L/D DP. BEGIN TO SLIP & CUT DRILL LINE.

01/31/08:  FINISH SLIP & CUT OF DRILL LINE. FUNCTION & RESET C.O.M. PREPARE RIG FLOOR TO PULL RISER. BACKLOAD EQUIPMENT TO THE WORKBOAT.

02/01/08:  CONTINUE TO BACKLOAD EQUIPMENT TO THE WORKBOAT. WOW WHILE ATTEMPTING TO UNLATCH BOP STACK. UNLATCH BOP STACK. R/D DRAPE HOSES. L/D LANDING JT & PULL SLIP JOINT.
**NOTE: ROV INSPECTED WELLHEAD; INSTALL TA CAP ON WELLHEAD & INJECTED 6 GAL OF CORROSION INHIBITOR AND PERFORM CLEAR BOTTOM SURVEY.

02/02/08:  L/D SLIP JOINT. PULL & L/D RISER TO 1257'. RIG COMMENCED MOVE TO AT 138 AT 22:50 HRS. **NOTE: FINAL REPORT
"},{"   ":126,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-04-02","TEXT_REMARK":"04/02/2012: A-1 online at 03:30 hrs. Finish rig down 36" casing handling equipment. Run inner string. Change out ARC. Complete running inner string. Perform bit space out check. Make up CADA. Install jewelry onto LPH. TIH with 36" conductor on 6-5/8" DP to 4;900'. Tag mudline at 5;282'; jet and spud in well from 5;282' to 5;420'. 138' of penetration at report time.

04/03/2012: Jet in 36" conductor from 5;420' to 5;589'. Soak 36" casing. Release from CADA. Drill sediment hole section from 5;589' to 6;150'.

04/04/2012: Drill sediment hole section from 6;150' to 7;000'. Displace hole with 10.7 ppg SSPAD mud. POOH with 26" rock bit assy above LPWHH at 5270'. FWD rotary online at 18:30 hrs. TIH with 26" PDC assy from 4;668' to 5;260'. Position FWD over LPWHH; stab in and displace to 10.7 SSPAD mud from 6;720' to 7;000'. Drill from 7;000' to 7;055'.

04/05/2012: Drill 26" salt section from 7;055' to 8;275'.

04/06/2012: Drill 26" salt section from 8;275' to 8;865'.

04/07/2012: Drilled 26" hole to TD @ 8;972'. Pump Hi-Vis sweep. Pump lignite pill.  Displace hole with 13 ppg pad mud. TOH to LPWHH; wash wellhead; clear wellhead; switch AFT to main @ 16:00 hrs. Run 22" csg on landing string.
"},{"   ":127,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-04-08","TEXT_REMARK":"04/08/2012: TIH with 22" casing on landing string. Land out HPWHH. Pump 200 bbl lignite pill with rig pumps. R/U cement head and pump 300 bbls of tuned spacer. Mix and pump 1630 bbls of 14.5 ppg lead and 205 bbls of 16.4 ppg tail. Displace cement with 205 bbls of SW. Final lift pressure 1100 psi. Preload wellhead; release MRLD and POOH with landing and inner string. A-1 offline at 20:00 hrs 04/08/2012.

Verbal approval was granted by Bobby Nelson on 03/08/2012 to use a different fluid to displace the well that what was approved in the permit (e-mail is attached).


"},{"   ":128,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-06-03","TEXT_REMARK":"06/03/2012: Run BOP/Riser to 2;592'. Tested choke/kill at 250/7500 psi. Tested rigid conduit and boost at 5000 psi. All tests held for 5 min.  

06/04/2012: Run BOP/Riser to 5;032'. Tested choke/kill at 250/7500 psi. Tested rigid conduit and boost at 5000 psi. All tests held for 5 min.  
NOTE: On 6/4/2012; e-mail received from Mr. Nelson (BSEE) with approval to latch up the BOP and commence testing prior to the RPD approval being received.

06/05/2012: Landed and latched BOP. Tested connector. Tested casing to 250/2000 psi for 30 minutes. Peformed deadman test. PU/Installed diverter. R/D riser run equipment.  

06/06/2012: R/D riser run equipment; R/U 750T equipment. Performed diverter test. RIH with BOP test assembly. Performed accumulator and BOP test at (250 psi low/7500 psi high). 

06/07/2012: Completed BOP test on 6-5/8" DP at 250 psi low and 7500 psi high. POOH with BOP test assembly. RIH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA. 

06/08/2012: Displaced well to 10.5 ppg SBM; took CLFs and SCRs followed by choke drill. Drilled out shoe track from 8;722' to 8;888' with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA.

06/09/2012: Performed FIT to 12.9 ppg. Drilled ahead from 8;888' to 9;260' with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA.
"},{"   ":129,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-06-10","TEXT_REMARK":"06/10/2012: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 9;260' to 10;130' KOP.

06/11/2012: Directionally drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 10;130' to 11;125'.

06/12/2012: Directionally drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 11;125' to 12;140'.

06/13/2012: Directionally drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 12;140' to 12;845'. Circulated bottom up. TOH from 12;845' to 9;754'. Performed diverter function test from Driller's panel.

06/14/2012: TOH. Functioned BOP while on DP. TOH to 357' with wear bushing. Functioned BSRs/CSRs; repinned wear bushing; slip and cut drilling line. TIH from 357' to 12;845'. Take SCRs at 12;845' and drill to 12;855'.

06/15/2012: Drilling ahead from 12;855' to 13;940'; exiting BOS at 13;008' MD / 12;860' TVD.

06/16/2012: Drilling ahead from 13;940' to 15;268' with 18-1/8" x 21" steerable assy.
"},{"   ":130,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-06-17","TEXT_REMARK":"06/17/2012: Drilling ahead from 15;268' to 16;552' with 18-1/8" x 21" steerable assy.

06/18/2012: Drilling ahead from 16;552' to 16;607' with 18-1/8" x 21" steerable assy. Pumped 100 bbl/ 12.9 ppg sweep and circulate hole/ shakers clean - condition mud as required. Flow check. Displaced rathole to 16.0 ppg hi-vis mud. TOH "wet" from 16;607' to 15;225'; slug pipe and continue TOH to 14;462'.
NOTE: Received approval from Mr. Nelson to delay BOP tests for 36 hours (until noon on 6/23/12). Approval included the requirement to perform function tests on BOP (including shear rams) prior to running casing.

06/19/2012: Continue TOH from 14;462'. Function test BOP (Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod) and diverter (Driller's panel) during TOH. Handle BHA and function BSR/CSR. Begin rig up for 16" casing operation.

06/20/2012: Finish R/U casing equipment. Run 16" casing on forward rotary and building stands on Aft. Run casing from derrick/deck to 4;879'. Run casing in riser at 3 min/std. At 14:00 hrs; convert floats due to issues stabbing flowback tool.
Began filling every 2 stands run.

06/21/2012: Running 16" casing from 4;879' to 8;572'. Forward running casing from derrick and deck. Aft picking up joints and building stands for Forward operation.

06/22/2012: Running casing from 8;572' to 10;980' shoe depth. P/U hanger and C/O casing equipment to drill pipe handling equipment. Run casing on DP from 10;980' to 16;266' shoe depth. Encounter restriction just after hanger passing through wellhead (hanger landing shoulder calculated at 5;280').
NOTE: Received approval from Mr. Nelson for an additional 24 hour extension to the BOP tests (until Noon on Sunday; 6/24/12).
NOTE: Sent communication to Mr. Nelson to reduce circulating time ahead of cement job. He responded with several questions; which were answered.

06/23/2012: Encountered restriction while landing 16 casing. Discussed options with offsite supervision.(5;273.63 hanger landing shoulder depth/ 16;264 shoe depth). Excercise options: Repeat attempts to slack casing beyond depth; pump on Choke and Kill to wash any debris from hanger assy. Suspend operations for T.S. Debby with shearable pipe in BOP. 
NOTE: Sent e-mail to Mr. Nelson with the BSEE informing him that we were suspending the operation with the shearable landing string across the BOPs pending the development of possible tropical storm.


"},{"   ":131,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-06-24","TEXT_REMARK":"06/24/2012: Operations suspended for T.S. Debby; positioned with shearable pipe in BOP. Aft rotary performing derrick management. Crews performing PMs/maintenance.   

06/25/2012: Operations suspended for T.S. Debby; positioned with shearable pipe in BOP. Crews performing PMs/maintenance. Prepare equipment and begin TOH with 16" casing on landing string to 12;900'. Aft assist Dril-Quip preparing spare casing hanger and awaiting remainder of hanger assy from crew boat.    

06/26/2012: TOH from 12;900' to 11;079' with 16" casing on 6-5/8" landing string. Inspect 16" hanger. RIH from 11;079' to 11;230'. Slip and cut 149' drill line. Pull hanger above rotary to 10;697'. L/D 16" hanger and P/U new 16" DQ hanger. TIH with 16" casing on 6-5/8"; 50 ppf landing string to 11;194'.  
NOTE: John Burnett has contacted Bobby Nelson with the BSEE on a daily basis since the incident where the 16" hanger would not pass the wellhead. The weather delays and resulting BOP test delays have been communicated. The BOP tests will be conducted as soon as possible following either cementing the liner or laying down the casing string.

06/27/2012: TIH 3-4 min/std with 16" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 11;194' to 16;285'; tag with 120k down. Pulled casing hanger up through HPWH; with no overpull to 16;256' shoe depth. Circulate and weight up total mud system from 10.9 ppg to 11.0 ppg. 
NOTE: John Burnett contacted Bobby Nelson with the BSEE at 15:21 hrs on 06/27/2012 via e-mail; informing him of the following: We ran in the hole with the 16" casing overnight. We managed to pass the hanger through the wellhead. We made it as far as 18' below the wellhead and are unable to go down further. We are able to pick up the casing but cannot go down. Our forward plan is to:
1) POOH and lay down the casing. 
2) RIH with a jetting assembly and test BOPs/jet the wellhead/stack. 
3) The next step will depend on what we see when we lay down the casing. We anticipate some kind of junk (i.e.; centralizers); but that is not clear right now. We anticipate making at least one; maybe more wiper trips before we attempt to run another string of casing.

06/28/2012: Circulate and condition mud at 16;265'. Simulate connection; flow check well 15 min. Circulate B/U; monitor for background gas; max gas 12 units. Pump out of hole 4 min/std from 16;254' to 12;900'.   
NOTE: At 13:37 hrs on 06/28/2012; John Burnett (CVX) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma Dist) via e-mail of the DID's plan forward to pull the 16" casing and test BOPs directly after.

06/29/2012: Pump out of hole 4 min/std from 12;900' to 11;194'. Flow check well; static. Pump slug. POOH from 11;194' to 11;000'; L/D casing hanger. POOH from 11;000' to 8;697' racking 16" casing in derrick.
NOTE: Hilal Kurban (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 06/29/2012 at 14:36 hrs with a Big Foot A1 update. Pulled out of the hole Landing String and the first two 16" casing stands. The forward plan is to POOH 16" casing and test BOPs. 

06/30/2012: Pull out of hole from 8;697' to 3;314' with 16.10" 103 ppf and 16.15" 16.15 ppf casing transfer aft; break down and lay out same. Note: Pooh with 183 of 264 jts at 24:00 hrs.
NOTE: Hilal Kurban (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 06/30/2012 at 13:51 hrs with a Big Foot A1 update. Pulled out of the hole 140 joints of 264 joints of 16" casing joints. The forward plan is to complete POOH 16" casing and TIH to test BOPs. 
"},{"   ":132,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-01","TEXT_REMARK":"07/01/2012: POOH with 16.15"; 119 ppf casing at 4 min/std from 3;314' to surface; inspecting and removing damaged composite centralized stop collars. Transfer to Aft; break down and lay out same in singles. R/D Frank's 16" casing handling equipment.
NOTE: Hilal Kurban (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) on 07/01/12 at 15:08 hrs with Big Foot A1 update. Pulled out of the hole 245 joints of 264 joints of 16" casing joints. The forward plan is to complete POOH 16" casing and TIH to test BOP.

07/02/2012: Finish R/D Frank's 16" casing handling equipment. Commence boosting high volume slug (240 bbls) from riser. Checking mud weights in and out of well. Monitor well on active system while boosting; well static.
NOTE: Mr. Muhammad Saleh (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) on 07/02/12 at 14:13 hrs with Big Foot A1 update. Approval granted for delayed casing test until the 16" casing has been run. 

07/03/2012: TIH from surface to 5;406'. Wash BOPs; HPWH; and 16" SA. TIH from 5;406' to 5;794'. Functioned BOP to remove any debris. Circulate hole clean and POOH from 5;794' to 5;480'. Circulate bottoms up with no debris observed at shakers. TIH from 5;480' to 5;812'. Rig up and performed accumulator and BOP test on 6-5/8" DP at 250 psi low/ 7000 psi high. Performed diverter function test from Driller's panel.
NOTE: Hilal Kurban (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) on 07/03/12 at 15:22 hrs with - Big Foot A-1 update. Due to a Pipe Racking System (PRS) problem; the operations were delayed. Currently TIH with BOP test assembly at 4;400'. The forward plan is to test BOP and POOH test BHA. TIH with a clean-out BHA to the section TD.

07/04/2012: Pressure tested BOPs on 6-5/8" DP (TP; Yellow) using initial baseline test interpreted as Pass by IPT. Tested Upper; Middle; and Lower pipe rams and associated valves to 250 psi/ 7500 psi. Tested Annular to 250 psi/ 7000 psi. Function test BOPs from Driller's panel Blue Pod. Pressure test BSR using Drill-Quip Dual Cam at 250 psi/ 7500 psi using 11.0 ppg SBM. Re-latch dual cam and POOH jet sub/ BOP test assembly.

07/05/2012: Continue POOH jet sub/ BOP test assembly to surface. RIH with 18 1/8" Cleanout BHA and reamer to 5542'. Land wear sleave. RIH from 5;542' to 8;924' and washing down; circulate hole clean; continue RIH and washing down to 14;802'. No tight spots observed. Continue to RIH and washing down.
