07/06/2012: Wash and ream 18" to 16;607'; working tight spots as necessary. Mill on junk at TD with limited torque up; then pump 200 bbl; 13.5 ppg Hi-Vis sweep. Circulate to adjust MW to 11.0 ppg. Flow check. POOH clean-out assembly 16;607' to 12;837' (2 std above BOS). Activate 21" Ander-reamer and wash and ream to 12;900'. 

07/07/2012: Wash 21" to 16;000' and ream to TD. Increased torque and pack-off at 16;380' during back-reaming. Work pipe and initiate jars to free pipe. Wash and ream to TD at 16;607'. Circulate bottoms up. POOH to 14;690' and TIH to 16;595' with no tight spots. Ream tight spot @ 15;595' to 16;607'. Prepare to pump final 200 bbl sweep and re-run 16" casing. 
"},{"   ":133,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-08","TEXT_REMARK":"07/08/2012: TIH from 16;250' to 16;508'. Wash and ream to TD at 16;607'. Pump 200 bbl Hi-Vis sweep and circulate hole clean. Spot 200 bbl pill in open hole from 16;607' to 16;000'. POOH with 18-1/8" cleanout assembly from 16;607' to 15;575'; wipe clean; and continue POOH to 14;000'. Pump 40 bbl slug; continue POOH to 8;874'. No tight spots observed. Space out and perform BOP function test and Diverter function test. Continue POOH from 8;874' to surface.

07/09/2012: POOH with clean-out BHA from 5;575'. Cut and slip 149' of drill line and service MDDM and traveling block. Boost riser with 11.0 ppg MW in and out. Prepare drill floor for rig up of casing running equipment. Replace lower forward roller on MDDM. Monitor well on trip tank: Well static. Hold PJSM with drill crew and business partners. Rig up Frank's T bails.

07/10/2012: Finish rig up of casing handling equipment and hold PJSM. Run shoe joint; lower float collar and 16.15" centralized casing to 1;150' per POA. Laydown #638 after pin fails to obtain correct torque shouldering. Salvage joint in slips after dressing box threads. Laydown #630 and #631 centralized joints. Run string to 1;422' with casing swages on drill floor in open position. Record 2 hrs of TOI NPT for inabilility to shut down #5 breaker which causes shut-down of drilling operations.

07/11/2012: RIH from 1;469' to 2;394'. PJSM for all crew running 16" casing from derrick and building on Aft. Run 1:1 from derrick and Aft. Run two singles from Aft to make up for laid-down casing with centralizers. Flow check @ 5;118' prior to entering BOPs with ROV on standby. DP in Advisory status with non-shearables across BOP. RIH to 6;971'. Record 1 hr of TOI NPT for repairs to Aft PRS. RIH from 6;971' to 7;824'. During casing running; proper swage on floor in open position.

NOTE: Mr. Nelson with BSEE was notified on 07/11/12 that three centralizers were damaged; thus 50 of the 53 planned centralizers were installed. This reduction in centralizer count will not affect the standoff needed to achieve isolation to the designed Hydraulic Isolation Depth (HID).

07/12/2012: Run 16" casing from 7;824' to 10;397'. DP in Advisorty status with non-shearables across BOP. Convert float equipment. R/D casing handling equipment and R/U drill pipe slips. TIH with 16" casing on 6-5/8" drill pipe landing string from 10;937' to 15;460'. String filled every 5 stands. Prepare for forward cement job on Aft. 

07/13/2012: Finish TIH 16" casing; washing down last 5 stands. Land out casing at 5;531' / 16;479' shoe depth. Circulate landing string and function test Blackhawk cement head. Pump 168 bbl 13.0 ppg spacer; pump 7 bbls cement and release bottom dart. Pump 580 bbl 16.0 ppg tail cement @ 5 bpm; and tail spacer. Displace with rig pumps at 16.6 bpm to maintain positive pump pressure. Observe bottom plug land. Bumped top plug @ 1;100 psi. Under maximum displacement. Bleed off and check floats. Set pack-off per POA. R/D cement equipment. Circulate string volume. R/D elevators and bails. Wait on cement. Prepare to POOH with 16" hanger running tool assembly.

07/14/2012: POOH with 16" hanger running tool assembly from 5;135' to surface. P/U wear sleeve BHA and TIH to 1;129'. Perform well control drill while tripping. Continue to TIH with wear sleeve BHA from 1;129' to 6;017'. Set wear sleeve in wellhead at 5;267'. TOH with wear sleeve running tool assembly from 6;017' to 5;946'. Slug pipe and TOH from 5;946' to 1;138'. Continue TOH to surface.
"},{"   ":134,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-15","TEXT_REMARK":"07/15/2012: Finish POOH. Function test casing shear rams and blind shear rams from drill floor panel on Blue pod. Test 16" casing against blind shear rams to 250 psi for 5 minutes and 4700 psi for 30 minutes. TIH to 15;986'. Perform diverter test. Pressure test BOPs on 6-5/8" 50# DP: test annular (250 psi/5;600 psi); all Rams (250 psi/5;600 psi); Kelly hose (250 psi/6;000 psi). All tests using IPT from Driller's panel on Blue pod. 

07/16/2012: Finish testing BOPs from Driller's panel on Blue pod. Function from Toolpusher's on Yellow. R/D test assy and TIH tagging TOC @ 16;200'. Drill cement and float equipment; drill out shoe @ 16;475'. Wash/ream rathole and drill 10' new formation to 16;617'. Circulate and condition 11.0 ppg SBM. Perform FIT to 1382 psi = 12.68 ppg EMW from 15;835' TVD with 11.0 ppg SBM.

07/17/2012: Drilling ahead with 14.5" x 16.5" steerable assy; drilling 14.5" hole from 16;617' to 16;764'. Open reamer and drill 14.5" x 16.5" hole from 16;764' to 17;690' with surveys and sampling geologic zones as per program.

07/18/2012: Drilling ahead with 14.5" x 16.5" steerable assy from 17;690' to 19;141' with surveys and sampling geologic zones as per program.

07/19/2012: Drilling ahead with 14.5" x 16.5" steerable assy from 19;141' to 20;136' with surveys and sampling geologic zones as per program.

07/20/2012: Drilling ahead with 14.5" x 16.5" steerable assy from 20;136' to 20;340' with surveys and sampling geologic zones as per program. Suspended drilling due to cuttings dryer down and diminishing supply of empty cuttings boxes. Circulated hole clean. TOH to 16" casing shoe. Monitored well on TT while repairing cuttings dryer. Repairing dryer while additional boxes arrive to rig. TIH from shoe to bottom and continue drilling from 20;340' to 20;480'.

07/21/2012: Drill from 20;480' to 21;400' with 14.5" x 16.5" assy; maintaining 30° inclination. Took pressure points in Orange sand as per SLB.

NOTE: On 07/21/2012; received 24 hour extension for shear ram function test from Mr. Bobby Nelson of BSEE. Original due date was 07/22/2012; extension through 07/23/2012.

NOTE: On 07/21/2012; notified Mr. Bobby Nelson that the section would be TD'd shallow and that the appropriate RPD would be submitted.
"},{"   ":135,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-22","TEXT_REMARK":"07/22/2012: Drill from 21;400' to 21;638' with 14.5" x 16.5" assy. Circulate hole clean and condition mud from 21;638'. Spotted 16 ppg mud in rathole. TOH.

07/23/2012: Finish circulate from 16;730'. Continue TOH with drilling assy; function test BOP during trip out. TOH to surface. Slip and cut drilling line. Begin R/U Schlumberger wireline equipment.

07/24/2012: R/U Schlumberger wireline equipment. Run MDT toolstring; taking pressure samples from from 21;181' to 19;847'. Take six fluid samples from Orange sand (21;151').

07/25/2012: Perform wireline operations. Seven unsuccessful attempts to sample fluid in PL 1.5 sand. Recovered three samples from the PL 1.7 sand. POOH with SLB E-Line. Lay out logging tool containing pressure samples ¿ noted missing pad from MDT tool. RIH with rotary sidewall core assy on E-line to 21;300'. Correlate on depth; cut sidewall core samples in Orange sand as per plan.

07/26/2012: TOH with HP-ROC core assy #1; rig up core toolstring #2. Suspended sidewall coring program due to wireline unit failure. Rig down wireline. Pick up cleanout assy (RCJB). TIH with 14-1/2" cleanout assy to 8;905'.

07/27/2012: TIH with 14-3/8" cleanout/junk basket assy from 8;905' to 15;461'. Tested BOPs at 250 / 5;600 psi . All BOP Pressure tests closed against SSTV with 11.0 ppg SBM; utilizing IPT from TP panel on Yellow pod. Function Test BOP from ToolPusher's Blue pod. Function diverter from Driller's panel. Monitor well over trip tank; well static. TIH from 15;461' to 20;708'; breaking circulation every 10 stds in open hole.

07/28/2012: TIH from 20;708' to 21;423'. Wash and ream thru tight spots from 21;423' to 21;621'. Circulate shakers clean at 21;621'. Pump down 2-1/4" RCJB activation ball; work RCJB on bottom. Pump out of hole from 21;621' to 21;617'; string stalled and became stuck followed by packed off. Jar on stuck pipe; re-establishing circulation; and backream out of hole to 21;540'; pump out above Orange sand to 21;070'. POOH 5 stds wet to 20;445'. Pump slug; TOH to 16;479' (16" shoe).

NOTE: John Burnett received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) at ~9:15 hrs on  07/28/2012 to set the 13-5/8" liner shallower than permitted. Confirmation e-mail is attached.
"},{"   ":136,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-29","TEXT_REMARK":"07/29/2012: Perform "Post Jar Inspection" on Fwd MDDM; traveling block and derrick. POOH from 16;479' to surface. Change out saver sub on Fwd MDDM. Perform planned rig maintenance. Rig up 13-5/8" casing handling equipment. RIH with 13-5/8" casing to 1;829'.

07/30/2012: RIH with 13-5/8" x 13-3/4" casing from 1;829' to 5;419'. P/U hanger assy to 5;483'. TIH with 13-5/8" x 13-3/4" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 5;483' to 17;120'.

07/31/2012: TIH with 13-5/8" x 13-3/4" casing to 21;442'. Hold PJSM for cement job. Pump 75 bbls tuned spacer; pump 421 bbls of 16.4 ppg primary cement @ 4 bpm / 700 psi. Follow cement with 27 bbls of fresh water spacer. Displaced cement with 1154 bbls 11.0 ppg mud @ 8 bpm / 140 psi initial. Set hanger with positive indication. Reverse out cement above TOL: 0 bbls of cement returned. Test top of liner. Circulate bottoms up with nerf ball. Flow check: static.

08/01/2012: POOH with liner hanger running tool and L/D. Change out IBOP assy on MDDM and R/U drilling bails. Inspect quill shaft. M/U 12-1/4" bit with Powerdrive. Hold PJSM and load radioactive source in SADN per Schlumberger. Flow check: static. Hold PJSM on tripping in hole. TIH from 921' to 2;530' with hole giving correct displacement. 

08/02/2012: Function test BSRs/CSRs from Driller's panel Blue pod. Pressure BSRs to 250 psi; test casing to 4725 psi for 30 minutes. RIH 5-7/8" DP from 4;543' to 8;274'. Test choke manifold valves using IPT. Change slips to 6-5/8" DP. RIH to 13;339'. Test BOPs on 5-7/8": Annular (250 psi low/5;600 psi high); Kelly hose and pipe valves (250 psi low/5;600 psi high); upper and middle rams (250 psi low/5;600 psi high). Completed 7 of 13 tests. 

08/03/2012: Complete BOP testing on 5-7/8" DP. Lower rams (250 psi low/5600 psi high). Test BOPs on 6-5/8" DP on Blue pod from Driller's panel. Function test BOPs from Toolpusher's panel at Yellow pod. Replaced faulty isolation valve at gumbo box. TIH with 12.25" drilling assembly. Performed choke drill. Begin drilling ratty cement from 21;118' to 21;187'.

08/04/2012: Drill cement inside 13-5/8" liner from 21;187' to 21;302' with 12.25" drilling assembly. Drill 13-5/8" shoe track from 21;302' to 21;440'. Weighted up to 11.5 ppg while drilling cement. Wash and ream 14.5" x 16.5" rathole from 21;440' to 21;572'. Backream from 21;572' until drill sting stalled at 21;485' due to hole packing off. Freed drill string and continued backreaming to 21;440'. Wash and reamed rathole from 21;440' to 21;575'. Drill string stalled at 21;575' due to hole packing off. Freed drill string; circulate hole clean; and continued to wash and ream from 21;575' to 21;638'. Drilled new formation from 21;638' to 21;648' with 12.25" drilling assembly. Backreamed from 21;648' to 21;440'; circulate hole clean; and pulled BHA inside liner to 21;399'. Space out drill string to close annular for upcoming FIT.
"},{"   ":137,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-05","TEXT_REMARK":"08/05/2012: Pulled 12.25" drilling assembly inside 13-5/8" liner to 21;399'. Perform FIT to 13.2 EMW using 11.5 ppg mud at the 13-5/8" liner shoe depth of 21;440'. Open annular; TIH from 21;399' to 21;440' with 12.25" drilling assembly. Wash and ream from 21;440' to 21;648'. Took SCRs at 21;648' with 11.5 ppg mud. Drill 12.25" hole from 21;648' to 21;895'; backreaming one stand length prior to each connection. Begin wellbore trajectory change from 30° to 0° inclination; dropping 1.5° every 100'. Drill 12.25" hole from 21;895' to 22;835'; dropping 1.5° every 100'; while backreaming one stand length prior to each connection.

08/06/2012: Drill from 22;835' to 23;111' with 12.25" rotary assembly; dropping 1.5° every 100'; while backreaming one stand length prior to each connection. Circulate hole clean; take a survey on bottom; and short trip from 23;111' to inside 13-5/8" liner to 21;316'. Circulate hole clean; TIH from 21;316' to 22;945'. Wash and ream from 22;945' to bottom at 23;111'. Took SCRs on bottom. Drill 12.25" hole from 23;111' to 23;494'; dropping 1.5° every 100'; while backreaming one stand length prior to each connection.

08/07/2012: Drill from 23;494' to 23;870' with 12.25" rotary assembly; dropping 1.5° every 100'; while backreaming one stand length prior to each connection. Completed wellbore trajectory change from 30° to 0° inclination. Drill 12.25" hole from 23;870' to 24;660' TD; holding wellbore trajectory of 0° inclination; while backreaming one stand length prior to each connection. Took SCRs on bottom. Pump 100 bbl 12.0 ppg sweep followed by 100 bbl Hi-Vis sweep. Circulate sweeps until hole clean.

08/08/2012: Circulate sweeps until hole clean. Pump out of hole from 24;660' to 24;350'. Perform stick test and correlation log per SLB LWD. Continue pump out of hole from 24;350' while taking stethoscope readings at depths per log schedule to 23;043'. Continue to pump out of hole from 23;043' to 22;500'.

08/09/2012: Pump out of hole; closely monitoring volumes. Obtain pressure tests at designated formations with stethoscope. Circulate and condition hole from 21;850' to 21;764' (14.5" x 16.5" rathole). Tag tight spots @ 21;850'. Work through with MDDM. Overpull noted at 21;800'. Circulate weighted sweep for hole clean-up; reciprocating and monitoring pits. Flow check: Static. Pump slug and TOH to 11;314'. 
NOTE: Bobby Nelson with BSEE wa contacted and granted 12 hr extension for BSR/CSR function test. Extension from 12:00 midnight 08/09/12 until 12:00 noon 08/10/2012.

08/10/2012: TOH from 11;287' with 12-1/4" assy. Perform BOP function and diverter function. Handle BHA and L/D jewelry components to deck from Aft rotary. Forward R/U Schlumberger equipment and begin wireline operations. While running wireline down to perform tie-in correlation; encountered restriction at 21;660'. Begin pulling out of hole with wireline run #1.

08/11/2012: Pull out of hole with Schlumberger wireline run #1. After 1st run tagging restriction at 21;660' tool depth. Reconfigure tool assembly (shortening length) and attempt second run. Unable to descend past 21;670'. Pull wireline tools and R/D wireline equipment. Pick up 12-1/4" clean-out assy from derrick and deck. TIH with same to 14;073'.
"},{"   ":138,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-12","TEXT_REMARK":"08/12/2012: TIH with clean-out assy from 14;073'. Wash and ream problem area below shoe to 22;445'. Stalled at 22;436'. Ream/pump out to shoe to 22;315' and circ sweep and circ second sweep from inside shoe. TOH to 19;612' with clean-out assy.

08/13/2012: T0H with clean-out assy from 19;612'. Handle clean-out BHA. R/U wireline equipment and RIH. Could not pass 21;718' wireline depth (21;747' correlated depth). Pull out of hole with wireline and L/D tools. Begin picking up 12-1/4" x 14-3/4" clean-out BHA.

08/14/2012: RIH with 12-1/4" x 14-3/4" clean-out BHA. TIH with clean-out assembly on pipe to 21;440' and record parameters. Wash/ream through as needed below shoe during TIH to 22;835'.
NOTE:  Notified Mr. Nelson; BSEE; that we were unable to complete logging operations due to hole conditions.

08/15/2012: Continue reaming/washing in hole to 24;368'. Stall and pack off. Pump out of hole to 24;012'. Ream in hole to 24;485'.

08/16/2012: Continue reaming/washing to bottom at 24;660' with clean-out assy. Encounter torque near stalling at numerous depths. Circulate sweep and bring B/U until hole clean. Pump/ream out of hole from 24;660' to 23;300'.

08/17/2012: Back ream out of hole from 23;300' to below shoe. Encounter torque at numerous depths near stalling. Pump sweep at 21;929'; circ sweep inside shoe and continue ream out to shoe before finish B/U circulation. Finish circ; pump slug and observe incorrect hole fill when pulling from 21;410'. Displace slug from string. Pump out of hole from 21;410' to 19;748'.
NOTE: Received 24 hour extension for BOP function tests; BOP pressure tests; and diverter tests from Casey Kavanaugh (BSEE) on 08/17/2012.

08/18/2012: Continue pump out of hole from 19;748' to 13;669' with clean-out assy. Function diverter and start BOP tests.
"},{"   ":139,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-19","TEXT_REMARK":"08/19/2012: POOH hole clean-out assembly; rack back BHA. Cut & Slip Drill line; service MDDM and PRS; change out saver subs; bails in prep for liner run.

08/20/2012: Rig up 9-7/8" casing handling equipment. RIH with 9-7/8" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 3;463' to 13;229'.

NOTE: Mr. Paul Nelson gave verbal approval to proceed with running/cementing the 9-7/8" liner shallower than originally permitted. The well was TD'd 555' TVD shallower than permitted. An RPD is pending review by BSEE.

08/21/2012: TIH with 9-7/8" liner on 6-5/8" DP to 21;921'. Wash and ream through tight spots from 21;921' to 22;640'.

08/22/2012: Wash and ream 9-7/8" liner from 22;640' to 23;664'. String stalled and packed off; unable to circulate; reciprocate and rotate. Attempt to free pipe with no success. Drop 2.75" liner setting ball and allow to fall.

08/23/2012: Set 9-7/8" liner hanger. TOH from 20;347' to 20;154'. Well showing signs of swabbing. RIH to 20;230'. Pump out of hole from 20;230' to 20;154'. Remove Frank's 1;000 ton slips and install BX 1000 slips. Ballast ship. Pump out of hole from 20;154' to 19;027'. R/D OES 22' 1;000 ton bails. Install link adaptors and 750 ton 11' bails and BX-5 elevators while circulating slug out of hole. Pump out of hole from 19;027' to 15;964'.

NOTE: Held conference call with Mr. Bobby Nelson regarding the stuck liner and proposed path forward. 

NOTE: John Burnett forwarded suspension plan for T.S. Isaac to Mr. Bobby Nelson on 08/23/12.

08/24/2012: POOH from 15;964' to 8;570'. M/U RTTS Assy; TIH to 14;552'. Set RTTS as per Halliburton. Spot 50 bbls of 11.5 ppg Hi-vis pill on top of RTTS. Release from RTTS; POOH 2 stds above BOPs. Test RTTS at 1;500 psi for 15 min. on chart. Displace mud pumps; headers; std. pipes; choke/kill & boost with seawater.

NOTE: John Burnett received phone message from Mr. Bobby Nelson; BSEE; stating that the BSEE understands and supports our forward plan. The forward plan being to clean out; run and cement 7" liner and tie back from the top of the 9-7/8" liner with the production tieback. Mr. Nelson did indicate that approval will stipulate that the hydrocarbon zone behind the 9-7/8" casing must be isolated prior to final abandonment at the end of the well's life.

08/25/2012: Pump out trip tank. Verify correct alignment prior to displacing. Adjust pop offs on mud pump #4. ET reboot cyber screen on mud pits. Displace riser as per POA. Monitor pressure below BSRs utilizing HPHT sensor for 30 min. Check flow; static. POOH with RTTS running tool from 5;240' to surface; monitoring BOP HPHT sensor. Silp and cut 149' drill line. Rig up diverter handling equipment. Pull diverter.

"},{"   ":140,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-26","TEXT_REMARK":"08/26/2012: Evacuate non-essential personnel due to T.S. Isaac. Pull and lay out diverter. P/U riser landing joint; make up and lower same. Lock slip joint. Adjust tensioners and verify correct weights for unlatching LMRP. Unlatch LMRP at 04:30 hrs. Secure SDC ring. Lay down landing joint and 16" heavy wall spacer sub. Pull and lay out slip joint; intermediate flex joint; termination joint and 40' pup. Pull LMRP on marine riser to 1;967' (40 of 67 jts layed out). 

08/27/2012: Pull LMRP on marine riser from 1;967' to surface and secure same. Lay down 2 remaining joints of slick riser. Transit rig to safe zone due to T.S. Isaac. 

08/28/2012: Transit rig to safe zone due to T.S. Isaac. Standby on DP mode 104 nautical miles from WR 29; Bigfoot A-1 Nevada; while waiting on weather due to Hurricane Isaac. Rig position at 00:00 hrs: Lat 26° 36.9' N / Long 091° 40.6' W / Heading 290°.

08/29/2012: Waiting on weather. Standing by 104 nautical miles SW of WR 29; Bigfoot A-1 Nevada; on DP mode due to Hurricane Isaac. Lat 26° 36.9' N / Long 091° 40.6' W / Heading 290°. At 16:00 hrs; transit back to WR 29; Bigfoot A-1 Nevada; location.

08/30/2012: Transit rig back to WR 29; Bigfoot A-1 Nevada. Arrive on location at 04:00 hrs. WOW. Pick up riser double.

08/31/2012: Skid LMRP to well center; make up to riser double. Lower and Splash LMRP @ 07:44 hrs. Test choke and line to 250 psi/ 5;600 psi high. Test rigid conduit and boost line at 250 psi low/ 5;000 high. Run LMRP on marine riser from 16' to 2;442' (32 of 67 jts). Test choke and kill lines from 250 psi low/5;600 psi high. Test rigid conduit at 250 psi/5;000 psi.

09/01/2012: Run LMRP on marine riser to 5;032'; while testing choke and kill lines to 250 psi low/5;600 psi high. Test rigid conduit to 250 psi low/5;000 psi high. P/U and M/U termination joint and intermediate flex joint. M/U slip joint to 5;126'. Hold PJSM. Rig up kill line conduit and boost drape hoses. Test choke and kill line and rigid conduit; as above.
"},{"   ":141,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-02","TEXT_REMARK":"09/02/2012: Position rig over A-1 well center and land BOP with verification from ROV. Adjust riser tensioners and set down weight. Unlock slip joint dogs. Hold PJSM and remove spider and gimbal. Install rotary table and rig up 750 ton drilling equipment. P/U RTTS overshot assembly. Perform Diverter test from Driller's panel. TIH with RTTS. Verify lines and begin SW to SBM displacement. Mud at surface after 228 bbls pumped. ROV monitor throughout displacement. Dispacement is IFO. 

09/03/2012: Perform flow check: Static. Circulate string volume. Mud out of balance: 200 psi back pressure. Flow check: Static. Pump 30 bbl slug. CBU. POOH with 16" RTTS assembly and running tool. Well control drill: Secure in 2 min. POOH with RTTS assembly to 9;200'.

09/04/2012: POOH with RTTS/hanger running tool assembly and L/D. Continue POOH. TIH with BOP test assembly with Dual Cam. Complete test of Choke/Kill manifold at 250/5600 psi utilizing IPT. Insert XP-1000 slips in rotary. Test BOP on 5-7/8" DP with 11.5 ppg SBM on Blue pod from Driller's panel; Annular and valves to 250/5600 psi. Test rams and associated valves to 250/5600 psi utilizing IPT. R/D double dutch and TIH. Space out on 6-5/8" DP and M/U double dutch.

09/05/2012: Pressure test BOP on 6-7/8" DP with 11.5 ppg SBM on Blue pod from Driller's panel; Annular and associated valves to 250/5600 psi; and Ram and valves to 250/5600 psi utilizing IPT. Functioned UVBRs closed with ROV hot-stab: 4 min 40 sec to close. Function test BOPs on 6-7/8" DP on Yellow pod from Toolpusher's panel. TIH and land Dual Cam in wellhead profile; release and pick up landing string. Test BSR to 250/5600 psi. Re-engage Dual Cam. TOH. TIH with Casing Test Assembly for 9-7/8" liner. Function test Diverter on 6-5/8" DP from Driller's panel. Continue to TIH.

09/06/2012: Tripped in with 9-7/8" RTTS to 23;365'. Washed from 23;365' to 23;468' (Upper FC). WOW. PJSM. Set RTTS at 23;390' and attempted to test 9-7/8" casing to 4;300 psi. Test failed at 2;700 psi. Discussed results with office. PJSM. POOH and set RTTS at 23;256' to retest casing. Test failed at 2;580' psi. POOH to test below 9-7/8" casing shoe. 

09/07/2012: TOH with 9-7/8" RTTS assembly. Attempt to set RTTS @ 20;410' and 20;573' unsuccessfully. CBU. Make additional five attempts to set RTTS. POOH from 20;570' to surface. Cleaned magnet and serviced RTTS. Prepare to TIH with 13-5/8" RTTS casing test assembly. 

09/08/2012: Laid out 9-7/8" RTTS assembly. Slip and cut drill line. Serviced MDDM. M/U 13-5/8" RTTS and TIH to 20;167'. Set RTTS and pressure tested 13-5/8" casing to 4;300 psi for 30 minutes. Test is successful. POOH with RTTS to 15;861'.
"},{"   ":142,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-09","TEXT_REMARK":"09/09/2012: TOH with 13-5/8" RTTS and layout. TIH with 9-7/8" RTTS to 20;337'. Space out. Unsuccessfully attempt to set RTTS. TIH to 20;495'. Prepare to re-set RTTS.

09/10/2012; TIH with casing test assy attempting to set RTTS at 20;288'; 20;464' & 20;965' - all failed. Successfully set RTTS at 21;609'. Casing test failed at 2600 psi. TIH tagging upper FC at 24;406'. Circulated and conditioned mud. Set RTTS at 24;350'. Pressured down drill string beneath RTTS to 2700 psi - no returns; no loss in SPP. Unseated RTTS. Circulated 1.5x liner volumes. TOH with RTTS to 21;260'. Successfully set RTTS at 21;260'. Pull out to 21;120' and attempted to set RTTS. Unable to set at 21;120'. Circulate bottoms up at 21;120' prior to pulling out of the hole.

09/11/2012: Complete circulating B/U from above TOL. TOH with 9-7/8" casing test assy (functioned BOP and diverter on TOH). Cut/slip drill line and perform unit equipment maintenance while Schlumberger prepares PMIT caliper logging equipment. Rig up wireline equipment and M/U tools. Begin RIH with wireline assy.

09/12/2012: Perform Schlumberger logging with caliper and gather information to determine forward well plan. Evaluate information. Perform unit maintenance and preparing for run #2- USIT in 13-5/8".

09/13/2012: R/U and run Schlumberger wireline USIT log (13-5/8"). POOH and lay out USIT tool. Prepare Schlumberger perf guns on deck and pick up same. RIH with perf run #1 to 24;394.6 WLM (perforate 24;384.6 top - 24;389.6' bottom). POOH w/ perf assy and L/D. P/U EZSV assy and RIH to 1;421'.
NOTE: Mr. Nelson with BSEE provided verbal approval to perforate the casing; set an EZSV; and attempt to establish circulation behind the production liner.

09/14/2012: TIH with EZSV assy from 1;421' to 7;393'; with 4-1/2" drill pipe across BOP. Pressure test BOP on 4-1/2" DP with 11.5 ppg SBM on Blue pod from Driller's panel; annular; rams & associated valves 250/5600 psi utilizing IPT. Continue TIH from 7;393' to 12;963' with EZSV assy breaking circulation at intervals to keep EZSV assy clear of debris. Change bails; install and test OES DP flowback tool.
NOTE: Mr. Nelson with BSEE provided verbal approval to proceed with cementing through the retainer and perforations.

09/15/2012: Continue TIH with EZSV assy from 12;963' to 24;352'; breaking circulation at intervals to keep EZSV assy clear of debris. Set EZSV at 24;350' and establish circulation through perforations. Sting out of EZSV. Spotted hi-vis in 9-7/8". Sting into EZSV and circulated 3x open hole volumes. Sting out of EZSV and circulate B/U and condition mud. Prepared for cement job. Begin performing cement job in 9-7/8" x open hole annulus.

"},{"   ":143,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-16","TEXT_REMARK":"09/16/2012: Continue TIH with EZSV assy from 12;963' to 24;352'; breaking circulation at intervals to keep EZSV assy clear of debris. Set EZSV at 24;350' and establish circulation through perforations. Sting out of EZSV. Spotted hi-vis in 9-7/8". Sting into EZSV and circulated 3x open hole volumes. Sting out of EZSV and circulate B/U and condition mud. Prepared for cement job. Begin performing cement job in 9-7/8" x open hole annulus.

09/17/2012: Finish TOH with EZSV R/T. Change MDDM bails on forward. RIH with 9-7/8" x 13-5/8" polish mill and BOP test assembly. Begin testing BOP on 5-7/8" DP and testing all related valves to 250 psi low/ 5600 psi high.

09/18/2012: Complete BOP testing (5-7/8"/ 6-5/8" DP) to 250/5600 psi. R/D test assy and equipment. TIH with polish mill assy to 24;250'/ TOL at 21;147'. Circulate B/U; pump slug; POOH.

09/19/2012: POOH with polish mill assy from 22;268' and L/D Same. R/U and run Schlumberger Wireline USIT (isolation scanner) - ECRD.

09/20/2012: Log up from 22;461' to 21;151' (TOL). POOH with USIT/ECRD logging assy from 21;151'. R/D Shlumberger wireline. Slip and Cut 149' drill line. R/U Frank's 11-7/8" csg equipment. RIH with 11-7/8" x 13-5/8" isolation hanger/packer and TBR seal assembly to 227'. R/D Frank's csg handling equipment and R/U OES flowback tool.
NOTE: Approval recived from Mr. Bobby Nelson to proceed with installation of a second trip packer.

09/21/2012: Install XP-1000 slips. TIH 2 min/std with 11-7/8" x 13-5/8" isolation/packer TBR seal assy on 6-5/8" DP from 227' to 21;000'; washed from 21;000' to 21;152'; set liner isolation/packer TBR seal assy as per Halliburton Service Rep.

09/22/2012: Make up MDDM; space out and locate annular. Attempt to pressure test 9-7/8" casing with no success. Monitor well on trip tank while build slug. Pump slug and POOH with hanger running tool then L/D.
NOTE: Notified BSEE (Houma District After Hours e-mail and Mr. Bobby Nelson) that the casing test was unsuccessful and outlined the forward plan for identifying the leak.
"},{"   ":144,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-23","TEXT_REMARK":"09/23/2012: Perform general rig maintenance while wait on 11-7/8" RTTS to arrive at rig. M/U 11-7/8" RTTS and TIH at 1.5 min/STD to 20;120'.
 
09/24/2012: TIH with 11-7/8" RTTS and set same at 21;044'. Pressure test 11-7/8" Versaflex hanger and TBR seal assy to 4;300 psi for 5 min each. Unset RTTS and moved 10' up the hole; casing failed to test below RTTS. Unset RTTS and pressure test casing (entire wellbore) to 4;300 psi for 30 min. 
 
09/25/2012: Pulled out of hole with 11-7/8" RTTS assembly to surface. Flow checked well while going thru BOP and well was static. Slipped and cut drill lines. Rigged up for casing run. Picked up and made up 10-1/8" casing isolation assembly and ran in hole to 305'. Rigged down casing handling and rigged up drill pipes handling equipment. Ran in hole 10-1/8" isolation casing assembly to 1;314'.
NOTE: Approval given by Mr. Bobby Nelson to run third hanger system.

09/26/2012: Ran in hole with 305 ft 10-1/8" casing (13-5/8" x 9 5/8" liner isolation assembly) to 21;021'. Washed down to 21;141'. Pressure tested surface lines to 5900 psi and set hanger at 20;956'.

09/27/2012: Pulled out of hole to 20;871'. Pressure tested casing to 4300 psi against annular. Held PJSM and performed negative test. Managed surface pits as preparation for well displacement to WBM. Displaced surface lines to WBM. Started displacing well to WBM.

09/28/2012: Completed mud transfers on surface pits. Finished displacing well to WBM. Pumped slug and pulled out of hole string. Conducted trip drill on way out to surface with string.
NOTE: Approval given by Mr. Bobby Nelson to start running the tieback.

09/29/2012: Pulled out of hole with isolation hanger running tool. Tripped into hole with wear sleeve retrieval / BOP test assembly from 748' to 5;500'. Tested BOP to 5;800 psi on 6-5/8" drill pipe. Washed wellhead; pulled wear sleeve and tripped out of hole with it. 
"},{"   ":145,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-30","TEXT_REMARK":"09/30/2012: Pull up out of hole with wear sleeve. Cut and slip drill line. R/U casing equipment and begin to run 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback for "dummy" space out run.

10/01/2012: RIH with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback. PJSM on non-shearables across the stack. R/D casing handling equipment. R/U landing string running equipment. TIH on 50# landing string.

10/02/2012: Trip in hole with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback. TIH on 50# landing string with painted "dummy" joint. Land on No-Go and mark pipe. TOH and calculate/ confirm proper space out for string. R/U casing equipment and P/U foam jts with pup joint. Prepare for final run of tieback on landing string.

10/03/2012: Finish P/U casing singles and hanger. R/D casing equipment and R/U DP handling equipment. Land casing as per POA on 50# string. P/U and R/U Blackhawk cement std. Record weights and baseline info. Confirm landing and circulate liner volume. Perform tieback cement operations. Pump 143 bbls Tuned spacer; 890 bbls Lead; 95 bbls Tail; and 27 bbls spacer. 

10/04/2012: Pressure set and test seal assy 3;500 psi/ 10;000 psi. R/D cement hoses and Blackhawk assy. TOH with landing string. L/D hanger; R/T and rig down Frank's bails and elevators. Install knuckle links and rig bails on MDDM. Install BX elevators and P/U Lead Impression Tool. RIH with LIT and perform impression top of hanger as per Dril-Quip. Begin TOH with LIT assy.

10/05/2012: TOH and L/D Lead Impression tool. Dril-Quip inspects lead blocks. Flow check: Static. RIH with Lockdown Sleeve to 7;126'. Set LDS and pressure test to 1;000 psi and hold 5 minutes. Pressure up to 3;000 psi to function lock down. Unable to achieve first LDS test to 10;000 psi. Test LDS down backside to 5;000 psi; no change to pressure applied to DP; indicating no leak. Test charted and successful. TOH. Perform BSR / Casing pressure test from Driller's panel Yellow pod.

10/06/2012: Complete BSR / Casing test on Yellow pod from Driller's panel to 250 psi/ 4300 psi. Function BSR/CSR on Yellow pod; Toolpusher's panel. TOH with LDS and inspect. Flow check: Static. Slip and cut drill line. RIH with 9-7/8" EZSV on 5" and 6-5/8". Perform BOP function test on Blue pod from Driller's panel. Function test diverter from Toolpusher's panel. TIH to 15;327'. Flow check: Static.

"},{"   ":146,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-10-07","TEXT_REMARK":"10/07/2012: Continue TIH to 17;800'. Set and test EZSV and circulate well. Spot 400' balanced plug. Pull above cement/spacer and circ DP wiper. Held stripping drill. Pressure test cement plug to 1000 psi and perform negative test; per APM. Begin TOH to 6;000' for top plug setting.

10/08/2012: TOH to 6;000'. Circulate and spot cement plug from 6;000' to 5;600'; per APM. Pull above to 5;320' and circulate ID wiper ball. Displace well to seawater. Displace treated drill water into wellhead. TOH with stinger and begin rigging down forward equipment for installation of riser handling equipment.

10/09/2012: R/D equipment from forward to prepare for riser operations. R/U equipment for BOP/Riser pulling operation. Pull diverter and lay out same. P/U riser landing joint; make up and lower same. Lock slip joint. Adjust tensioners and verify correct weights for unlatching LMRP. Unlatch BOP at 10:39 hrs. Secure SDC ring. Lay down landing joint and 16"  heavy wall spacer sub. Pull and lay out slip joint; intermediate flex joint; termination joint and 40' pup. Pull LMRP on marine riser to 4;317' (9 buoyed jts layed out).

10/10/2012: Continue pulling BOP on marine riser joints to surface. Disconnected and removed BOP from moonpool. L/D remaining 2 jts riser. R/D riser handling equipment from floor. Moved BOP to below rotary. L/D riser running tool. C/O bails; installing knuckle links to MDDM. Skid BOP center moonpool. Preparing BOP wash sub assy.
 
10/11/2012: Jet and skid BOP from moonpool to maintenance position. Begin maintenance scope: Disassembly of forward MDDM for C/O of main shaft. Aft cut/slip and L/D drill pipe to deck. Various departments begin maintenance tasks.
"},{"   ":147,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-07-10","TEXT_REMARK":"07/10/2018: Test choke manifold. Troubleshoot leaking valves on cement manifold. Retrieve bore protector. Set Dril-Quip combo test tool in surface wellhead to test tubing head gasket. Perform tubing head gasket test to 340 psi low for 5 minutes and 10;000 psi high for 30 minutes (good test).

07/11/2018: Finished 30 min high pressure tubing head gasket test - good test. Install service lines for rig. Reconfigure Dril-Quip combo tool for testing BOP and set same in surface wellhead. Perform line tests from cement unit to rig floor. Perform BOP testing as per IPT test plan.

07/12/2018: Perform BOP test as per IPT test plan using 5-7/8" DP from Primary station using 8.6 ppg seawater to 250 psi low/ 10;000 psi high. Test annular to 7;000 psi high. Test top drive safety valves and standpipe to 7;500 psi high.

Troubleshoot upper blind shear ram locks and resolve same. Perform surface line test with freshwater to 350 psi low - bad test. Leak on valve #13 on choke manifold. Troubleshoot and test same - bad test. Line up and perform low pressure surface line test with freshwater in preparation for BOP test #17. Observed leak on test stump connection; tighten same. Troubleshoot leaking valves on cement manifold. Perform test #7; as per IPT test procedure (no test; pressure exceeded 500 psi on low test; bled pressure off to retest). 

Perform accumulator drawdown test from maintenance control station. Function BOPs from secondary remote BOP control panel. Change out swivel packing and test to 7;500 psi.

07/13/2018: Rig Down BOP testing equipment. Verify torque of all BOP components. Pull out of hole with Dril-Quip combo tool. Install bore protector. Bleed off accumulator bottles and verify bottle pre-charge pressure. Perform CAD unit UPS draw down test. Stage BHA handling tools on rig floor. Makeup 9-1/2" bit and 10-3/4" cleanout BHA.

Note: On 07/13/2018 at 17:19 hrs; Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) gave approval to proceed through Step 4 of the completion procedure.

07/14/2018: Continue making up and TIH with 10-3/4" cleanout BHA to 1;030'. TIH; picking up 5-7/8" CTM-57 23.4 ppf drill pipe to 4;880' MD. 
"},{"   ":148,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-07-15","TEXT_REMARK":"07/15/2018: P/U and TIH with 5-7/8" DP from 5;267' to 5;403'. Displace seawater in wellbore to 11.5 ppg WBM. Drill cement stringers/ soft cement from 5;403' to 5;481'. Drill firm cement from 5;481' to 5;532'.

07/16/2018: Continue drilling out cement plug from 5;532' to 5;585'. Circulate and condition mud to 11.5 ppg and clean surface lines and equipment due to cement contamination. Continue drilling cement plug from 5;585' to 5;675'. 

07/17/2018: Continued drilling hard cement and stringers from 5;675' to 6;533'. Continue P/U and TIH with 5-7/8" DP to 6;852'. 

07/18/2018: Continue P/U and TIH with 5-7/8" DP from 6;852' to 12;339'; breaking circulation every 1;000 ft. 

07/19/2018: Circulate bottoms up at 12;337'. Continue P/U and TIH with 5-7/8" DP to 16;401'. Wash and ream from 16;401' to 17;004'. Function tested BOP from Driller's control panel. 

07/20/2018: Continue cleaning out casing from 17;004' to 17;266'; then wash down to 10-3/4" x 9-7/8" crossover at 17;286' DPM (drill pipe measurement). Pumped Hi-Vis sweep and circulate hole clean. TOH to 6;282' MD. 

07/21/2018: Continue TOH and L/D 10-3/4" BHA. P/U 9-7/8" BHA and TIH to 2;334'. Slip and cut 80 ft of drill line. Function tested UBSR and LBSR from Driller's control panel.
"},{"   ":149,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-07-22","TEXT_REMARK":"07/22/2018: Finish slip and cut of drill line. Continue TIH to 14;158'. Circulate and condition mud to 11.5 ppg. Continue TIH to 15;866'. Held pit drill with crew.

07/23/2018: Continue TIH from 15;866' to 17;286'. Wash and ream to 17;498'. Drill cement to 17;791'; top of EZSV. Drill out EZSV to 17;794'. Pump sweep and circulate hole clean; make wiper trip to 17;280'. TIH; tag at 19;619' with 20k down; wash and ream to 19;745'. 

07/24/2018: Drill cement. Wash and ream from 19;745' to 20;330'. Pump hi-vis sweep and circulate hole clean. Flow checked well - static. TOH to 17;191'. Circulate bottoms up.

07/25/2018: Finish circulating well clean at 17;191'. Clean mud pits and surface equipment in preparation for change over from 11.5 ppg WBM to 11.5 ppg SOBM. Test choke manifold per IPT test procedure to 250 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. ROV inspected riser and subsea wellhead.

07/26/2018: Secure well and muster due to fire on VRU skid on production deck. Returned to work once fire was extinguished and fire watch posted. Cleaning mud tanks and surface equipment. Take on 11.5 ppg SOBM for change over. Pressure test BOP to 250 psi low/ 6;500 psi high per IPT test procedure from Rig Manager's remote panel. Function tested BOP from main panel.

07/27/2018: TIH to 20;330'. Displace well from 11.5 ppg WBM to 11.5 ppg SOBM. Drill out 9-7/8" tieback shoe track from 20;330' to 20;647'. 

07/28/2018: Drill out cement from 20;647' to 20;946'; pump hi-vis sweep and circulate hole clean. Short trip to 20;218'. TIH and wash and ream strung out cement to 21;457'. 
"},{"   ":150,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-07-29","TEXT_REMARK":"07/29/2018: Wash and ream strung out cement from 21;457' to 22;396' and observe drilling break. Flow check well; well static. Trip in hole (TIH) from 22;396' to 22;964'. Tag with 20k down at 22;964'. Wash and ream strung out cement from 22;964' to top of EZSV at 24;341'. Pump hi-vis sweep and drill out EZSV from 24;341' to 24;350'. Observe drilling break at 24;350'. Flow check well; well static. Continue drilling strung out cement from 24;350' to 24;380'.

07/30/2018: Continue drilling strung out cement from 24;380' to 24;413'. Pump hi-vis sweep and circulate hole clean. Trip out of hole (TOH) from 24;380' to 24;260'. Observe 30k drag. Work pipe from 24;260' to 24;314' with no drag observed. TOH from 24;314' to 12;366'; washing production tieback gaps at 21;231' to 21;186' and 20;946' to 20;916'. 

07/31/2018: TOH from 12;366' to 5;267'. Circulate bottoms up (B/U). TOH from 5;267' to 1;020'. TOH with BHA from 1;020' to surface. Function tested upper and lower blind shear rams from Rig Manager's remote panel; good test. Rig up (R/U) gamma ray (GR)- casing collar locator (CCL) - junk basket (JB) BHA on E-line and run in hole (RIH) from surface to 15;866'. 

08/01/2018: Continue RIH with GR-CCL-JB BHA on E-line from 15;866' to 24;438'. Pull out of hole (POOH) from 24;438' to 696'. Replace hydraulic fitting on E-line spooler. Continue POOH from 696' to surface. Rig down (R/D) E-line equipment and change out drum on E-line unit. P/U permanent packer BHA and stage same on rig floor. Observe brakes not functioning properly on E-line drum. Lay down (L/D) permanent packer BHA and R/D E-line unit. Perform rig maintenance while waiting on replacement E-line unit. 

08/02/2018: Continue rig maintenance while waiting on replacement E-line unit. Function test BOP and BSRs from accumulator unit; good test. R/U replacement E-line unit and equipment and function test brakes; good test. P/U permanent packer BHA and RIH from surface to 24;066'. Log permanent packer on depth from 24;066'. Set permanent packer at 24;373'. POOH with E-line from 24;373' to 18;120'.

08/03/2018: Continue POOH with packer setting BHA on E-line from 18;120' to surface. Pressure test casing against lower BSR with 11.5 ppg SBM to 5;579 psi for 30 minutes; good test. P/U caliper-gyro BHA on E-line and RIH from surface to 5;687'. Perform gyro survey downlog from 5;687' to 17;366'. RIH from 17;366' to 17;466' with caliper-gyro BHA. Perform caliper log of casing from 17;466' to 5;167'. BSEE routine inspection performed on TLP from 08:30 hours to 12:00 hours. 

08/04/2018: Continue POOH with caliper-gyro BHA on E-line from 5;167' to surface. Perform function test of upper and lower BSRs from Primary and Secondary control stations; good test. R/D E-line equipment from rig floor. Function test BOP on 5-7/8" drill pipe from Primary and Secondary control stations; good test. Slip and cut drill line. P/U and RIH with displacement BHA and assemblies on drill pipe from surface to 6;471'. "},{"   ":151,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-08-05","TEXT_REMARK":"08/05/2018: TIH with displacement BHA to 11;734' MD. P/U RTTS packer and continued to TIH to 15;069' MD. Platform ESD tripped at 11:30 hours; reported to muster stations. Troubleshoot dynamic brake modules and blower fans. Continued TIH to 16;690' MD.

08/06/2018: TIH and set RTTS packer at 5;352' MD; bit depth 17;238' MD. Circulated and conditioned SOBM through RTTS bypass until 11.5 ppg in and out. Pumped 126 bbls of base oil to a pressure of 1;438 psi and closed bypass on RTTS. Bled off 10.75 bbls of base oil and observed no flow for 30 minutes. Pressured up down drill string to equalize pressure and opened bypass; allowing base oil to u-tube out. Reverse circulated until mud weight was 11.5 ppg. Released packer and began TOH to 13;455' MD.

08/07/2018: TOH from 13;455' to 11;734' and L/D RTTS packer. TIH with displacement assembly from 11;734' to 21;652'.

08/08/2018: Continue TIH with displacement assembly to 24;320'. Wash down; tagged PBTD at 24;373' with 10k down. Circulate and condition mud. TOH to 24;042'. Retrieve bore protector. Circulate and condition to balance mud at 23;947'. Set Dril-Quip test plug.

08/09/2018: Test choke manifold as per IPT procedure with 11.5 ppg mud to 250 psi low and 6;500 psi high. Attempt to test Dril-Quip test tool prior to testing BOP stack components; no test. Make various attempts to obtain a pressure test of the primary and back-up Dril-Quip test tools with no success due to leaking ball seat in tools.

08/10/2018: Continue troubleshooting Dril-Quip test plug with no success. Reconfigure test plug with safety valve. Pressure test BOPs with 11.5 ppg SBM as per IPT to 250 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. Test annular; inner and outer FSV; upper VBR; lower VBR from Primary control station.

08/11/2018: Function test BOPs from the Primary and Secondary control stations. Pressure test casing with 11.5 SBM against USBRs to 5;700 psi. Pressure test USBRs/LSBRs to 250 psi/ 5;500 psi with 11.5 ppg SBM from Secondary control station. Function test UBSRs/LSBRs from the Primary and Secondary control stations. L/D Dril-Quip test tool. Set bore protector. Perform BOP test 3 per IPT procedure on safety valve with 11.5 ppg mud to 250 psi low/ 10;000 psi high.  Perform BOP test 4 per IPT procedure on safety valve with 11.5 ppg mud to 250 psi low/ 6500 psi high. BOP testing complete. Clean volume return tank. TIH from 23;947' to 24;373' and tag PBTD with 10k down. P/U 5 ft off PBTD. Circulate and condition mud.
"},{"   ":152,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-08-12","TEXT_REMARK":"08/12/2018: Displace well from 11.5 ppg SBM to 10.4 ppg CaCl2 completion brine. Clean pits and lines of residual mud and solids. 

08/13/2018: Continue cleaning mud and solids from rig in preparation for completion operations. Clean flow line trough; return and fill lines; shakers and under shakers; rotary pollution pans; rig floor drain pans; trip tanks and all associated lines; and DP set back area.

08/14/2018: Continue cleaning rig's surface pits and lines. TOH to 21;660' to inspect top brush of cleanout assembly; OK. TIH to 24;041'. Continue cleaning pits and lines. 

08/15/2018: Continue cleaning rig's surface pits and lines. 

08/16/2018: Continue cleaning rig's surface lines. Begin installing frac lines on west side of drilling module (DM). 

08/17/2018: Continue cleaning rig's surface pits and lines. Jet BOP stack and function BOPE from Primary and Secondary control panels. Circulate bottoms up and TIH to 24;487'. 

08/18/2018: Reverse circulate and forward circulate well clean; filtering 10.4 ppg CaCl2 brine. Perform stripping test with range 3 joints in preparation for frac pack.  
"},{"   ":153,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-08-19","TEXT_REMARK":"08/19//2018: Performed stripping test; pressure test annular to 4500 psi to verify integrity after stripping. Performed power limit test on make safe generators and TOH with 5-7/8" drill pipe laying down cleanout assemblies.

08/20//2018: Finish TOH and L/D cleanout assemblies. R/U wireline and run in hole with sump packer assembly to 21;000' (midnight depth).

08/21//2018: Continue RIH with sump packer on e-line and set same at 24;320'. POOH and R/D wireline. Removed drill line from drum; burnished breaks; performed drawworks brake test; and cut 86 ft of drill line while testing choke manifold offline to 250 psi low; 6500 psi high. 

08/22//2018: Complete slip and cut of drill line. Pull wear bushing; set test plug and test BOP from Secondary station to 250 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. Function tested BOP from Primary and Secondary control stations. R/D test equipment and set wear bushing. Begin changing out drawworks brake actuators.

08/23//2018: Finish changing out drawworks brake actuators; test brakes to OEM specifications. P/U 107 ft of 6-5/8" 18 SPF TCP guns and assembly and TIH with same to 4;458' midnight depth. Function upper and lower blind shear rams from Primary and Secondary stations.

08/24//2018: Continue TIH with TCP assembly to 24;150'. Pick up space out pups and change out 500 ton bails with BX-4 elevators to 750 ton bails and BX-5 elevators.

08/25//2018: Finish TIH with TCP assembly. Snap in and out of sump packer at 24;320'. Pick up 8 ft; set Positest LS perforating packer; test same to 600 psi; initiate firing sequence for TCP assembly per Schlumberger procedure and perforate the Maroon target sand from 24;203' to 24;310' MD (22;730' to 22;837' TVD); 18 spf. Initial losses 24 bbl/hr; slowing to 2-3 bbl/hr. Reverse circulate 1-1/2 bottoms up to mud gas separator; no hydrocarbons observed. Unset TCP packer and TIH to tag sump packer at 24;320'; no fill. Well taking 2-3 bbl/hr. TOH with TCP BHA to 17;238'; midnight depth. 
"},{"   ":154,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-08-26","TEXT_REMARK":"08/26/2018: Finish POOH with TCP assembly; lay out same; confirm no misfires on guns; rig down TCP handling tools; rig up Weatherford and frac pack handling tools; pick up screens; blank joints and FS2 assembly.

08/27/2018: Picked up frac assembly; begin trip in hole; continue TIH in hole with frac pack assembly to 20;951'; midnight depth.

08/28/2018: Continued tripping in hole with Frac-Pack assembly from 20;951' to 24;167'. Reverse circulate string to flush string of excess pipe dope. Change out bails and elevators from 500T to 750T. TIH with Frac-Pack assembly from 24;167' to 24;245'. P/U frac head and M/U to string. Sting into sump packer with 20 klbs down at 24;340'. Snapped out of sump packer with 27k. Snapped back into sump packer and dropped 2.25" VCA packer setting ball at 12:30 hrs. Rigged up frac iron and tested same. Set VCA packer at 23;969' and performed backside test to 1;500 psi. Reverse out packer setting ball. Tested surface lines.

08/29/2018: Pumped 70 bbl pickle treatment down work string and reverse out same. Connected frac hose from MV Dolphin to TLP. Confirm tool position and sleeves are open. Established circulation rates and pressures. Flushed 2x surface lines with 8.6 KCl. Performed step rate test. Reversed out nini-frac fluid. Perform main frac. Attempt to pick up to reverse out position. Troubleshoot Nabors drawworks brakes.

08/30/2018: Troubleshoot Nabors drawworks brake fault; repair same. Picked up to reverse out position and attempted to reverse out with mud pumps. Maintain 6;500 psi on annulus while applying 2;000 psi to DP. Bleed pressure off DP to surge sand loose. Unsuccessful after multiple attempts to initiate reverse circulation. Bleed back side to 1;000 psi and strip down 28 ft. Bleed off pressure on back side; open annular BOP and monitor well on trip tank. Rigged down 4" chicksan iron from frac head. R/U 2" chicksan iron to frac head to cement manifold. Slack off drill string to position service tools in squeeze position with 85k weight down on VCA packer @ 23;070'. Monitor well: Shut in drill pipe pressure built to 510 psi. Annulus static. 

08/31/2018: Monitoring shut in drill pipe pressure. Observed pressure increase from 510 psi to 1;638 psi. Monitoring annulus on trip tank (static). Preparing for coil tubing clean out.

09/01/2018: Monitoring shut in drill pipe pressure. Observed pressure increase from 1;638 psi to 1;670 psi. Monitoring annulus on trip tank (static). Preparing for coil tubing clean out. 

Note: Due to pending coil tubing operations; requested BSEE approval to delay BOP function testing and pressure testing. Mr. Nelson of BSEE Houma District granted email approval to delay BOP function and pressure testing for a period of 7 days while pursuing remedial action. 
"},{"   ":155,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-09-02","TEXT_REMARK":"09/02/2018: Continue monitoring shut in DP pressure; 1;667 psi. Monitor annulus on trip tank (static). Back load equipment to make room for coil tubing spread. Off load coil tubing rig up equipment. Spot beams and secure with clamps; spot turn table to beams and secure same.

09/03/2018: Continue monitoring shut in DP pressure; 1;667 psi. Monitor annulus on trip tank (static). Finalize installation of coil tubing support beams and turn table. Prepare TLP for TS Gordon.

09/04/2018: Continue monitoring shut in DP pressure; 1;667 psi. Monitor annulus on trip tank (static). Perform negative test on upper and lower frac valves (failed). Continue monitoring shut in DP pressure; 1;683 psi. Monitor annulus on trip tank (static). 

09/05/2018: Continue monitoring shut in DP pressure; 1;678 psi. Monitor annulus on trip tank (static). Develop plan to test while discussing forward plan with Houston office. Bled off total of two barrels of fluid from DP in one-barrel increments and monitor pressure build for 30 minutes for each step. Continue R/U coil tubing equipment on pipe rack.

09/06/2018: Bled one barrel of fluid from DP / 655 psi to 50 psi. Supreme field tech greased lower and upper frac valves. Perform negative test on lower frac valve with 1;600 psi differential - good test. Equalize pressure from cement unit to lower frac valve; open lower frac valve and monitor shut in DP pressure on choke manifold; 1;620 psi. Monitor annulus on trip tank (static). Continue R/U coil tubing equipment on pipe rack.

09/07/2018: Continue monitoring shut in DP pressure; 1;620 psi. Monitor annulus on trip tank (static). Off load MV Charlie Comeaux and Juan C. Continue R/U coil tubing equipment. Test two 5-7/8" safety valves to 250 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. 

09/08/2018: Continue monitoring shut in DP pressure; 1;620 psi. Monitor annulus on trip tank (static). Off load Staged Weatherford tongs and equip to rig floor. Perform negative test on lower frac valve - good test. Remove upper frac valve. Install adapter flange and 5-1/8" 15k gate valve to lower frac valve in preparation for rigging up coil tubing. Continue monitoring annulus on trip tank (static).

Note: Received approval from Mr. Adriano Garcia (BSEE) via after hours email to delay function and pressure testing of BOP for an additional 7 days. 
"},{"   ":156,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-09-09","TEXT_REMARK":"09/09/2018: Perform shell test on 5-1/8" 15M gate valve and connections to 350 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. Performed 30-minute negative test to 1;550 psi on 5-1/8" 15M gate valve; and on lower frac valve. M/U Schlumberger upper and lower 15M dual combination rams; flow cross to 5-1/8" 15M gate valve. R/U control lines to coil tubing BOPs; stage injector head and guide to rig floor.

09/10/2018: R/U Schlumberger coil tubing injector head. Un-spool coil and stab 1.75" CT into injector head. R/U Supreme remote BOP panel and associated equipment. Perform connector pull test to 35 klb; pump 0.75" ball and 1.75" foam pig through CT. Function test CT BOPs. Commence pressure testing CT BOPs.

Note: On 09/10/2018; received approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to proceed through step 2 of the coil tubing clean out procedure for testing coiled tubing BOPs to 250-350 psi low and 6;500 psi high while waiting on RPM approval for A-1 Nevada well.

09/11/2018: Continue pressure testing CT BOPs to 250-350 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. M/U DSA BHA on coil tubing string; stab injector; complete pressure testing same.

09/12/2018: Pick up injector head; make up BHA; re-stab injector head; perform coil tubing accumulator drawdown test; pressure test connection and surface lines to 250-350 psi low/ 6;500 psi high.

09/13/2018: Establish pump parameters; equalize pressure on drill string and run in hole with coil tubing at 50 ft/min; pumping 10.4 ppg brine at 0.26 bpm to 13;000'.  Displace well to 10.4 ppg brine and continue to RIH with coil tubing; pumping at 1.5 bpm to 16;000'. No indication of solids/sand in drill pipe or returns.

09/14/2018: RIH with coil tubing in 1;000 ft increments from 16;000' to 19;000'; circulating bottoms up at each incremental depth (17;000'; 18;000'; 19;000'). RIH with coil tubing in 100 ft increments from 19;000' to 19;200'; circulating bottoms up at each incremental depth (19;100'; 19;200'). No solids in returns.

Note: On 09/14/2018; received approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to delay BOP function and BOP/Casing pressure testing for a further period of 7 days while pursuing remedial action.

09/15/2018: RIH with coil tubing in 100 ft increments from 19;200' to 19;500'; circulating bottoms up at each incremental depth (19;300'; 19;400'; 19;500'). No solids in returns. Encounter top of sand at 19;537' MD.  Pump sweep and circulate bottoms up; continue washing in hole to 19;937'.
"},{"   ":157,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-09-16","TEXT_REMARK":"09/16/2018: RIH with coil tubing; washing from 19;937' to 21;250' MD; pumping sweeps and circulating bottoms up as needed.

09/17/2018: RIH with coil tubing; washing from 21;250' to 23;400' MD; pumping sweeps as needed. Stopped and circulated bottoms up at 22;600' MD and 23;400' MD.

09/18/2018: RIH with coil tubing; washing from 23;400' MD at 1.75 bpm; pumping sweeps as needed; tag 3-1/2" cross over inside drill pipe at 24;181' MD (coil tbg measurement); 24;088' (drill pipe measurement). Pump 2.5 bbl gel sweep and circulate drill pipe clean at 1.78 bpm.

09/19/2018: Pump sweep and circulate drill pipe clean at 24;178' with 10.2 ppg CaCl2 brine. Use choke manifold to simulate 10.4 ppg fluid equivalent (holding 236 psi back pressure) and monitor volumes for 5 min. No gains or losses observed. Displace drill pipe with 10.4 ppg CaCl2 brine and pull out of hole to surface with coil tubing.

09/20/2018: Close lower frac valve to isolate drill string; perform negative inflow test for 15 minutes. Displace coil tubing reel with 8.6 ppg drill water; flush surface lines and test lower frac valve to 4;200 psi for 5 minutes. Displace coil with dry N2; rig down coil running equipment and surface lines from rig floor.

09/21/2018: Attempted to remove lower frac pup joint with no success due to the PS-30 slips not releasing. Successfully released PS-30 slips and changed to backup set. Picked up frac pack service tool into reverse position and commenced reversing out workstring.

09/22/2018: Reversed 3x bottoms up through workstring and picked up on service tool to close FS-2 and MCS valves. Performed pressure test against casing; and closed FS-2 and MCS valves to 1;000 psi for 5 minutes (limited by MCS differential pressure rating). Changed out bails; elevators; and POOH with workstring to 6;837'.

Note: On 09/22/2018 at 10:14 hrs; received approval from Mr. Sanders (BSEE) to delay BOP function and pressure testing for a further period of 24 hours and casing pressure testing for a further 7 days while limited by the differential rating of the MCS.
"},{"   ":158,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-09-23","TEXT_REMARK":"09/23/2018: Continued pulling out of hole. Laid out gravel pack service tool; wash pipe and BHA. Pulled wear bushing; set test plug and test BOP to 250/6;500 psi with 10.4 ppg CaCl2 brine.

09/24/2018: Finish pressure testing BOPs to 250/6;500 psi from Primary station. Pressure test BSR to 250/6;500 psi from Primary station. Function test BOP from Primary and Secondary stations. Pull test plug and set bore protector; slip and cut 120' drill line. Begin picking up cleanout BHA.

09/25/2018: Pick up Halliburton cleanout assembly. Trip in hole (TIH) to 19;798'. 

09/26/2018: Continue TIH to 23;968'; 1 ft above VCA packer. Recorded baseline parameters and activate Vac Tech assembly. Perform cleanout above FS2 and wash out from VCA packer to inside of FS2 from 24;036' to 24;044' (FS2 ball @ 24;050'). TOH to 6;952' MD.

09/27/2018: TOH to surface with Halliburton Cleanwell BHA and lay down same. Open Vac Tech chambers and recovered minimal debris. Performed rig maintenance upgrade to drawworks brakes. Rig up to pick up 3-1/2" top-off assembly.

09/28/2018: Pick up top-off BHA and TIH to 472'. Serviced rig floor equipment; replaced drill line cable guide and TIH to 15;672'. 

Note: On 09/28/2018; Mr. Adriano Garcia (BSEE) approved delaying BOP testing for an additional 7 days or when MCS valve is isolated; whichever comes first.

09/29/2018: Continued to TIH with top-off BHA from 15;672' to 20;757'. Performed rig maintenance and troubleshot PRS-8 single joint elevators. Reverse circulated dope ball out of string; TIH to 24;336' and M/U frac head/iron. Established top-off tool positions and record parameters."},{"   ":159,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-09-30","TEXT_REMARK":"09/30/2018: Pressure test frac iron to 7;000 psi. Reverse circ one DP volume. Test pop-off valves. Perform re-stress of frac pack from Baker frac vessel; final test of 1 BPM @ 1;018 psi provided confirmation of good annular pack. R/D frac iron. TOH and log with ProTechnics from 24;336' to 24;042'. Dump seals and close FS-2 valve. Test FS-2 valve with 1;105 psi; OK. Continue log up with ProTechnics from 24;042' to 23;848'. TOH to 17;534'. Function BOPs from Primary and from Secondary stations.

10/01/2018: TOH from 17;534' to surface with Halliburton top-off BHA and L/D same. Slip and cut drill line. 

10/02/2018: Continue troubleshooting drawworks drill line anchor; received instructions from the manufacturer; CANRIG; on how to modify the anchor segments to the correct tolerances. Finish slipping and cutting drill line. P/U and RIH with isolation assembly to 107'.

10/03/2018: Finish P/U Halliburton isolation assembly to 520'. Crossover to 5-7/8" DP and TIH with isolation assembly to 18;815'; Midnight depth.

10/04/2018: Continue TIH with Halliburton isolation assembly to 24;023'. Land PFZ locator in VCA packer @ 23;969' DPM. Mule Shoe @ 24;026' DPM. Set VCH packer @ 23;520' DPM. Release from packer. TOH to 10;758'. 

10/05/2018: TOH with packer setting tool and L/D same. Pressure test casing to 250-300 psi low and 4;200 psi high for 30 minutes; good test. Perform derrick management to prepare for completion operations. M/U Halliburton CleanWell assembly and jet wellhead. Retrieve bore protector. Jet wellhead with Halliburton CleanWell assembly after pulling bore protector. L/D CleanWell assembly.

10/06/2018: Set Dril-Quip combo test tool. Function test upper and lower BSRs from Primary and from Secondary stations. Pressure test BOPs to 250 psi/ 6;500 psi from Secondary station. Function BOPs from Primary and from Secondary stations. Back out of Dril-Quip combo tool and pressure test upper and lower BSRs to 250 psi/ 6;500 psi from Secondary station. Retrieve BOP test tool and L/D same. M/U Halliburton CleanWell assembly. RIH and jet from 72' to 97'. TOH and L/D CleanWell assembly. Prepare rig floor for ESP sheaves. Perform well control pit drill. Hang Baker Hughes ESP sheaves.
"},{"   ":160,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-10-07","TEXT_REMARK":"10/07/2018: Function upper and lower blind shear rams from Primary and Secondary stations. Function BOPs from Primary and Secondary stations. Install 4 Halliburton control line sheaves. M/U FOSV to crossover subs. M/U kill stand #1. Nabors repaired rotary table lock. R/U Weatherford StabMaster on V-Door Machine (VDM). M/U kill stand #2. R/U Weatherford trip master; 500-Ton spider in rotary. Test power-scope and StabMaster ZMS. Stage Baker electric submersible pump (ESP); motor lead extension (MLE) spool and unit to rig floor. 

10/08/2018: Perform ZMS checks between catwalk machine (CWM); ST-120 iron roughneck and power-scope. Verify ZMS interlocks at different block heights with StabMaster & TDS. Function upper and lower blind shear rams from Primary and Secondary Stations. P/U 3-1/2" mule shoe and RIH on 3-1/2" 10.2# VAM tubing and TIH to 216'. M/U chemical injection mandrel (CIM)/ downhole temperature gauge (DHTG) assembly and tubing encapsulated conductor (TEC) line. Continue P/U 3-1/2" 10.2# VAM tubing and RIH to 1;913'. 

10/09/2018: Continue RIH with completion assembly; 3-1/2" 10.2# VAM tubing; to 6;430'. M/U safety valve. Suspend operations due to high winds associated with Hurricane Michael. Monitor well on trip tank; static.

10/10/2018: Continue WOW for 18 hours. Begin running ESP assemblies.

10/11/2018: Continue RIH with lower ESP motor and pump assembly.

10/12/2018: Finish running lower ESP assembly and begin running upper ESP assembly.

10/13/2018: Finish running upper ESP assembly. M/U production packer and motor lead extension (MLE) penetrators. Run control lines through packer and splice and test same.
"},{"   ":161,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-10-14","TEXT_REMARK":"10/14/2018: Splice and test chemical injection line to 10;000 psi. Pick up string and adjust adjustable union to remove slack from motor lead extension (MLE) cable; secure same with clamps. Change out tubing encapsulated conductor (TEC) spool due to back lash and feed new TEC line through packer.

10/15/2018: Install and test TEC line to 16;000 psi for 15 minutes; splice and install chemical injection line and test same to 10;000 psi for 15 minutes; splice and test MLE cables. Install RA tag in first joint of tubing and RIH picking up 5-1/2" tubing to 8;019'.

10/16/2018: Continue P/U 5-1/2" production tubing and RIH from 8;019' to 12;341'.

10/17/2018: Continue P/U 5-1/2" production tubing and RIH from 12;341' to 12;897'. Lost continuity with upper ESP motor. Troubleshoot; decision made to TOH. Pull and L/D 5-1/2" tubing from 12;897' to 11;879'; checking continuity every 6 joints.

10/18/2018: TOH with 5-1/2" production tubing from 11;879' to 6;908'; checking continuity every 10 stands. 

10/19/2018: Continue TOH with 5-1/2" production tubing from 6;908' to 6;829'. Inspect "Y" blocks. Slack off to 6;908' and conduct continuity checks (all tests failed). Sever ESP cables below splices and test continuity (both tests passed). Test MLE pigtails (both tests failed). Removed both ESP spools from rig floor. Replaced same with new ESP cable and spools.

10/20/2018: Spot ESP spools on rig floor. POOH and L/D ESP assemblies. Check motors for continuity to locate ground fault.
"},{"   ":162,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-10-21","TEXT_REMARK":"10/21/2018: Finish TOH and L/D lower ESP assembly. R/D MLE spoolers and handling equipment. Prep tools to be sent to shore for evaluation. Prepare to test back up ESP equipment. Monitoring well on trip tank; static.

10/22/2018: Backload primary ESP equipment for shipment to Baker for failure diagnostics. Deck test back-up ESP equipment and prepare to RIH. Monitoring well on trip tank; static.

10/23/2018: Baker continued performing tests on back-up ESP equipment components on pipe rack and performed electrical tests on ESP spoolers (good test). Nabors continued with daily rig PMs and general housekeeping. Monitoring well on trip tank; static.

10/24/2018: Baker performing diagnostics of ESP equipment at Claremore; OK; facility. Weatherford inspecting equipment. Nabors continue with daily rig PMs and general housekeeping. Monitoring well on trip tank; static. 

10/25/2018: Baker performing diagnostics of ESP equipment at Claremore; OK; facility. Weatherford inspecting equipment. Nabors continue with daily rig PMs and general housekeeping. Monitoring well on trip tank; static.

10/26/2018: Weatherford inspecting equipment. Nabors continue with daily rig PMs and general housekeeping. Decision made to complete well without ESPs due to results of testing by Baker. Prepare rig floor to TOH and L/D 3-1/2" tubing. TOH and L/D 3-1/2" tubing from 6;271' to 5;537'. Monitoring well on trip tank; static.

10/27/2018: TOH L/D 3-1/2" tubing from 5;537' to 2;733'. Service rig floor equipment. TOH L/D 3-1/2" tubing from 2;733' to 251'. L/D chemical injection mandrel. TOH L/D 3-1/2" tubing from 251' to surface. Close UBSR. R/D tubular running equipment. Begin testing BOPE to 250 psi low/ 6;500 psi high per IPT test sequence with 10.4 ppg brine. Monitoring well on choke line; static.
"},{"   ":163,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-10-28","TEXT_REMARK":"10/28/2018: Complete BOP and safety valves testing to 250-300 psi/ 6;500 psi with 10.4 ppg CaCl2; successful test. TOH and L/D BOP test plug and finish testing safety valves to 250-300 psi/ 6;500 psi with 10.4 ppg CaCl2; successful test. Pressure test BSRs to 250 psi/ 6;500 psi. Function test upper and lower BSRs from Primary and Secondary panels. Function test BOP from Primary and Secondary panels. R/D test iron and clean and clear rig floor of same.

Note: On 10/28/2018 at 13:53 hours; Doug Mowat (Chevron) received approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) to proceed as requested to add the permanent gauge carrier and gauge to the upper completion.

10/29/2018: Waiting on CPU card for CAD unit and install new CPU card and power up remote panels upon arrival. Function test UBSR/LBSR from Primary and Secondary remote panels successfully. RIH with one (1) stand of 5-7/8" DP and function test all VBRs and Annular from Primary and Secondary remote panels successfully. P/U production assembly and begin TIH to 91'.

Notes:
At 08:07 hours on 10/29/2018; Thomas Ahlf (Chevron) sent email notification to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) advising that the CAD unit CPU experienced a card failure that rendered the primary & secondary BOP control stations inoperable. Advised that the BOP is functional from the CAD unit & that a man will stand by the unit at all times. The well is secured with the UBSR closed & the well is being monitored on the choke gauge. Operations are suspended until repairs & successful function testing are completed. 

At 19:35 hours on 10/29/2018; Thomas Ahlf sent email notification to Bobby Nelson advising that the CAD unit CPU card was replaced & the unit powered up as it should. The remote stations' lights & data values were restored & data is accurate. We performed a full function test from the primary & secondary control stations & confirmed that we have full functionality of the BOP as designed.

10/30/2018: P/U seal assembly and RIH with 54 stds of 5-1/2" tubing from the derrick to 7;281' and install the downhole pressure temperature gauge (DHPTG). Terminated TEC line and performed external test to 25;000 psi for 15 minutes; good test. Continue to RIH with tubing to 7;387'.

10/31/2018: Continue to pick up and RIH with 5-1/2" C-110 tubing from 7;387' to 13;752'.

11/01/2018: Continue to pick up and RIH with 5-1/2" C-110 tubing from 13;752' to 15;602'. Make up SCSSV and CIM to tubing. Successfully function SCSSV and pressure test control lines and continue to TIH with 5-1/2" tubing from 15;602' to 18;494'.

11/02/2018: Continue to TIH with 5-1/2" tubing from 18;494' to 20;003' and repair/replace slips. Continue to TIH with 5-1/2" tubing from 20;003' to 23;683'.

Note: On 11/02/2018 at 7:07 hours; Carl Simonson (Chevron) received email approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) for a 4 day casing test extension to allow running of the upper completion.

11/03/2018: Change out tubing handling elevators to DP elevators and wash down to engage tubing packer seals into the packer seal bore. While pulling stand; experienced 20 k-lbs overpull and the string became hung up. Worked string clear and pull tubing mule shoe above packer seal bore and displaced annulus with 10.4 ppg CaCl2 inhibited packer fluid. Sting back into packer seal bore; pick up tubing hanger; and begin terminating control lines at hanger.

"},{"   ":164,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-11-04","TEXT_REMARK":"11/04/2018: RIH with tubing hanger on running tool (THRT) and landing string. Attempt to test SCSSV lines from surface to 8500 psi. Test failed. Attempt to recover tubing hanger to surface. Obstruction preventing string from moving up. Attempt to land tubing hanger. Obstruction preventing landing of tubing hanger. Bore scope indicated damaged THRT assy. 

11/05/2018: R/U slickline to set hold open sleeve at SCSSV and RPT plug.

Note: On 11/05/2018 at 16:06 hours; Jonathan Michalec (Chevron) received email approval from Adriano Garcia (BSEE) to proceed with operations for establishing a secondary barrier in the A-1 Nevada well. RPM approval is required for performing the remedial work to follow.

11/06/2018: Rig up slickline lubricator and test to 7;000 psi. RIH and retrieve HXT isolation sleeve. M/U tool string and test quick test sub (QTS) to 7;000 psi. RIH and install wear sleeve in HXT. 

11/07/2018: Make up tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. RIH to SCSSV at 8;046' SLM.

11/08/2018: Set hold open sleeve at 8;034' across SCSSV. Make up tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. RIH with 2.5" gauge ring to 23;845' MD. M/U tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. RIH with 2.562" RPT plug and set at 23;845' in RPT nipple. M/U tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. RIH with 2.562" prong plug and junk basket to RPT plug at 23;845' MD. M/U tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. RIH and retrieve wear sleeve from HXT. M/U tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. RIH with HXT isolation sleeve. Attempt to test isolation sleeve unsuccessfully. M/U tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. Retrieve isolation sleeve. Seals missing from sleeve.

Note: On 11/08/2018 at 12:25 hours; Jonathan Michalec (Chevron) received approval from Adriano Garcia (BSEE) to delay casing test until the 12th of November due to current well operations.

11/09/2018: Redress isolation sleeve. M/U tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. RIH and set isolation sleeve across HXT. Test wellbore (Sleeve; lubricator; RPT plug and prong) to 4;200 psi. R/D slickline lubricator; bell nipple; pollution pan. R/U to lift BOP stack from BOP spool.

11/10/2018: Break RBC connection. Lower riser by relieving pressure on tensioning cylinders while lifting BOPs. Remove damaged components from THRT. Make up BOP to BOP spool RBC. Land tubing hanger. Test TH body seals. 
"},{"   ":165,"WELL_NAME":" A001","API12":608124006200,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-11-11","TEXT_REMARK":"11/11/2018: Install tubing hanger/ production tree safety valve and chemical injection valves. Pressure test tree safety valve 1 & 2; chemical injection valve 1 & 2 and associated seals to 7;500 psi. Rigged up well bay hoists to viewing valve in preparation to remove. 

11/12/2018: Removed viewing valve from ESP port and installed blind flange. Pressure tested RMS/ ESP flange/ gallery to 7;500 psi. Rigged up to purge SCSSV control lines. Released from tubing hanger and pulled landing string to surface. Observed tubing hanger running tool (THRT) had backed off at top connection. Nipple down bell nipple/ slip joint and lay out on deck. Nipple down BOP and secure in setback area (BOP removed from well at 14:15 hrs). Make up (M/U) BOP spool running tool and Radial Bolt connection (RBC) run/retrieval tool; run and engage RBC. Break out RBC bolts at production tree. 

Note: Wayne Bridgeman with Chevron notified BSEE Houma district on 11/12/18 @ 15:33 that tubing hanger had been landed and tested and therefore no further operational testing of the production casing was planned. 

11/13/2018: Pull BOP spool joint to rig floor and lay out same. Remove THRT. Disconnect SCSSV control lines from tubing hanger. Rig up and pressure test SCSSV lines to 8;500 psi from horizontal flange outlet access. Test tree to wellhead outlet assembly to 9;750 psi. Rig up and test tree to wellhead pin connector to 9;750 psi.

11/14/2018: Rig up slickline assembly. Installed neck seal and DX-1 gasket. Installed crown valve and confirmed crown valve fully seated. Test annular gallery below hanger neck to 10;000 psi to verify pressure integrity of DX-1 gasket. Nippled up slickline lubricator; slickline BOP and side entry sub.

11/15/2018: Test lubricator against crown valve to 7;000 psi. RIH with slickline and retrieve to surface isolation sleeve in tubing hanger. M/U temporary crown plug tool string and test Quick Test Sub (QTS) to 7;000 psi. Set temporary crown plug. Pressure test temporary crown plug to 1;000 psi. M/U retrieval tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. Pressure test tubing hanger neck seals against crown valve and crown plug to 10;000 psi. RIH retrieve temporary crown plug. M/U wear sleeve tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. Run and set wear sleeve. M/U hold open sleeve retrieval tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. RIH and retrieve hold open from across SCSSV (wear sleeve rode hold open sleeve retrieval tool out of hole). M/U back-up wear sleeve and test QTS to 7;000 psi. Pressure test tubing to 1;000 psi against 2.56" RPT plug. Perform inflow test on SCSSV and bled to 248 psi. Pressure up control lines and tubing to open SCSSV. RIH and set tubing hanger wear sleeve. 

11/16/2018: Make up GR pulling tool; test lubricator to 7;000 psi. RIH with slickline to 23;845'. Latch on and retrieve RPT plug. Opened FS2 valve; bullheaded 300 bbls base oil down tubing. Closed SCSSV. Bleed down pressure to negatively test the SCSSV. Final pressure 218 psi; results of negative test approved by Lead Drill Site Manager; Superintendent; and operations operator. M/U tool string and test QTS to 7;000 psi. Run and set crown plug on slickline. Pressure test crown plug with 6;500 psi. Close crown valve and pressure test to 6;500 psi. Rig down slickline and install night cap on crown valve. Prep rig for skidding operations.

Note: Debbie Campise (Chevron) submitted rig movement notification via eWell on 11/16/2018.

11/17/2018: Prepare to skid rig. Commence skid rig from A001 "Nevada" to A004 "Colorado" well. "},{"   ":166,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2011-12-09","TEXT_REMARK":"12/09/2011: TIH with 26" Conductor on 6-5/8" DP. Tag bottom at 5285'. Spud well and jet from 5285' to 5390'. 

12/10/2011: Con't to jet from 5390' to 5592'. Soak 36" casing. Release from CADA and drill ahead with 26" assembly to 6118'.

"},{"   ":167,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2011-12-11","TEXT_REMARK":"12/11/2011: Directionally drill from 6118' to 7191' with 26" Rock Bit & Motor Assembly.

12/12/2011: Continue to drill to 7603'. AROP: 17.1 FPH.
