12/13/2011: Continue to drill to 7781'. AROP: 14.2 FPH. TOH with 26" Rock Bit on Aft. RIH with 26" PDC Salt BHA and drill ahead from 7781' to 7818'.

12/14/2011: Continue drilling to 8660'. AROP: 25 FPH.

12/15/2011: (Fwd) Continue drilling to 8941' TD. Spot 16 ppg mud in 50 ft rat hole and displaced the rest of the hole with 13 ppg PAD mud and POOH. (Aft) Continue to run 22" casing to 3574 ft. Run Inner String and M/U MRLD in 22" casing.

12/16/2011: RIH with 22" casing on 6-5/8" DP and land out HPWH at 8886'. R/U and begin cement job.

12/17/2011: Finish cementing 22" casing. POOH with MRLD and Inner String.
"},{"   ":168,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2011-12-18","TEXT_REMARK":"12/18/2011: Continue to pick up and run riser. Midnight depth 4;317' (57 joints).
Offline - PU and rack back 18 1/8" clean out BHA; wear sleeve stand with Dril-Quip wear sleeve; and test plug BHA.

12/19/2011: Continue running riser and jewelry from 4;317' to 5;200' (slip joint). Install drape hoses and test mood boost line. Flush choke and kill lines with seawater and test same. Stroke out slip joint and grease inner barrel. Lock in inner barrel and remove half moon clamp.

12/20/11: Finish riser operations; latch and test connector. Test casing to 250 psi low / 1;300 psi high. Perform turn test for slip joint and perform deadman test. Rig down riser handling equipment and rig up drill pipe handling equipment. Trip in hole with 18-1/8" BOP test BHA.
Offline - PU 16-1/2" x 19" BHA. Begin to pick up 6-5/8" 50# DP.

12/21/11: Finish tripping in hole with testing BHA. Perform diverter flow/function test. Begin BOP testing and encounter disparity in gauge readings. Troubleshoot Halliburton test chart pressures. Resume testing BOPs. 
NOTE: (1) Tested against 6-5/8" DP only; the APD indicated testing against both 6-5/8" and 5-7/8"; however the first hole section only required 6-5/8" DP. This was discussed with Mr. Nelson with the BSEE on 12/19/2011 and his agreement to test only on 6-5/8" DP was obtained. (2) VBR tests performed against test rams rather than against a test plug due to an issue with the spaceout subs for the test tool. The APD indicated testing against a test plug; this issue was discussed with Mr. Nelson with the BSEE on 12/20/2011 and his verbal agreement obtained prior to conducting the tests.

12/22/11:  Completed BOP tests. POOH with test assembly. RIH with 18-1/8" cleanout assy; set wear bushing and continue in hole. Wash top of plug; prepare to displace hole from seawater to 11.0 ppg Rheliant. Displace surface lines and manifolds.

12/23/11: Displace well from seawater to 11.0 ppg Rheliant. Drill cement and shoe track. Drill and clean out 26" rathole to 8;941'. Begin drilling 10' new formation to 8;950'.

12/24/11: Finish drilling 10' of new formation to 8;951'. Circ BU into riser. Perform FIT with 11.1 ppg to 12.7 ppg (EMW - 740 psi). POOH with cleanout assy. Cut and slip drill line. RIH with 16.5" x 19" steerable assy to 1;347'. Note: Fire in Bosun's store (see Significant Events for description).

"},{"   ":169,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2011-12-25","TEXT_REMARK":"12/25/2011: TIH with 16.5" x 19" steerable assy. Log and wash to bottom. Take SPRs and establish parameters. Drill to 9;053' and activate reamer. Ream up to 9;043'. Drill 16.5" x 19" hole to 9;300'.

12/26/2011: Drilling 16.5" x 19" hole from 9;300' to 10;325'.

12/27/11: Directionally drilled 16.5" x 19" hole from 10;325' to 11;420' - survey and downlink as required.

12/28/11: Directionally drilled 16.5" x 19" hole from 11;420' to 12;590' - survey and downlink as required.

12/29/11:  Directionally drilled 16.5" x 19" hole from 11;590' to BOS at 12;936' - survey and downlink as required. Began circulating bottoms up from BOS. Encountered losses to hole and decision to spot 200 LCM pill; TOH 1;000' above pill and displaced well from 11.3 to 11.0 ppg Rheliant SBM.

12/30/11: Completed displacing wellbore from 11.3 ppg to 11.0 ppg SBM. TIH and wash kelly stand to bottom at 12;941'. Continue drilling ahead from 12;941' to 13;243'.

12/31/11: Directionally drill ahead with 16.5" x 19" steerable assy from 13;243' to 14;730' (section TD). Circulated pills around to clean hole prior to TOH.
Note: Section TD is 60' shallower than shown in the APD. This depth was selected to be approximately the same geologic marker as shown in the APD and to ensure the shoe was in a clean shale section.

"},{"   ":170,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-01-01","TEXT_REMARK":"01/01/2012: Completed circulating hole clean from 14;730'. TOH with drlg assy and R/B BHA; meanwhile rigged up to run 16" casing on Aft. Downloaded MWD data. Performed BSR/CSR function test followed by boosting riser.

01/02/2012: Changed saver sub on Fwd and serviced rig. Rigged up for 16" casing on Fwd. Ran 4 joints 16" casing in hole. Stopped to make repairs to Fwd PRS. Picked up single 16" csg from Fwd conveyor. Dropped single joint 16" casing across rig floor from Aft PLS. Made up single from Fwd conveyor to string and stopped job performing investigation followed by removing single joint damaged casing from rig floor. Performed risk assessment and developed plan to move forward running casing.

01/03/2012: Completed developing plan to move ahead with casing run. Drifted stand #6 from the derrick. Picked up single from Aft conveyor to Fwd rotary. Continue running 16" casing as per tally / POA from 214' to 4032'.

01/04/2012: RIH with 16" casing to 9;015'. Picked up hanger. Rigged down Frank's casing equipment; rigged up Frank's DP equipment to run landing string. RIH with casing on landing string to 11;216' (function tested diverter at 9;327')

01/05/2012: Ran 16" casing to 14;567'; landing same in 16" adaptor. Circulated prior to cement job. Cemented and displaced cement. Set seal assy and tested packoff. Attempted to shear off of packoff - no shear seen. Tested down annulus confirming packoff not set. Laid out cement stand and spaced out to close annular preventer. Closed in well and WOC.
Note: Obtained waiver from Mr. Nelson; BSEE; for a 24 hour extension on the BOP tests. 

01/06/2012: WOC; test BOPs on 6-5/8" drill pipe; POOH; TIH with Mill & Flush Assy.

01/07/2012: Test BOPs on 6-5/8" drill pipe. TOH with landing string complete with seal assy packoff. Rigged down Frank's bails; rigged up link tilt and rig bails / elevators. Made up mill/flush assy complete with 5-7/8" test assy and TIH.

"},{"   ":171,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-01-08","TEXT_REMARK":"01/08/2012: Continue to test BOPs on 5-7/8" DP. TIH with Mill & Flush Assembly. Mill/Flush 16" hanger. TOH with Mill & Flush Assembly. P/U and RIH with Seal Assembly Running Tool. 

01/09/2012: Continue RIH with Seal Assembly Running Tool and set seal in 16" hanger. Test 16" casing to 250 psi low / 4;500 psi high. Test BSR's. POOH. TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA.

01/10/2012: TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA. Tag cement and drill shoe track. Circ hole clean.

01/11/2012: Perform FIT. Unsuccessful. POOH and TIH with FASDrill.

01/12/2012: FASDrill Plugged. Unable to Circulate. POOH. P/U 14-1/2" Cleanout BHA.

01/13/2012: Continue to TIH with 14-1/2" Cleanout BHA to 14;250'. Circulate hole clean. POOH. P/U 16" FASDrill and TIH.

01/14/2012: Continue POOH. P/U 16" FASDrill and TIH.

"},{"   ":172,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-01-15","TEXT_REMARK":"01/15/2012: TIH and set FASDrill at 14;247'. Squeeze 135 bbls below packer and leave 15 bbls on top.

01/16/2012: POOH with FASDrill setting tool. Slip and cut drill line. C/O Gumbo box isolation valve. TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA.

01/17/2012: TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA to 13;947'. Wash; ream and drill cement to 14;237'. Drill through packer and cement below packer to 14;345'.

01/18/2012: Continue to drill cement to 14;572'. Perform shoe test to 12.1 ppg EMW. Continue to drill out rat hole to 14;740'. Perform LOT to 11.8 ppg EMW. POOH and start to test BOPs on 6-5/8" DP at 9;836 bit depth.

01/19/2012: Continue testing BOPs on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8". 
NOTE: Submitted revised screening tool and consequence analysis to BSEE based on the lower than anticipated fracture gradient. Received approval from Mr. Nelson; BSEE; to continue drilling on 01/19/2012.

01/20/2012: Complete testing BOPs on 6-5/8". Function test BOPs. POOH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA. Change out MWD and directional tools. Slip and cut drill line. Function BSRs.

01/21/2012: TIH wtih 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA to 14;458'. Wash to 14;760'. Drill ahead to 14;745'.
"},{"   ":173,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-01-22","TEXT_REMARK":"01/22/2012: Continue drilling from 14;740' to 15;478'; while taking stethoscope readings per program.

01/23/2012: Continue drilling from 15;478' to 16;646'.

01/24/2012: Continue drilling from 16;646' to 16;911'. Detected leak in 5k 'blue stab'. Continue to take formation pressure readings while preparing control fluid isolation plan and reviewing with BSEE. Upon receiving approval; continued drilling to 17;139'.
NOTE: Received e-mail approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson; BSEE; that isolation plan was acceptable and permission granted to continue working.

01/25/2012: Drilled from 17;139' to 17;189'. Identified control fluid leak in Rigid Conduit between joints 50 & 51. Performed Accumulator draw-down function test; and time exceeded allowable limit. Retrieved wear bushing and pulled out of hole.
NOTE: Received e-mail approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson; BSEE; to set RTTS packer; perform negative test; and unlatch LMRP and repair control line leak between.

01/26/2012: Finish POOH. TIH and set RTTS at 6;002'. 

01/27/2012: Test packer; perform negative test; trap 11.0 ppg hydrostatic under BSR. Displace riser. POOH.

01/28/2012: Started pulling riser. When LMRP was unlatched; ROV identified damage to seals on both blue and yellow hot stabs; decision made to pull LMRP to surface.
"},{"   ":174,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-01-29","TEXT_REMARK":"01/29/2012: Pull LMRP/ lay down riser. Land LMRP on cart and skid to stbd side.

01/30/2012: Pulling LMRP/ laying down riser. Perform needed maintenance and repairs to LMRP. 

01/31/2012: P/U LMRP off beams and skid cart clear. Lower LMRP to 192'. Run LMRP on riser changing mud seals on each joint.
NOTE: Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) reviewed the third party review of the repairs to the hot stabs and deemed it acceptable.

02/01/2012: RIH with LMRP on riser. R/U riser jewelry; latch LMRP; install diverter. R/D riser handling equip.

02/02/2012: P/U diverter and set on I-Beams on rotary. Change out upper diverter seals. 

02/03/2012: Finish installing diverter. TIH with over shot assy to 5200'. Displace riser with 11.0 ppg SBM.

02/04/2012: Pressure tested BSRs to 3500 psi; as per plan. Recorded unplanned discharge while transferring mud (detailed above). Stopped operations; allowing TOI to discuss unplanned discharge event and develop way forward procedures for CVX review/approval. Retrieve RTTS; POOH with same.
NOTE: Received approval from Mr. Nelson (BSEE) to perform BSR test against RTTS to a lower than approved value (3500 psi vs. the 4500 psi stated in the APD).
"},{"   ":175,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-02-05","TEXT_REMARK":"02/05/2012: Pump out of hole until RTTS above 16" csg. POOH with RTTS to surface. TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" drilling BHA to 9;614'. R/U to test BOPs. 
Note: Tested choke manifold offline at 250 / 7;340 psi.

02/06/2012: Performed accumulator test. Test BOPs on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" DP.

02/07/2012: Break Circulation at 9;840'. TIH from 9;840' to 14;567' and break circulation. TIH from 14;567' to 17;033'. Wash to bottom at 17;190'. Circulated bottoms up from TD. Drill ahead to 17;274'. Take four stethoscope readings.

02/08/2012: POOH to surface. R/U and RIH SLB USIT to log 16".

02/09/2012: Run USIT log in 16" casing; POOH and C/O logging string to log 22" casing. RIH and run USIT log across 22" casing. POOH and R/D wireline. Slip and cut drill line. M/U 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA (function BSR/CSR) and TIH to 5;045'.
NOTE: Mr. Nelson (BSEE) accepted casing inspection log results as being acceptable via email on 02/09/2012.

02/10/2012: Functioned BSR/CSR. TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" assembly from 5;045' to 14;335'. Circulate and Condition Mud. TIH from 14;335' to 17;150'. Wash from 17;150' to 17;274' while relogging hole section at 200 ft/hr. Drill from 17;274' to 17;790'.

02/11/2012: Continue to drill from 17;790' to 18;688'. While making connection; saver sub stripped out of connection. Pull 5 stands and C/O saver sub. TIH to 18;688'. Con't to drill ahead to 18;793'.
"},{"   ":176,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-02-12","TEXT_REMARK":"02/12/2012: Continue to drill ahead with 14.5" x 16.5" BHA from 18;793' to 19;628'. Taking stethoscope pressures at 19;192'.

02/13/2012: Continue to drill ahead with 14.5" x 16.5" BHA from 19;628' to 20;052'. Taking stethoscope pressures at 19;831'.

02/14/2012: Continue to drill ahead with 14.5" x 16.5" BHA from 20;052' to 20;086' TD. Circulate hole clean with 11.2 ppg In/Out. POOH to 8;471'.

02/15/2012: Continue to POOH to surface. R/U casing running equipment.

02/16/2012: Run 5903' of 13-5/8" x 13-3/4" liner on 6-5/8" DP to 8139'.

02/17/2012: Continue to run liner to depth of 19;955' on 6-5/8" DP. Cement liner in place with 2055 cu-ft. And displacement same.

02/18/2012: Continue with cement displacement. Set liner hanger at 14;028'. POOH with liner setting tool to 1;194'.
"},{"   ":177,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-02-19","TEXT_REMARK":"02/19/2012: Complete TOOH. Function Test BSRs/CSRs. Perform casing test to 4550 psi. RIH and set wear sleeve.

02/20/2012: TOH with wear sleeve running tool and jet sub - racked both in derrick. TIH with 12-1/4" drilling assy to 10;029' bit depth. Completed testing BOPs on 5-7/8" DP; began testing BOPs on 6-5/8" DP.

02/21/2012: Completed BOP test on 6-5/8" DP; followed by function test. TIH with 12-1/4" drilling assy. Tagged cement. Drilled out shoe track and cleaned out rathole. Drilled 13' new formation. Circulated bottoms up. Performed FIT to 13.3 (good test).

02/22/2012: Drill 12 1/4" hole section from 20;099' to 21;124'; circulate and condition. Take stethoscope pressures @ 21;095'; 21;087'; 21;073'.

02/23/2012: Take stethoscope readings @ 21;038'; 21;037'; 21;025'; 21;024'. Drill 12-1/4" hole from 21;124' to 22;250'. Circulate bottoms up.

02/24/2012: Circulate bottoms up; take stethoscope readings; drill 12-1/4" hole from  22;250' to 22;445' (TD). Circulate hole clean. TOH to 22;207'; hole pulling tight attempting to pack off. Pump out of hole.

02/25/2012: Pump out of hole to 20;490'; take stethescope samples at 20;487'; 20;473'; 20;462'. Attempt to TOH; taking overpull; pump out hole to shoe. Attempt TIH taking weight. Wash & ream to bottom (22;445'). Pump sweep around. Attempt to TOH; taking overpull; pumping out of hole to 22;138'.
"},{"   ":178,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-02-26","TEXT_REMARK":"02/26/2012: Pump out of hole to 19;480'. Function test BOPs; circ btm's up; function Diverter; TOH.

02/27/2012: TOH; handle BHA; cut & slip drill line; Change out saver sub. R/D drill pipe equipment; R/U Frank's casing equip. Run 9-7/8" liner.

02/28/2012: Run 9-7/8"; 65.1#; Q-125 HC; SLSF from derrick. P/U Versaflex hanger; run 9-7/8" on landing string to 4;850'. Change out Fwd Drawworks C blower motor. Continue to run 9-7/8" liner on 6-5/8" landing string from 4;850' to 16;745'.

02/29/2012: Run 9-7/8" liner in hole on 6-5/8" drill pipe; speed restricted from 19;950'. Could not get past 20;266'. M/U MDDM working pipe and establishing circ. Hole packing off; rotate liner and working down while preventing pack off. TIH with liner when hole conditions allowed. TIH to 22;365'. P/U Blackhawk cement head. Could not pass 22;388' work pipe; staging up pumps to 8 bbl/min.; attempting to work pass 22;388'. Max weight down 100K. Circ bottoms up while attempting to work liner down.

03/01/2012: Work casing down to 22;388'. Circ. B/U attempting to work pipe to bottom. Reconfigure Blackhawk cement head and P/U same. Perform cement job. Set liner hanger; reverse out. POOH 2 stds.; install and pump nerf ball 1 DP capacity.

03/02/2012: R/D 9-7/8" casing handling equipment. TOH from 19;530'; L/D liner hanger running tool. Function BSRs/CSRs. Test casing and liners to 4;100 psi. TIH with polish mill assy to 7;500'.

03/03/2012: TIH with polish mill assy to 21;787'. Polish 9-7/8" PBR. Circulate B/U. Attempt to perform negative test; could not due to float in string. Circulate base oil out through choke/kill lines. Pump slug.
"},{"   ":179,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-03-04","TEXT_REMARK":"03/04/2012: TOH from 21;693' to 8;982'. Function test BOPs. TOH to surface. Clean & clear rig floor of excess equip. Slip & cut drill line. M/U 8-1/2" bit & wear sleeve retrievable assy; TIH.

03/05/2012: TIH to 9;073'. Attempt to latch wear sleeve adapter to wear sleeve; latched into wear sleeve but wear sleeve not latched to wellhead. TOH to 3;930'. Re-dress wear sleeve with new pins. TIH to 5;280' and wash wellhead with bit. TIH to 9;023'm set wear sleeve; continue TIH to 20;477'. 

03/06/2012: Wash to TOC @ 21;784'. Circ. Perform negative test. Displace SBM to WBM. Pump slug. While testing choke manifold; TOH to 16;500'.

03/07/2012: Test BOPs. TOH to wear sleeve; pull wear sleeve; active PBL wash wellhead and BOPs. Boost out riser. Pump slug and TOH.
NOTE: On 03/07/2012; identified control fluid leak in Blue Hot Stab. Discussed with Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) and received verbal approval to continue operations with stab isolated. Written confirmation from Mr. Nelson received on 03/08/2012. 

03/08/2012: Function Diverter; cont TOH. Function BSR. R/D drill pipe handling equip. R/U csg equip. Hold PJSM. P/U seal assembly and run 9-7/8" 65.3# C110 SLIJ-II tieback csg. Calibrate block height sensor. Cont running 9-7/8" 65.3# C110 SLIJ-II tieback csg. P/U XO. Run 10-7/8" 72.0 #C110 SLIJ-II csg.

03/09/2012: TIH with 10-7/8" csg from 3;586' to 14;028'. R/D Frank's csg equipment and R/U drill pipe equipment and OES flow back tool. TIH with 9-7/8" x 10-7/8" casing on 6-5/8" drill pipe from 14;031' to 16;509'.

03/10/2012: TIH with tieback for space-out run. Space out and get measurements. TOH with landing string. R/D OES flow back tools and drill pipe equip. R/U casing equip. P/U syntactic foam joints and pup joint. R/D casing equip.

"},{"   ":180,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-03-11","TEXT_REMARK":"03/11/2012: TIH with tieback check space out. Circulate and condition prior to cement job. Cement and displace tieback.

03/12/2012: Set tieback hanger and test seal assy with 7;500 psi - okay. TOH. Cut and slip drill line. M/U bit and Dril-quip impression block and TIH. TIH; pressure up to 2;500 psi; activate tool; attempt to shear ball with 5;800 psi; did not shear. Troubleshoot lower MDDM IBOP. TOH. Function impression block and install new pins.

03/13/2012: TIH with lead impression tool to 6;971' (tool @ 4;816'). Pipe not filling. TOH to wet pipe; drift pipe while TIH to 7;438' pipe depth; good disp. Land to and apply 2;500 psi with Halliburton for 5 min. Finsh procedure and TOH. L/D impression tool and TIH with lockdown sleeve. Set lockdown sleeve; shear off with 180k overpull. TOH with R/T.

03/14/2012: TOH with lockdown R/T; L/D same and perform casing/BSR test to 250 psi/ 4;400 psi (5 min/ 30 min). TIH with EZSV and set at 17;235' as per Halliburton. Pull up cement stinger 10' above EZSV. Slacked off and performed successful weight test to 60k and pressure test to 1;000 psi. Picked up 10' above EZSV. Circulated mud around for equal weight in/out prior to setting first TA plug.

03/15/2012: Performed cement job from 17;225' stinger depth. Est TOC: 16;825'. TOH to 16;538'. Circulate string contents clean. Pressure test plug to 1;000 psi for 15 min. TOH from 16;538' to 5;964' and circ slug out of well. R/U and spotted balanced plug at 6;000'. Est TOC: 5;560'. TOH to 5;354'. Circulated string contents clean. Perfomed flow check on seal assy and top plug using drill water. Displaced surface equipment; choke/kill/boost lines to seawater.

03/16/2012: Displace well from 11.5 WBM to seawater. TOH with EZSV stinger. R/U riseruhandling equipment; install Gimble; pull Diverter; M/U landing jt; unlatch BOP; moved off location 50'; installed TA cap; moved off location 500'; removed tensioner ring. Began taking on mud for BGF batch set.

03/17/2012: Prepare moonpool; remove storm loops and clamps. L/D landing jt and spacer pup. Remove drape hoses. Pull BOP; laying down slip joint; intermediate flex joint and termination joint and 40' pup. Pull buoyed riser from 4;992' to 2;592'.
"},{"   ":181,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-03-18","TEXT_REMARK":"03/18/2012: Continue pulling BOP and laying down riser from 2;592' to moonpool. Disconnect BOP and rig down riser handling equipment. R/U MDDM with drilling links; bails; elevators.

03/19/2012: Wash BOP with stand and jetting assy before beginning maintenance scope on rig floor and on BOP. Lay down jetting assy and rack stand. Skid BOP to maintenance position. Perform planned rig floor and derrick maintenance workscope.

03/20/2012: Continue performing planned rig floor and derrick maintenance workscope. "},{"   ":182,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-11-25","TEXT_REMARK":"11/25/2018: N/D BOPE after inner riser run to install horizontal surface tree (HST).

11/26/2018: Install 13-5/8" 10k psi horizontal surface tree. 

11/27/2018: N/U 18-3/4" 15k Class 5 BOPE. Begin between well maintenance work. Replace lower blind shear rams blocks in accordance with Cameron product advisory 36134. Begin changing upper blind shear ram blocks.

11/28/2018: Continue between well BOP work. Complete UBSR ram block change out. Inspect lower VBRs. Replaced annular element.

11/29/2018: Complete between well BOP work. Torque annular cap; N/U telescoping joint and bell nipple. Begin installing Foxholes. Begin testing choke manifold to 250 psi low / 10;000 psi high with seawater.

11/30/2018: Remove bore protector from HST. TIH with test tool and test horizontal surface tree to 10;000 psi. Reconfigure test tool for BOP testing and set same. Begin initial BOP test to 250 psi/ 10;000 psi high using seawater. Annular tested to 7;500 psi high.

12/01/2018: Completed initial BOP test to 250 psi low/ 10;000 psi high. TOH with BOP Test Tool. Install bore protector in HST. Torque bolts on BOP post-BOP test. P/U 10-7/8" cleanout BHA and TIH to 3;370'.
"},{"   ":183,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-12-02","TEXT_REMARK":"12/02/2018: TIH with 10-7/8" cleanout assembly from 3;504' to 5;413' and tagged with 20k down. Displace riser from 8.6 ppg seawater to 11.5 ppg WBM and began driling ratty cement to 5;650'. Drill firm cement from 5;650' to 5;777'.

12/03/2018: Drill firm cement from 5;777' to 6;080'. Continue to TIH and wash down 3 stands to 6;375' followed by a 30 bbl sweep.

12/04/2018: Circulate 1.5x BU at 6;375' and continue to TIH to 16;691' washing and reaming as needed.

12/05/2018: Continue to wash and ream from 16;691' to 16;844' as needed and tag the 10-7/8" x 9-7/8" crossover at 16;844'. Performed a 6;200 psi inner riser test for 30 min; successful test. Begin to TOH from 16;844' to 6;929 with 10.875" cleanout assembly.

12/06/2018: Continue to trip out of hole from 6;929' to surface. P/U and TIH with the 9-7/8" cleanout assembly from surface to 5;754'.

12/07/2018: TIH with 9-7/8" cleanout assembly from 5;754 to 16;790'. Wash down and tagged at 16;844' with 20k down. Wash and reamed from 16;844' to 16;988' and began to drill hard cement from 16;988' to 17;341'; tagging the top of the EZSV at 17;341' with 30k. Pumped 30 bbl Hi-Vis sweep and worked pipe at reduced parameters advised for EZSV mandrel.

12/08/2018: Drill out EZSV and flow check well (well static). Make short trip to 16;790' and function test BOP. Trip back in washing and reaming as necessary to 19;134' and drill firm cement from 19;134' to 19;347'.
"},{"   ":184,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-12-09","TEXT_REMARK":"12/09/2018: Drill cement from 19;347' to 19;482'. 

12/10/2018: Drill orifice collar from 19;482' to 19;486'. Drilled cement from 19;486' to 19;779'. Flow check well; no flow. Washed ratty cement from 19;779' to 19;970'. Washed from 19;970' to 20;061' with no indication of cement. Flow check; no flow. Short tripped form 20;061' to 18;455'. Tagged with 25k to 40k overpull multiple times; washed and reamed these areas. 

12/11/2018: Trip in hole from 18;455' to 21;769'. Located cement at 21;769. Slip and cut 110 ft of drill line. Drill cement from 21;769' to 22;180'. Drilled float collar from 22;180' to 22;183'. Flow Check. Washed and reamed from 22;183' to 21;769'.

12/12/2018: TIH to 22;183'; TOC. Pump sweep and circulate out. TOH to 19;781' (tieback). Jet tieback gap and circulate out. TOH to 5;278'.

12/13/2018: Jet subsea wellhead profile at 5;270'. TOH and L/D cleanout assembly. R/U Baker e-line. M/U CCL; GR; gauge ring/junk basket on e-line and RIH to 22;194'. POOH. RIH with plugged packer; DPU setting tool; GR and CCL to 11;700'.

12/14/2018: Continue RIH with plugged packer on e-line and set packer at 22;184' MD e-line measurement (IES). POOH and L/D setting tool. Test 10-7/8" x 9-7/8" casing with 11.5 ppg WBM against upper BSRs to 250 psi low; 5;200 psi high for 30 minutes; good test. Test lower BSRs to 250 psi low; 5200 psi high; good test. Validated tests with IPT. M/U casing caliper/gyro/CBL tools on e-line and RIH to 22;101'. Lost communication with CBL tool. Made several unsuccessful attempts to re-establish communication.

12/15/2018: POOH with caliper/CBL/gyro tool string to 16;811'. Log with multi-finger casing caliper and gyro from 16;810' to 5;170'. POOH and L/D wireline tools. Retrieve wear bushing. Pressure test annular preventer; upper and lower variable bore rams on 5-7/8" DP using 11.5 ppg WBM to 250 psi low/ 6500 psi high; monitored using IPT. Set wear bushing. Function test upper and lower BSRs from Primary and Secondary control stations.  "},{"   ":185,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-12-16","TEXT_REMARK":"12/16/2018: RIH with caliper/ CBL/ Gamma Ray tool to 22;174'. Log with CBL from 22;174' to 18;366'. Locate TOC behind 9-7/8" production liner at 20;166'. POOH with caliper/ CBL/ Gamma Ray tool from 18;366' to surface. L/D wireline tools. Rigged down wireline. Make up and TIH with 9-7/8" casing scraper and displacement BHA to 11;862'. 

12/17/2018: M/U top drive and break circulation. Circulate and condition mud at 11;862'. M/U 10-7/8" RTTS and TIH from 11;862' to 17;582'. Space out; position and set RTTS at 5;606'; bit depth 17;602'. Pumped 300 bbls base oil to a pressure of 3;400 psi. Bled off 14-1/2 bbls of base oil and observed no flow for 30 minutes. Negative (inflow) test wellbore to 8.6 ppg equivalent for 30 minutes. Pressured up down drill string to equalize pressure and opened bypass; allowing base oil to u-tube out. Reverse circulated until mud weight was 11.5 ppg. Released packer and began TOH with 10-7/8" RTTS from 17;602' to 11;862'. L/D RTTS. P/U 10-7/8" Bristle Tech assembly #9.  

12/18/2018: TIH and P/U 10-7/8" Bristle Tech assembly #10 at 14;919'. P/U 10-7/8" Bristle Tech assembly #11 at 17;311'; P/U 10-7/8" Bristle Tech assembly #12 at 19;701'. Continue TIH to 21;998'. Wash from 21;998' to PBTD at 22;173'. Circulate and condition WBM. Displace 11.5 ppg WBM with 8.6 ppg seawater; monitoring barrel in and out. Prepare tanks for displacing seawater with 10.4 ppg CaCL.

12/19/2018: Cleaned and prepped surface system in preparation to displace from 8.6 ppg seawater to 10.4 ppg CaCl2. Displaced well from 8.6 ppg seawater to 10.4 ppg CaCl2 completion fluid. 

12/20/2018: Continue cleaning mud system in preparation for completion operations. Perform short TOH from 22;156' to 19;701'. TIH from 19;701' to 21;999'. TIH to PBTD at 22;073'. P/U Clean Well jet sub and FOSV. Functioned BOPs prior to jetting. Washed 21;999' to 22;073' (bit depth). Jet BOPs with three passes.

12/21/2018: Finish jetting BOPs. L/D jetting tool. L/D TIW and single joint of DP. TIH to 22;171'. R/U pump in sub assembly and circulate at 22;171'. R/D pump in assembly. Perform stripping test test through annular.

12/22/2018: Complete stripping drill and pressure test annular to 250 psi low; 4500 psi high. Slug pipe and TOH from 22;171' to 4;883'; laying down Halliburton Clean Well assemblies #12 through #5. 

"},{"   ":186,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-12-23","TEXT_REMARK":"12/23/2018: TOH from 4;883' to surface while laying down Halliburton Clean Well assemblies. Hang off block/ top drive. Slip and cut drill line. P/U Halliburton temperature gauge carrier assemblies. TIH to 2;926'. Held well control drill. Continue TIH with Halliburton temperature gauge carriers on DP to 7;171'. Monitor well for 30 minutes to allow fluid temp to stabilize. Well static.

12/24/2018: Perform temperature test at 7;171'. POOH. L/D temperature gauge assy. Clean rig floor. Held PJSM for e-line run.

12/25/2018: R/U to run e-line. Hang off block and top drive; remove drill line from drawworks drum due to slack in line. Re-spool drill line on drawworks drum. Finish R/U for e-line run. RIH and set sump packer @ 22;134' MD IES. R/D e-line. Retrieve bore protector. TIH and set BOP test tool. R/U to test BOPs.

12/26/2018: R/U and perform BOP pressure test of annular preventer; upper and lower variable bore rams on 5-7/8" drill pipe from Primary control station per IPT test plan with 10.4 ppg CaCl to 250-350 psi low and 6;500 psi high. Monitoring well on trip tank through casing valve; well static throughout. Set well bore protector. Function test BOPs (Annular; UVBR; LVBR; UBSR; LBSR and all hydraulic safety valves) from Primary and secondary stations. Function test USBRs and LSBRs from Primary and Secondary control stations. Well static. P/U and RIH with Schlumberger TCP assembly to 316.16'. TIH with TCP assembly on 5-7/8" CTM-57 DP from 316.16' to 7;085'.

12/27/2018: TIH with TCP assembly to 12;158'. P/U and build firing head assembly. TIH to 22;103'. Tag and snap in and out of sump packer at 22;134' MD IES. P/U firing head assembly and R/U iron to Supreme choke manifold. Test surface iron to 4;500 psi. Set Posi-test packer at 21;726'. Test back side to 500 psi for 5 min. Circulate and establish baseline circ pressure at 200 psi at 2 bpm. Initiate firing sequence as per procedure. Guns fired @ 22:12 hours. Monitor gauges and bubble hose for 15 min. Open TCP choke; circulate across firing head at 12 bbl/hour losses. P/U and open packer by-pass. Monitor for 30 minutes at 5.4 bbl per hour loss.

Perforation depth: 
21;995' - 22;124' IES MD
21;791' - 21;920' IES TVD

12/28/2018: Reverse circ 1.5 drill string volume. Break chiksan loose and monitor well - well U-tubing. Reverse circulate 1.5 drill string volumes. L/D firing head. Monitor well at 21;947'. TIH and tag packer. TOH with TCP assembly from 22;124' to 5;266'. 

12/29/2018: TOH with TCP from 5;266' to 396'. Reverse circulate 1.5 drill string volume. TOH and L/D spent TCP assembly. Change out top drive saver sub. P/U Halliburton Frac pack assembly and TIH to 266.10'.
"},{"   ":187,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-12-30","TEXT_REMARK":"12/30/2018: R/D WFD handling tools. TIH with Halliburton frac pack assembly from 400' to 21;575'.

12/31/2018: TIH with frac pack assembly from 21;575' to 22;148' (mule shoe depth); tagged no-go at 22;124'. Decision made to TOH with frac pack assembly following review of connection torque records that revealed the frac screen assembly was under-torqued. TOH with frac pack assembly from 22;124' to 15;873'.

01/01/2019: Finish POOH with frac pack assembly from 15;873' to surface while monitoring well on trip tank. Rig up to slip and cut drill line.

01/02/2019: Slip and cut drill line. Perform drawworks brake test. Function test BOPs from Primary and Decondary remote stations. Rig up Weatherford trip master; pick up frac assembly and TIH with same to 11;126' (midnight depth).

01/03/2019: Continue TIH with frac assembly; reverse out dope ball with charger pumps; rig up frac head and lines; test same to 7;000 psi; set VCA packer at 21;765' MD; test same to 1;500 psi; release MPT service tool from packer and reverse out packer setting ball.

01/04/2019: Pickle work string; establish injection rates; perform acid treatment; mini frac and main frac. Pumped total of 201;769 lbs 25 mesh Kryptosphere HD proppant; with estimated 196;294 lbs displaced below crossover; leaving 5;475 lbs in drill pipe above crossover. Attempt to pick up to reverse position and discovered tool string stuck. Work pipe and attempt to free same while mobilizing contingency equipment to rig.

01/05/2019: Continue to work string from reverse position up 14 ft from reverse position (14 ft of travel is pipe stretch; no movement at tool) with 2;200 psi on drill pipe. Mobilizing contingency equipment to rig.
 
Note: @ 14 ft; stretch with 245k overpull; while waiting on contingency tools.
"},{"   ":188,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-01-06","TEXT_REMARK":"01/06/2019: Perform negative test on upper and lower frac valves to 2;200 psi; rig up Weatherford tongs; break out and remove frac assembly above tested frac valves and lay out same.

Note: Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 01/06/2019 at 16:52 hrs to continue with contingency wireline operations.

01/07/2019: Change out bails and elevators; rig up ATES top entry wireline sub; rig up baker wireline sheaves in derrick; make up sinker bars with CCL and pressure test wireline lubricator system to 250/7;000 psi. Run in hole with wireline to 300' and observe leak on grease injector head. Pull wireline toolstring back into lubricator and isolate well with upper frac valve.

Note: Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 01/07/2019 at 09:05 hrs to proceed with the proposed plan to re-gain fluid overbalance to formation after frac string cut.

01/08/2019: Rig down grease injector; change out seals in same; re-install and test to 250/7;000 psi. Run in hole with wireline; sinker bars and CCL; tag top of proppant at 21;337'; POOH and lay out wireline BHA.

01/09/2019: Make up and function test wireline mechanical pipe cutter tool toolstring.
 
Note: Carl Simonson (Chevron) received approval from Bill Sanders on 01/09/2018 at 15:45 hrs to extend BOP test; BOP function test and BSR function test due on 01/09/2019 through 23:59 hours on 01/11/2019.

01/10/2019: Test wireline lubricator to 250/7;000 psi. RIH with Baker mechanical pipe cutter; correlate depth and cut pipe at 21;299'. Positive indication of pipe cut ovserved at surface. POOH with wireline to surface and isolate lubricator. Rig down wireline cutter toolstring. Make up and pressure test wireline lubricator and chicksan for reverese circulation to 250/7;000 psi. Reverse out 535 bbls of frac fluid from frac string with 10.4 CaCl2 brine; overdisplace by 50 bbls. Flow check well - well static. Commence rigging down wireline.

01/11/2019: Rig down Baker electric line; oil states grease injector system with ATES wireline lubricator and supreme frac head; offload same from rig floor. Commence POOH with cut pipe from 21;299'.

Note: Carl Simonson (Chevron) received approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) on 01/11/2019 at 18:11 hrs; as follows: Extend BOPE test; BSR tests and function test until Sunday; Jan 13th; and a 1 week extension for casing test due on Jan. 13th; until Jan. 20th. 

01/12/2019: Lay out cut pipe; pull wear bushing; set test plug; test BOP VBRs and annular preventer to 250/6;500 psi from Secondary remote station with 10.4 CaCl2. Back out of test plug; pull above BOP; close and test BOP BSRs to 250/6;500 psi from Primary Station. Re-engage test plug and function test all BOP components from Primary and Secondary stations; all tests approved by IPT. Rig down testing equipment; set wear bushing; service rig; perform drops inspection and pick up Weatherford's 8-1/2" overshot assembly while monitoring well on trip tank; well static.
"},{"   ":189,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-01-13","TEXT_REMARK":"01/13/2019: Pick up fishing BHA; TIH with same to 21;209'; change out bails and elevators; wash down to top of fish at 21;299'. Latch fish and pulled 268 klb overpull in attempt to free string. Overpull limited to 80% tensile rating of weakest component in frac pack service tool. No downhole pipe movement. Well static.

01/14/2019: Jarred up on stuck pipe; slip and cut drill line and continued jarring operations. Totaled 356 upward jar hits with no notable pipe movement. Well taking a maximum of 13 bbl/hr fluid during jarring upward only. Well is static when jarring stops. Released overshot.

01/15/2019: Perform post jarring derrick inspection. TOH from 21;272' to 15;472'. Service rig floor. TOH from 15;472' to 8;116'. TLP emergency shut-down (ESD) activated; drilling package make safe generator (MSG) came online and drill pipe was positioned to secure the well. Drilling operations stood by until TLP power was restored. Monitored well throughout - well static. TOH from 8;116' to 2;961'. Chevron production conducted a planned platform emergency shut down from Driller's cabin ESD pull station as witnessed by BSEE inspector. MSG came on line as designed. TOH from 2;961' to 438'.

01/16/2019: TOH to surface and L/D fishing assembly. P/U alternative fishing assembly and TIH to 16;200'.
 
01/17/2019: TIH and latch on to fish at 21;299' with 20k down. Record block position and hook loads. Began jarring on fish. Totaled 68 upward jar hits and 55 downward jar hits; no fish movement. Well taking fluid during jarring operations. Well is static when jarring stops. Released overshot from fish. Nabors performed post jarring derrick; top drive; track and PRS8 inspection.

01/18/2019: TOH from 21;266' to 328'. TOH and L/D fishing assembly. Function test upper and lower BSRs from Primary and Secondary station. Slip and cut drill line.

01/19/2019: Service TDS. R/U WFT handling tools. P/U and TIH with 3.5" wash pipe; Halliburton Vac-Tech assembly. Function test VBRs and Annular preventer on 5-7/8" DP from Primary and secondary stations and HCRs from Primary and Secondary stations. TIH from 1;157 to 13;193'. 
"},{"   ":190,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-01-20","TEXT_REMARK":"01/20/2019: TIH from 13;193' to 20;462'. Record circulating parameters and drop 1.75" ball to activate Vac-Tech tool. TIH from 20;462' to 21;194'. Commence circulating down and enter top of 5-7/8" fish at 21;299'. Wash out inside of 5-7/8" DP to 21;733' and tagged 5-7/8" x 3-1/2" crossover with 15 klb. Circulate out of fish and TOH to 16;451'. Pump 30 bbl 10.9 ppg CaCl2 slug.

01/21/2019: TOH from 16;451 to 278'. R/U WFT 3.5" handling equip. TOH and L/D 3.5" washpipe. R/D 3.5" handling equip. P/U modular clean-out chambers from Vac-Tech BHA and collect proppant for backload.

01/22/2019: Continue to collect proppant from Vac-Tech chambers for backload. P/U ValiTech tool and collect proppant for backload. Clean rig floor. P/U 8-1/8" overshot with 5-7/8" grapples. TIH to 9;108'

01/23/2019: TIH from 9;108' to 21;235'. Establish baseline parameters. TIH and engage fish.

01/24/2019: Engage fish at 21;299' (TOF). R/U E-line logging complement. Pressure test lines to 250-350 psi low and 7;000 psi high. RIH with CCL and sinker bars to 17;874'.

01/25/2019: RIH with CCL/3.25" gauge ring to 21;734' (inside fish) and log up to 21;342'. RIH to 21;734' and repeat up-log to 21;342'. POOH and L/D CCL and gauge rig. P/U Mechanical Pipe Cutter (MPC) assembly; test lubricator to 7;000 psi. RIH with MPC to place cutter blade at 21;718' and begin cutting 5-7/8" drill pipe.

01/26/2019: Complete cut on 5-7/8" 23# DP tube at 21;718'; retract anchors and POOH with MPC to surface above tool trap. Reverse circulate 1.5 DP volumes; observing proppant in returns. Lost fluid at 4 bbl/hr during reverse circulation; loss rate reducing to 0 over the following 14 hrs. R/D Baker E-line and Oil States equipment. TOH with fish from 21;718' to 13;599'. 

Note: Mr. Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email confirmation from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 01/26/2019 at 16:37 hrs that Chevron is granted a 2 day BOP pressure and function test as well as a 1 week casing test extension due to ongoing fishing operations.
"},{"   ":191,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-01-27","TEXT_REMARK":"01/27/2019: TOH to surface with 8-1/8" overshot BHA and cut 5-7/8" drill pipe. L/D 11 joints of 5-7/8" 23# drill pipe and one cut joint. TIH and retrieve bore protector. Run Dril-quip combo tool. Function test VBRs and annular from Primary and Secondary stations. R/U and test VBRs and annular to 250-300 psi (low) and 6;500 psi (high) from Primary station.
 
01/28/2019: Complete BOP pressure test; testing VBRs and annular to 250-300 psi (low) and 6;500 psi (high) from Primary station. R/D test iron and set bore protector. Function test BSRs from Primary and Secondary control stations. P/U and RIH with washover BHA. R/U OES flowback tool and TIH to 1;992'.

01/29/2019: Trip in hole with washover BHA on 5-7/8" 23# DP with OES CFT to 21;120'.

01/30/2019: TIH to 21;589' and rig down OES flowback tool. Slip and cut 12 ft of drill line. Wash over fish; reverse circulating at 8 bpm to 21;745'; tag gravel pack packer setting tool with 10 klb. Proppant observed in returns. TOH with 10 stands to 20;646'. Rig down OES flowback tool service loop from derrick.

01/31/2019: Complete rig down of flowback tool and TOH with washover BHA to 677'.

02/01/2019: TOH to surface and lay out washover BHA. Lay down 2 stands of 6-3/4" DC's. P/U Weatherford overshot assembly with agitator tool and function test same. P/U two stands of 6-3/4" DC's and TIH to 6;537'.

02/02/2019: Continue TIH with overshot assembly; wash over fish and latch onto same at 21;718'. Stage pumps up to 600 gpm to activate downhole agitator. Monitor pipe for movement while agitating and working string from 15 to 55 klb overpull. Observed 5 ft of upward movement before no further forward progress. Warm up jars and jar on fish 3 times at max jar force. Observed overpull drop off to pick up weight; slack off and attempt to re-engage overshot or verify fish free. Set down 45 klb and pick up with no overpull; repeat 1x. Perform derrick inspection and TOH with overshot assembly and possible fish to 19;854' (overshot depth).
"},{"   ":192,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-02-03","TEXT_REMARK":"02/03/2019: POOH with overshot assembly; lay out 35.32 ft of fish (partial fish). Unable to retrieve fish left in hole. Function test VBRs and annular from Primary and Secondary remote stations. Wait on plugback equipment to arrive on location. Monitor well on trip tank; well static.

Note: A radioactive density logging tool (Caesium source) is left in the fish at 22;111' MD.

Note: On 02/03/2019 at 17:45 hrs; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) for a 1 week casing test extension.

Note: On 02/03/2019 at 19:45 hrs; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to commence abandonment operations on the A-4 well.

02/04/2019: Equipment arrives at location. Pick up and RIH with Cast Iron Bridge Plug (CIBP) to 9;530'.

02/05/2019: Continue to TIH with CIBP and set at 21;730'. Pressure test casing and CIBP to 4;200 psi for 30 minutes. Pump spacer and spot 500 ft balanced cement plug on top of CIBP (TOC at 21;230'). Pick up above cement plug and reverse out to clean pipe. Drop 7" nerf ball and displace same out of drill pipe.

02/06/2019: TOH to surface; lay out CIBP setting tool; and rig up Baker wireline.

02/07/2019: Rig up Baker electric line; RIH with CIBP; correlate depths and set same at 20;810'; POOH with electric line; rig down sheaves; test CIBP against BSR to 1;100 psi for 15 minutes.

02/08/2019: Nipple down bell nipple and slip joint. Wait on weather to nipple down BOP due to platform motion. Prepare for rig skid while waiting on weather.

02/09/2019: Nipple down BOP and BOP spool joint; reinstall main deck cassettes roller plates and nipple up crown valve.
"},{"   ":193,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-02-10","TEXT_REMARK":"02/10/2019: Pressure test DX-1 gasket and crown valve against upper CIBP to 1;000 psi for 15 min. Rig down testing lines; commence rig skid from B-4 slot (WR 29 #A4) to C-1 slot (WR 29 #A6) to run outer drilling riser.

02/11/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead. 
02/12/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead. 
02/13/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead. 
02/14/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead. 
02/15/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead. 
02/16/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead. 

Will return to the B-4 slot (#A4 well) on approximately 02/25/2019 to sidetrack."},{"   ":194,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-02-17","TEXT_REMARK":"02/17/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead. 
02/18/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead.
02/19/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead.
02/20/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead.
02/21/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead.
02/22/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead.
02/23/2019: Currently running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead.

Will return to the B-4 slot (#A4 well) on approximately 02/26/2019 to sidetrack.
"},{"   ":195,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-02-24","TEXT_REMARK":"02/24/2019: Running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead.

02/25/2019: Running outer drilling riser on the WR 29 #A6 wellhead.

Note: On 02/25/2019; Debbie Campise (Chevron) submitted the Rig Move notification in eWell indicating that the M400 is planning to move from the WR 29 A-6 well to WR 29 A-4 well on 02/26/2019.

Note: On 05/25/2019 at 3:15 pm; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) sent an email to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) providing an update on the timing of the initial BOP testing on the A-4 Colorado well.

02/26/2019: Performed between well maintenance work. Prepared rig for skidding operations.

02/27/2019: Finish preparing rig for skid and skid from slot C-1 to slot B-4 (Well A-4 Colorado slot).

Note: On 05/27/2019 at 3:59 pm; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to proceed with operations up to and including displacement to 11.9 ppg mud on the Colorado (A-4) ST01 well.

02/28/2019: Complete post skid checks and equipment re-installation. Function test platform ESD in Driller's cabin after rig skid. Nipple down crown valve and upper work platform from Colorado well.
 
03/01/2019: N/U BOP spool joint; and install roller plates and pollution pans in main deck cassette. Install choke and kill coflex hoses; remove turnbuckles from stack; commence BOP installation onto BOP spool joint.
 
03/02/2019: Land BOP and transfer weight to surface tensioner system. Nipple up slip joint; bell nipple; flow line and trip tank lines.
"},{"   ":196,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-03-03","TEXT_REMARK":"03/03/2019: Install rotary bushings and fox holes in preparation to lay down excess pipe. Lay down 6-3/4" drill collars and 5-7/8" HWDP from derrick.

03/04/2019: Lay down excess 5-7/8" drill pipe from derrick. Pick up and rack back 3 new stands of 6-3/4" drill collars.

03/05/2019: Held Colorado sidetrack pre-spud meetings with all rig crews. Pick up and rack back 663 ft of 4.5" HWDP and 3;183 ft of 4.5" drill pipe. Retrieved bore protector while testing choke manifold and safety valves offline.

03/06/2019: Make up Dril-Quip test tool and test VBRs on 5-7/8" and 3.5" drill pipe from Primary station with seawater to 250 psi (low) and 10;000 psi (high). Test annular preventer on 5-7/8" and 3.5" drill pipe from Primary station with seawater to 250 psi (low) and 7;000 psi (high). Perform accumulator drawdown test and function test BOP from Primary and Secondary stations. Pressure tested upper and lower BSRs with sea water to 250 psi (low) and 10;000 psi (high).

03/07/2019: Completed BSR pressure and function test. Performed torque spot check on 20% of BOP bolts and 100% of bolts that had been broken prior to nipple up - no issues found. Performed casing test to 5;740 psi for 30 min. Rigged up and performed caliper log of the inner production riser. P/U MWD assembly and shallow test same.

03/08/2019: Pick up 9.625" Track Master Whipstock assembly and TIH to 7;640'.
 
Note: On 03/08/2019 at 7:36 pm; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) to proceed with operations up to and including trip in hole with 8-1/2" cleanout assembly. 
 
03/09/2019: Continue TIH with whipstock assembly; tag CIBP at 20;810'.
"},{"   ":197,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006000,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-03-10","TEXT_REMARK":"03/10/2019: Displace brine with 11.7 ppg SBM/ 11.9 ppg downhole. Begin milling window in 9-7/8" casing at 20;892' MD/ 20;697' TVD (KOP).

03/11/2019: Finished milling window and dressed off same. Drilled 30 ft of new formation to 20;936'. Pumped sweep and circulated hole clean. Picked up jetting assembly and jetted BOP; tree and wellhead. L/O jetting tool; TIH. Performed FIT with 11.7 ppg SBM to 13.0 ppg DH EMW (1;297 psi).

03/12/2019: TOH from 20;401' to 9;357' with mill assembly. 

03/13/2019: TOH to surface and L/D mill assy. Recovered 859 lbs of metal from string magnets. Functioned BSRs from Primary and Secondary stations. P/U 8-1/2" window cleanout assembly. Function tested VBRs and annular from Primary and Secondary stations.

03/14/2019: Complete P/U 8-1/2" window cleanout assembly. TIH to 4;987'.

03/15/2019: Continue to TIH to 20;527'. Cut and slip drill line.

03/16/2019: TIH to 20;936'. Rotary and slide drill from 20;936' to 21;195' MD/ 20;995 TVD.
"},{"   ":198,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-03-10","TEXT_REMARK":"03/10/2019: Displace brine with 11.7 ppg SBM/ 11.9 ppg downhole. Begin milling window in 9-7/8" casing at 20;892' MD/ 20;697' TVD (KOP).

03/11/2019: Finished milling window and dressed off same. Drilled 30 ft of new formation to 20;936'. Pumped sweep and circulated hole clean. Picked up jetting assembly and jetted BOP; tree and wellhead. L/O jetting tool; TIH. Performed FIT with 11.7 ppg SBM to 13.0 ppg DH EMW (1;297 psi).

03/12/2019: TOH from 20;401' to 9;357' with mill assembly. 

03/13/2019: TOH to surface and L/D mill assy. Recovered 859 lbs of metal from string magnets. Functioned BSRs from Primary and Secondary stations. P/U 8-1/2" window cleanout assembly. Function tested VBRs and annular from Primary and Secondary stations.

03/14/2019: Complete P/U 8-1/2" window cleanout assembly. TIH to 4;987'.

03/15/2019: Continue to TIH to 20;527'. Cut and slip drill line.

03/16/2019: TIH to 20;936'. Rotary and slide drill from 20;936' to 21;195' MD/ 20;995 TVD.
"},{"   ":199,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-03-17","TEXT_REMARK":"03/17/2019: Rotary and slide drill from 21;195' to 21;336'; kicking off to achieve 35 ft separation from original wellbore. Circulate B/U. TOH 3 stands above window.
 
03/18/2019: Jet BOPs; surface wellhead and tree. TOH from 20;534' to 108'.

03/19/2019: Laid out BHA. Function BSRs from Primary and Secondary panels. Picked up 8-1/2" x 9-1/4" Directional BHA; ran in hole to 1;034'.

03/20/2019: Tripped in hole with 8-1/2" x 9-1/4" BHA from 1;034' to 6;094'. Pulled Bore Protector and set BOP test plug. Pressure tested annular and VBRs to 250 psi/ 6;500 psi from Secondary station and function test BOP from Primary and Secondary stations.

03/21/2019: Laid out test stand. Pulled and laid out test plug. Pick up and set bore protector. Performed surface test on MWD tools. Tripped in hole from 6;286' to 20;788' (104 ft above TOW). Obtained baseline parameters before entering TOW.
 
03/22/2019: Wash from 20;789' to 20;944' through window. Washed and rotated from 21;065' to 21;081'; logging Green Sand. Activated reamer at 21;081'. Under-reamed 8-1/2" hole to 9.25" from 21;081' to 21;336'. Tagged bottom at 21;336'. Rotary steerable drilled from 21;336' to 21;556'.

03/23/2019: Rotary steerable drilled from 21;556' to 22;108' MD/ 21;874' TVD.
"},{"   ":200,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-03-24","TEXT_REMARK":"03/24/2019: Rotary steerable drilled from 22;108' to 22;461'.
 
03/25/2019: Rotary steerable drilled from 22;461' to TD at 22;511' MD/ 22;253' TVD. Pumped a 50 bbl hi-vis weighted sweep and CBU 1.5x. Perform 15 min flow check; static. Reamed out of the hole to 22;260'. Pulled wet on elevators into casing to 20;779'. Perform 15 min flow check; well static. Pumped slug. Dropped 3.875" hollow drift. TOH to 15;860'.

03/26/2019: TOH to surface; and commence lay out directional BHA.

03/27/2019: Lay out bit and remaining directional BHA; rig up and run 7" liner to 1;796'. Pick up versaflex liner hanger and RIH with one stand of 4-1/2" drill pipe. Break circulation through hanger and casing while rigging down casing handling equipment.

03/28/2019: Continue running in hole with 7" C110 PE SLSF casing on drill pipe to 17;394'.
 
03/29/2019: Continue running in hole with 7" C110 PE SLSF casing from 17;394' to 22;500' TD. Rig up Blackhawk cement head; C&C hole and cement 7" liner with 383 cu ft of 16.4 ppg; class H cement; with full returns.

03/30/2019: Cement in place at 00:06 hrs. Confirmed floats holding after displacement. Dropped 2.565" hanger setting ball and allow same to fall to seat. Pressure up on hanger setting tool and set hanger; (top of liner at 20;683' MD/ 20;492' TVD); lay out cement head; release from hanger running tool; drop nerf ball and circulate same around. Begin TOH; laying out drill pipe.
"},{"   ":201,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-03-31","TEXT_REMARK":"03/31/2019: Continue to trip out of hole laying out drill pipe to 14;777'.
 
04/01/2019: Continue to trip out of hole laying out drill pipe to 6;593'.

04/02/2019: Finish laying out drill pipe and 7" liner hanger running tool.

04/03/2019: Retrieved bore protector; RIH with 5 stands of tail pipe; set BOP test plug; rig up and commence testing of annular and VBRs on 4" drill pipe to 250/ 6;500 psi from Primary control station.

Note: BSEE inspectors Chris Treland and Clint Campo from the Houma district arrived on location at 08:40 hours for routine inspection. No INCs. Inspectors departed location at 14:15 hours

04/04/2019: Completed testing annular and VBRs on 4" drill pipe to 250/ 6;500 psi from Primary control station. Function tested BOP from Primary and Secondary control stations. Pressure tested Upper and Lower BSRs to 250-300/ 6;500 psi from Secondary station. Functioned Upper and Lower BSRs from Primary and Secondary stations. Retrieved BOP test tool and install bore protector. R/U and RIH with GR/CCL and Dummy CIBP to 22;262'. POOH with E-Line.
 
04/05/2019: Make up and RIH with Halliburton cement bond log on Baker electric line and log from 21;550' to 20;600'. POOH and lay out logging tools; lay out pipe remaining and 4" and 6" drill collars from derrick. M/U CIBP on wireline. RIH and set same at 22;275'.

04/06/2019: POOH with wireline. Tested casing to 5;139 psi for 30 minutes; with 11.7 ppg SBM (11.9 ppg downhole). R/D wireline equipment. P/U polish mill asy. RIH picking up drill pipe to 5;240'.
"},{"   ":202,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-04-07","TEXT_REMARK":"04/07/2019: Continue TIH picking up drill pipe to 9;200' bit depth; 5;500' RTTS depth. Pump 187 bbls of 6.6 base oil to achieve an under balance of 2;088 psi; perform 30 min inflow test; good test. Reverse out base oil. TOH and L/D RTTS.

Note: At 11:44 hrs on 04/07/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) that Chevron may proceed as requested to displace SBM to completion brine; circulate and filter.
 
04/08/2019: Trip in hole with polish mill assembly. RIH picking up 5-7/8" DP to 15;195'.

04/09/2019: RIH picking up 5-7/8" DP from 15;195' to 20;499'. Take baseline parameters.

04/10/2019: Polished top of 7" liner. Pumped and circulated out Hi-vis sweep. TOH from 20;623' to 19;330'. Washed across tieback gap. TOH from 19;330' to 5;400'. Washed across SSWH. TOH from 5;400' to surface and L/D Halliburton clean well BHA. Functioned UBSRs and LBSRs from Primary and Secondary control stations. M/U 5-7/8" bit and Halliburton displacement assembly and TIH to 365'.

Note: At 14:57 hrs on 04/10/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) communicated the 7" liner CBL interpretation to Bobby Nelson (BSEE); confirming competent cement from the top of the liner (20;683' MD) down to 22;050' MD. The lower 450 ft of cement down to the 7" shoe at 22;500' MD shows to be contaminated cement with poor bonding characteristics (deepest log depth 22;293' MD).

04/11/2019: TIH from 365' to 1;858'. Function annular and VBRs from Primary and Secondary stations. TIH from 1;858' to 17;800' while picking up and installing Halliburton scraper/brush assemblies. TIH from 17;800' to 22;110'.

Note: At 22:06 hrs on 04/11/2019; Wayne Bridgeman (Chevron) received email from Bill Sanders (BSEE); stating "Based on the information provided; low probability for success for remedial cementing; and high chance of damaging the production target in attempting to place further cement; Chevron may proceed with displacement to brine."

04/12/2019: Record baseline parameters at 22;110'. Circulate and condition 11.7 ppg SBM. Build spacers and displace 11.7 ppg SBM with 10.5 ppg CaCl2. Clean mud tanks.

04/13/2019: Continue cleaning SBM from mud system.
"},{"   ":203,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-04-14","TEXT_REMARK":"04/14/2019: Continue cleaning M400 mud system. POOH to 19;436' to confirm clean-up tools clean and lay down same. TIH to 21;635' while continuing to clean mud lines and tanks.

04/15/2019: Finished cleaning lines. Jetted BOPs. TIH to 22;269'. Displace well to 10.5 ppg brine. TOH from 22;269' to 21;824'.

04/16/2019: TOH from 21;824' to surface L/D Halliburton Clean-Well BHA. Perform casing test to 6;500 psi with 10.5 ppg brine. R/U Baker E-line equipment on rig floor.

04/17/2019: Complete R/U Baker E-line. RIH and set CIBP at 22;270' MD/ 22;026' TVD. POOH and L/D DPU setting tool. RIH and set Halliburton sump packer at 22;190' MD/ 21;951' TVD. POOH with E-Line and R/D same. P/U Dril-quip retrieving tool and pull bore protector. RIH with 5 stands of 5-7/8" CTM 57 DP. M/U BOP test tool.

04/18/2019: Test VBRs and annular preventer on 4" DP from Secondary station to 250-300 psi low; 6;500 psi high. Function test BOP from Primary and Decondary stations. Circulate and flush BOP stack through choke & kill. Retrieve BOP test tool; set bore protector. Function UBSR and LBSR from Primary and Secondary stations. Build kill stands. 

04/19/2019: P/U 405 ft of TCP assembly. TIH with TCA on DP to 16;500'.

04/20/2019: TIH to 22;190'. Build TCP control head. Snap in and out of sump packer. Put guns on depth and test lines to 7;000 psi. Set TCP packer and verify guns on depth. Perforate well from 22;042' - 22;180' MD / 21;812' - 21;942' TVD. Circulate across TCP control head. Reverse 1.5 work string volumes. Flow check. Well u-tubing. Pump 20 bbl 11.2 ppg slug. TOH from 22;175 to 21;886'. M/U TCP control head; RIH to 22;002'.

Total losses to well since perforating: 8.5 bbls.

"},{"   ":204,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-04-21","TEXT_REMARK":"04/21/2019: M/U TCP head and set 7" posi-test packer at 21;714' (gauges @ 21;687'). Cycle IRDV TV and IRDV CV. Circulate across TCP control head (no loss rate). Commence reverse circulation to 10.6 ppg CaCl2 while building and filtering 10.6 ppg brine. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 22 bbls.

Note: At 19:52 hrs on 04/21/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) sent an email to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) with notification that 10.5 ppg brine in hole would be weighted up to 10.6 ppg prior to pulling out of hole after perforating.

04/22/2019: Continue reverse circulation to 10.6 ppg CaCl2 while building and filtering 10.6 ppg brine. L/D TCP control head and slip and cut drill line while monitoring well for losses - well static. Un-set 7" posi-test packer and TIH from 21;823' to 22;179'. P/U and M/U TCP control head. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 63 bbls.

04/23/2019: Make up TCP control head assembly; tag sump packer with 20k down (no fill); rig up and reverse 10.6 ppg brine while monitoring for losses - well losing at 6 bph during reverse circulation; well losing at max 0.5 bph when shut down. Perform 30 bbl injection test at 2;000 psi surface pressure. Surface pressure bleeding off slowly to formation. Open well and monitor on trip tank; well static. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 50 bbls.

04/24/2019: Rigged down TCP firing head; pulled bit above perfs and monitor well on trip tank while transfer 10.6 ppg to supply vessel and take on 3;463 bbls of 11.2 ppg CaCl2 brine while filtering same. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 7 bbls.

Note: Rory Chalmers sent an email notification to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 04/24/2019 at 09:22 hrs. that the plan is to raise the brine weight in the well from 10.6 ppg to 11.2 ppg prior to pulling out of the well with TCP assy. and displacing back to 10.5 ppg once the frac tools have been pulled above the FS-2L valve and the formation isolated.

04/25/2019: Rig up and displace well with 11.2 ppg brine; snap in and out of sump packer (no fill); TOH above perfs. Monitor well - average 1 bph loss rate. TOH to 20;120'. Function test annular and VBRs from Primary and Secondary stations. Continue TOH to 17;183'. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 121 bbls.

04/26/2019: TOH lay out TCP assembly (all shots fired); make up perf collet locater and begin TIH with same. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 13.2 bbls.

04/27/2019: TIH with perf collet; tag sump packer 22;190' with 20k-lb down; rig up reverse out assembly; snap out with 16k-lb and reverse 11.2 ppg brine to spec.
Fluid loss past 24 hours: 22.1 bbls.
"},{"   ":205,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-04-28","TEXT_REMARK":"04/28/2019: Snap in and out of sump packer at 22;190'; no fill observed. Rigged down reverse out assembly and POOH to surface with perf collet locator. Slip and cut drill line. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 55.3 bbls.

04/29/2019: Rig up tubing tongs and handling tools for frac assembly. Pick up frac assembly and RIH with same to 2;563'. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 17.7 bbls.

04/30/2019: Continue TIH with frac assembly to sump packer at 22;190'; change out bails and elevators; snap in and out of sump packer with no fill or issues stinging into packer. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 11 bbls.

05/01/2019: Set down 20k-lb on sump packer; drop packer setting ball; rig up service lines and set VBA packer at 21;818' MD/ 21;602' TVD. Test packer to 1;500 psi; reverse out setting ball; perform pickle treatment flush and test treating lines from frac vessel to 12;000 psi. Obtain circulating rates with cement unit and spot 8 bbl acid in treating lines. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 76 bbls.

05/02/2019: Bullhead acid into perfs. Performed mini-frac; performed step rate test and reversed out mini frac fluid. Performed main frac and reversed out proppant; reverse out 3x DP volumes. R/D frac iron and P/U service tool to dump seals and close FS2/MCS while logging pack with Protechnics logging tools. Losses stopped once above FS valve. Pressure test FS2/MCS TO 1;000 psi for 5 minutes. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 527 bbls.

Note: At 14:05 hrs on 05/02/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) for a 3 day or as soon as possible extension to BOP testing; BOP and BSR function testing as requested. 

05/03/2019: Prepare surface volumes and perform displacement to 10.6 ppg CaCl2 brine. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 0 bbls.

05/04/2019: TOH to surface and L/D GP BHA. No abnormalities or proppant observed on any GP tools/washpipe. Retrieved surface bore protector and set BOP test plug while testing choke manifold offline while monitoring well on trip tank; well static. Fluid loss past 24 hours: 0 bbls.
"},{"   ":206,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-05-05","TEXT_REMARK":"05/05/2019: Rig up and test VBRs; annular preventer and BSRs with 10.6 ppg CaCl2 from Primary station to 250-350 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. Function test VBRs; annular and BSRs from Primary and Decondary stations. Retrieve BOP test tool and set bore protector. R/U Weatherford and Halliburton isolation assembly handling equipment.

05/06/2019: TIH picking up isolation assembly from surface to 1;670'. Rig down tubing handling equipment and continue TIH with isolation assembly on 5-7/8" drill pipe to 17;497'.

05/07/2019: Continue TIH to place isolation assembly VCH packer at 20;196' MD/ 20;014' TVD. Set and test VCH packer to 4;300 psi. TOH from 20;196' to 4;072'.

05/08/2019: TOH to surface. Pressure test casing against FS valve and BSRs to 4;300 psi. Pull bore protector on 4th attempt; observed scoring on bore protector OD. Jet tree/ surface wellhead. Set BOP test plug and test VBRs and annular with 10.6 ppg CaCl2 from Secondary station to 250-350 psi low/ 6;500 psi high. Function test VBRs; annular and BSRs from Primary and sDecondary stations. Jet surface wellhead; recovering metal fines. Decision to run bore-scope to observe tubing hanger seal profile. 

05/09/2019: Inspect wellhead with bore-scope camera - no scoring observed on tubing hanger seal profile; however footage inconclusive. R/U control line sheaves in preparation to run upper completion.

05/10/2019: R/U tubing handling equipment; P/U and rack back 34 stands of 5.5" 23# tubing in derrick.

05/11/2019: Finish P/U and rack back a total of 64 stands of 5.5" 23# tubing in derrick. P/U dummy tubing hanger to perform land out and pressure test on tubing hanger sealing profile after scoring observed on bore protector (5/08/2019).
"},{"   ":207,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-05-12","TEXT_REMARK":"05/12/2019: Pressure test on dummy tubing hanger (TH) failed. Pull TH and inspect TH for any anomalies. Seal area had signs of damage. RIH and set bore protector. P/U 10-3/4" RTTS and TIH with same.

Note: At 09:42 hrs on 05/12/2019; Chris Fontenot (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) to proceed to temporarily suspend the well as per the submitted plan and to change out the surface tree.

05/13/2019: TIH to packer depth of 5;710'. Perform negative test on FS-2 valve. Perform RTTS positive test to 1;000 psi. Reverse out 6.5 ppg base oil. Perform positive test below RTTS to 700 psi against FS-2 valve (inflow test pressure). 

05/14/2019: Perform inflow test on RTTS storm valve. R/D test assembly; TOH and L/D RTTS running tool. N/D BOPs.

Note: On 05/14/2019 at 10:40 hrs; Pat Campbell (Chevron) sent an email notification to BSEE Houma District of the upcoming M-400 72-hour initial latch up pressure testing of the BOP after the Horizontal Tree change out.

05/15/2019: Prepare rig floor for BOP removal. Lift BOPs and stage at south side of drilling module. N/D spool joint. P/U horizontal surface tree (HST) and stage to pipe deck.

Note: At 16:04 hrs on 05/15/2019; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) sent an email notification to Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that per the communications on 5/12/19 regarding the tree change out; the well has been successfully suspended and the BOP is currently being removed to perform a tree change out. Given these activities; the BOP will not be function tested today (per schedule). The BOP will be function and pressure tested once nippled back up to the well.

05/16/2019: Stage backup HST to well bay and N/U same. N/U BOP spool joint. N/U 18 3/4" BOPs.

Note: On 05/16/2019 at 15:00 hrs; Pat Campbell (Chevron) sent an email notification update to Josh Ladner (BSEE) regarding the timing of the M-400 BOP re-installation initial pressure testing after the Horizontal Tree change out.

Note: On 05/16/2019 at 15:51 hrs; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) sent an email to William Sanders (BSEE) for review concerning Chevrons intended BOP equipment test program/ rationale plan following the horizontal tree change out on the well. 

05/17/2019: Finish N/U BOPs. Jet BOPs. P/U BOP test tool.

Note: On 05/17/2019 at 08:35 hrs; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from William Sanders (BSEE) that the BOP test plans sent to BSEE on 05/16/2019 are acceptable as this is not an initial test and the components removed to perform the change out are being tested to the RWP of the wellhead.

05/18/2019: Test HST/VBRs to 250-350 psi low and 10;000 psi high for 30 minutes. Test VBRs and annular preventer to 250-350 psi low and 6;500 psi high from Primary station. Function test Annular; UVBR; LVBR; UBSR; LBSR from Primary and Secondary stations. Perform Accumulator drawdown test. Pull BOP test assembly and L/D same. Tests witnessed by BSEE Inspectors.
"},{"   ":208,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-05-19","TEXT_REMARK":"05/19/2019: R/D BOP test tools; M/U TDS and flush choke and kill lines. Jet BOPs and HST. TOH and L/D Clean Well assembly. Set bore protector. Check torque on BOP flange bolts and RBC. RIH with RTTS retrieval tool. Latch RTTS. Pump 50 bbls Hi-vis sweep (86 vis) and circulate out at 8 bpm.

05/20/2019: TOH and L/D RTTS. TOH with 5-7/8" tailpipe. Pull bore protector and jet HST profile. R/U to run upper completion.

05/21/2019: R/U tubing handling equipment. M/U mule shoe; CIM; and install control line. P/U ported sub and DHPTG. RIH with same on 3-1/2" tubing to 2;717'.

05/22/2019: RIH to 3;716'. Stage MLE spooler to rig floor. P/U and install lower; middle and upper motor assemblies; vacuum filling each assembly at rotary.

05/23/2019: Finish vacuum filling and installing upper motor assembly on lower ESP. Install tandem seal assembly with pothead and pumps on lower ESP. P/U lower bypass tubing and lower motor for upper ESP.

05/24/2019: Install and test WellLift HP gauge line. Install upper ESP assembly. P/U packer and measure MLE cables for packer penetrators.

05/25/2019: Feed MLE cables through adjustable adapters. Make up packer penetrators and test same. R/U and splice TEC and CI lines and test same. R/D Weatherford tripmaster and RIH with one stand 5 1/2" from derrick.
"},{"   ":209,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-05-26","TEXT_REMARK":"05/26/2019: TIH with ESP assembly on 5-1/2" tubing from derrick; installing clamps as needed to 8;332'.

05/27/2019: Running in hole with ESP assembly on 5-1/2" tubing to 12;144'; pick up timed pup and Schlumberger SCSSV.

05/28/2019: Function test SCSSV through A and B ports; test same to 8;500 psi for 15 minutes. Install CI line with FMJ connections and test to 10;000 psi. Continue RIH; picking up tubing from 12;190' to 15;409'.

05/29/2019: Continue RIH; picking up tubing from 15;409' to 20;210'.

05/30/2019: Rigged down Weatherford Vario elevators and rigged up 6-5/8" handling equipment; pick up tubing hanger and sting into isolation packer. Installed RMS MLE splices and tested same; made up MLE penetrators to hanger.

05/31/2019: Installed MLE and SCSSV penetrators/ control lines in tubing hanger and tested same. RIH and land out hanger in wellhead. Lock tubing hanger in wellhead and perform 50k-lb overpull test to confirm latch.

06/01/2019: Rig up slickline BOP and lubricator with isolation retrieval tool in same; test lubricator to 7;000 psi for 15 minutes. Pressure test hanger seals and install ESP flanged outlets on wellhead.

"},{"   ":210,"WELL_NAME":" A004","API12":608124006001,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-06-02","TEXT_REMARK":"06/02/2019: Complete electrical checks on ESP penetrators; pressure test to 7;500 psi; install surface caps on same. Bleed down SCSSV ports A and B to zero; make up penetrator adapters and test to 7;500 psi. Install CI penetrators and pressure test to 7;500 psi. Reverse circulate 850 bbls inhibited packer fluid into tubing x casing annulus.

06/03/2019: Set bore protector on slickline. Run in hole with 3.25" gauge ring to 16;086'; pull out of hole with gauge ring and RIH with 3.125" RPT plug. Set RPT plug in landing profile at 16;086'. POOH and test tubing against RPT plug to 1;000 psi. Close SCSSV; maintaining 1;000 psi; and perform inflow test on same. Equalize pressure across SCSSV and open same. Pressure up down tubing; against RPT plug to set packer with 5;500 psi. RIH and pull RPT plug to surface. Pull bore protector and set temporary crown plug.

06/04/2019: Install and test night cap to 7;000 psi. Test temporary crown plug to 6;500 psi. R/D slickline and pull TH running tool. R/D upper completion equipment from rig floor.

06/05/2019: N/D flow line; bell nipple; slip joint; knife gate valve. Bleed accumulator to 0 psi. Remove BOP control lines. N/D BOPs and spool joint.

06/06/2019: Install upper work platform. Disconnect SCSSV control lines and install 1/4" speed-bite plugs. Pressure test A&B SCSSV lines to 8;500 psi. Install TEC line through wellhead outlet. Perform pressure test to 10;000 psi on TEC lines. Install threaded TH lower lock ring. Install TH neck seal; upper lock ring and DX 1 gasket. Pressure test neck seal and gate valve to 10;000 psi. N/U lubricator assembly to HST. M/U 3.0" GS running tool and slickline lubricator.

06/07/2019: Test lubricator to 7;000 psi. Retrieve temporary crown plug. Test lubricator quick test sub to 7;000 psi. Open SCSSV and cycle open FS-2 valve. Bullhead 342 bbls base oil. Close and perform successful inflow test on SCSSV. Set crown plug on slickline and test same to 6;500 psi. Close and test crown valve to 6;500 psi. R/D slickline/lubricator and equipment. Install cap flange on crown valve. Install tree flange on AAV. Handover A4 well to Operations.

06/08/2019: R/D surface lines from cement manifold to AAV. Perform Derrick inspection. R/U fox holes. Prepare and function test VDM for pipe lay down. Lay down 5-7/8" DP out of derrick.

Note: On 06/08/2019 at 12:01 hours; Rory Chalmers (Chevron) received email approval from Bill Sanders (BSEE) to perform drill pipe lay down operations using the PRS; VDM; fox holes; while flowing the A4 well.
"}]
